row.title: Cervical Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on cervical cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Gallbladder Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Cancer that arises in the gallbladder is uncommon. Almost all gallbladder cancers are adenocarcinomas. The most common symptoms caused by gallbladder cancer are jaundice, pain, and fever. Find evidence-based information on gallbladder cancer treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about gallbladder cancer.

row.title: Head and Neck Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on head and neck cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Kidney (Renal Cell) Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Kidney cancer has three main types. Renal cell cancer, or renal cell adenocarcinoma, forms in the tubules of the kidney. Transitional cell carcinoma forms in the renal pelvis and ureter. Wilms tumors are common in children. Find evidence-based information on kidney cancer treatment, research, genetics, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Kidney Cancer.

row.title: Adjuvant Chemotherapy Modestly Improves Survival in Some Men with Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Adjuvant Chemotherapy Improves Prostate Cancer Survival
row.field_page_description: Giving some men with prostate cancer chemotherapy after standard treatment with radiation and hormone therapy modestly improves how long they live, according to results from a new NCI-funded clinical trial.
row.field_feature_card_description: Adjuvant chemotherapy improved survival in some men with prostate cancer.

row.title: Funding for Research Areas
row.field_page_description: See how appropriated funds are spent for frequently requested areas of cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: See funding amounts for frequently requested areas of cancer research.
row.field_list_description: See dollar amounts for various disease areas ranging from AIDS to Uterine Cancer.

row.title: In Mice, New Drug Conjugate Suggests Promise for Hard-to-Treat Pediatric Cancers
row.field_short_title: New Drug Conjugate Suggests Promise against Sarcoma
row.field_page_description: Findings from a study in mice suggests that a new type of drug conjugate may have potential as a treatment for two cancers that are often diagnosed in children.
row.field_feature_card_description: In mice, a new type of drug conjugate shows potential against cancers often diagnosed in children.

row.title: NCI Launches Competition to Spur Research on Breast Cancer Genomics, Disease Risk
row.field_short_title: Competition Spurs Research on Breast Cancer Genomics and Risk
row.field_page_description: Last month, NCI launched a competition to spur research in an area of great public health interest: the genomic basis of breast cancer and breast cancer risk.
row.field_feature_card_description: Participants can earn up to $50,000 in prizes for their research findings.

row.title: Cancer Currents Now Available in Spanish
row.field_short_title: Cancer Currents Now Available in Spanish
row.field_page_description: As part of our effort to more effectively reach patients, health care providers, and researchers with timely, authoritative, and scientifically accurate cancer information, we are now offering selected Cancer Currents blog posts in Spanish.
row.field_feature_card_description: Translated selections from the Cancer Currents blog about cancer research news, NCI programs, and more.

row.title: Denosumab Effective for Multiple Myeloma and Solid Tumors
row.field_short_title: Denosumab Effective for Multiple Myeloma and Solid Tumors
row.field_page_description: Results from a randomized phase III trial of denosumab to prevent skeletal related events in several types of cancer were published online February 22, 2011, in the Journal of Clinical Oncology (JCO).
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from a randomized phase III trial of denosumab to prevent skeletal related events in several types of cancer were published online February 22, 2011, in the Journal of Clinical Oncology (JCO).

row.title: Drugs Approved for Neuroblastoma
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for neuroblastoma. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: History of the NCI Cancer Centers Program
row.field_short_title: History of the NCI Cancer Centers Program
row.field_page_description: A timeline of the development of NCI’s cancer centers program over the last 100 years.
row.field_feature_card_description: A timeline of the development of NCI’s cancer centers program over the last 100 years.

row.title: e-ASIA Joint Research Program
row.field_page_description: e-ASIA Joint Research Program
row.field_feature_card_description: e-ASIA Joint Research Program

row.title: Stem Cell Transplants in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Stem cell transplants are procedures that restore blood-forming stem cells in cancer patients who have had theirs destroyed by very high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Learn about the types of transplants and side effects that may occur.
row.field_feature_card_description: Stem cell transplants are procedures that restore blood-forming stem cells in cancer patients who have had theirs destroyed by very high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Learn about the types of transplants and side effects that may occur.
row.field_list_description: Stem cell transplants are procedures that restore blood-forming stem cells in cancer patients who have had theirs destroyed by very high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Learn about the types of transplants, side effects that may occur, and how stem cell transplants are used in cancer treatment.

row.title: Cancer Health Disparities Research
row.field_page_description: NCI is addressing cancer health disparities through its efforts in basic research, community-level programs, and more.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is working to understand and address cancer health disparities, such as the higher cancer death rates, less frequent use of proven screening tests, and higher rates of advanced cancer diagnoses among certain populations as compared with others.
row.field_list_description: NCI is working to understand and address cancer health disparities, such as the higher cancer death rates, less frequent use of proven screening tests, and higher rates of advanced cancer diagnoses among certain populations as compared with others.

row.title: Cancer Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: Investigating the genetic foundations of cancer has improved our understanding of cancer biology and led to better prevention, diagnosis and treatment methods.
row.field_feature_card_description: Understanding the genetic foundations of cancer leads to new methods of diagnosing and treating the disease.
row.field_list_description: Investigating the genetic foundations of cancer has improved our understanding of cancer biology and led to new methods of diagnosing and treating the disease.

row.title: Global Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: NCI is confronting the global burden of cancer through many programs and international partnerships.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is committed to supporting international programs and partnerships that drive progress against cancer worldwide.
row.field_list_description: NCI is confronting the global burden of cancer by creating sustainable international partnerships, supporting programs that address global gaps in research and scientific training, and disseminating information and best practices that drive improvements in cancer research and cancer control.

row.title: Spotlight on Scientists
row.field_page_description: Written profiles highlighting the work of NCI and NCI-funded researchers, clinicians, and others who contribute to cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Written profiles highlighting the work of NCI and NCI-funded researchers, clinicians, and others who contribute to cancer research.

row.title: Funding Strategy
row.field_page_description: NCI formulates funding guidelines based on expected allocations, program requirements, and funding history. Learn how NCI funding decisions are made.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI funding strategy aims to fund the most promising scientific opportunities.
row.field_list_description: To fund the most promising scientific opportunities, NCI formulates guidelines based on expected allocations of funds, program requirements, and prior history.

row.title: Contracts and Small Business
row.field_page_description: Information about the types of contract mechanisms used by NCI to procure cancer research products and services.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about the types of contract mechanisms used by NCI to procure cancer research products and services.

row.title: Bone Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: There are several types of bone cancer. Osteosarcoma usually starts in osteoblasts, a type of bone cell that becomes new bone tissue. Ewing sarcoma arises from a primordial bone marrow–derived mesenchymal stem cell. Find evidence-based information on bone cancer including treatment, research, genetics, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about bone cancer.

row.title: Breast Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: The most common type of breast cancer is ductal carcinoma, which begins in the cells of the ducts. Breast cancer can also begin in the cells of a lobule and in other tissues of the breast. Find evidence-based information on breast cancer treatment, causes and prevention, genetics, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about breast cancer.

row.title: Esophageal Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: The incidence of esophageal cancer has risen in recent decades, coinciding with a shift in histologic type and primary tumor location. Find evidence-based information on esophageal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about esophageal cancer.

row.title: Liver and Bile Duct Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Liver cancer includes two major types: hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and intrahepatic bile duct cancer, also known as cholangiocarcinoma. Find evidence-based information on liver and bile duct cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genomics and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about liver and bile duct cancer.

row.title: Lung Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on lung cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Plasma Cell Neoplasms (Including Multiple Myeloma) Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on plasma cell neoplasms (including multiple myeloma), which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_short_title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer
row.field_page_description: Ovarian epithelial, fallopian tube, and peritoneal cancers are diseases in which malignant cells form in the tissue covering the ovary, lining the fallopian tube, or peritoneum. Find evidence-based information on ovarian cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer.

row.title: Gastrointestinal Carcinoid Tumors—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Gastrointestinal carcinoid tumors are rare, slow-growing tumors that originate in the neuroendocrine cells in the GI tract. Find evidence-based information on gastrointestinal carcinoid tumors treatment and research.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Gastrointestinal Carcinoid.

row.title: Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Pituitary Tumors—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Pituitary tumors represent from 10% to 25% of all intracranial neoplasms. Pituitary tumors can be classified into three groups: benign adenoma, invasive adenoma, and carcinoma. Find evidence-based information on pituitary tumors treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Pituitary Tumor.

row.title: PDQ® Supportive and Palliative Care Editorial Board
row.field_page_description: Experts in the fields of pain and palliative care, psychology, medical oncology, and pediatric oncology.

row.title: How To Handle Withdrawal Symptoms and Triggers When You Decide To Quit Smoking
row.field_short_title: Handling Withdrawal Symptoms & Triggers When You Decide to Quit
row.field_page_description: This fact sheet provides helpful tips related to smoking cessation.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet that provides helpful tips related to smoking cessation.

row.title: Helicobacter pylori and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the relationship between H. pylori infection and gastric cancer, gastric mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma, and other cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet about the relationship between H. pylori infection and gastric cancer, gastric mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma, and other cancers.

row.title: Parathyroid Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Parathyroid tumors are usually benign (not cancer) and are called adenomas. Parathyroid cancer is very rare. Having certain inherited disorders can increase the risk of parathyroid cancer. Start here to find information on parathyroid cancer treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Parathyroid Cancer.

row.title: Cancer Training at NCI
row.field_page_description: Training, fellowships, and other professional education opportunities for students and scientists on the NIH/NCI campus in Maryland (intramural).
row.field_feature_card_description: Find training, fellowships, and other professional education opportunities for students and scientists on the NIH and NCI campuses in Maryland.

row.title: Resources for Health Professionals
row.field_page_description: Get the latest information about cancer with our PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries and find NCI-supported clinical trials. We also offer training information and tools as well as resources for public health program planners and cancer registrars.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find evidence-based information about cancer as well as risk assessment tools, training tools, and other resources.

row.title: Selenium and Vitamin E Cancer Prevention Trial (SELECT): Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Selenium and Vitamin E Cancer Prevention Trial (SELECT): Questions and Answers
row.field_page_description: Learn the results of the Selenium and Vitamin E Cancer Prevention Trial. SELECT was a clinical trial to see if one or both of these substances could help prevent prostate cancer when taken as dietary supplements.

row.title: Common Myths about Cancer and Cancer Health Disparities
row.field_short_title: Common Myths about Cancer and Cancer Health Disparities
row.field_page_description: To better understand cancer and cancer health disparities, CRCHD addresses five common misconceptions about cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: CRCHD addresses five common misconceptions about cancer.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Manuel L. Penichet, M.D., Ph.D. - Reprogramming the Immune System to Kill Cancer
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Manuel L. Penichet, M.D., Ph.D. - Reprogramming the Immune System to Kill Cancer
row.field_page_description: Dr. Manuel L. Penichet, former CURE K01 trainee and NCI R01 grantee, aims to genetically engineer antibodies that can be used to directly target and eliminate cancer cells and also stimulate the body’s immune system to fight and destroy cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Penichet aims to genetically engineer antibodies to fight cancer.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Marcia Cruz-Correa, M.D., Ph.D., Finds Link between Human Papillomavirus and Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Marcia Cruz-Correa, M.D., Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Dr. Marcia Cruz-Correa, a CRCHD grantee, and her team of researchers from the University of Puerto Rico discovered a link between human papillomavirus and colorectal cancer in tissue samples from a large cohort of colorectal cancer patients.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Cruz-Correa find link between human papillomavirus and colorectal cancer.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Community Health Educator Antoinette Ayers, Helps VA Residents Become More Proactive about Managing Their Health
row.field_page_description: Ms. Antoinette Ayers, NCI/CRCHD National Outreach Network community health educator, is making health services more accessible to the people of Petersburg, VA by bringing a health resource center to the city's historic public library.
row.field_feature_card_description: Ms. Ayers, NON CHE, brings health resource center to local public library.

row.title: CGH Celebrates Take Your Child To Work Day 2015
row.field_short_title: CGH Celebrates Take Your Child To Work Day 2015
row.field_page_description: Shady Grove celebrated Take Your Child To Work Day this year with a variety of activities and sessions aimed at inspiring school-aged children to explore career paths in science and public service. CGH hosted its inaugural Take Your Child To Work Day session: An Introduction to Global Health.

row.title: Hands-on Workshops Aim to Strengthen Tobacco Control Efforts in Indonesia
row.field_short_title: Hands-on Workshops Aim to Strengthen Tobacco Control Efforts in Indonesia
row.field_page_description: The Global Adult Tobacco Survey (GATS), conducted in 2011 by the Indonesian National Institute of Health Research and Development and the U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention, showed that more than 67% of men and almost 40% of boys aged 13-15 use tobacco.

row.title: Electrocautery Superior to Topical Treatments for Precancerous Anal Lesions
row.field_page_description: Results from a randomized clinical trial conducted in Amsterdam suggest that electrocautery is better than topical imiquimod or fluorouracil at treating potentially precancerous anal lesions in HIV-positive men who have sex with men.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from a randomized clinical trial conducted in Amsterdam suggest that electrocautery is better than topical imiquimod or fluorouracil at treating potentially precancerous anal lesions in HIV-positive men who have sex with men.

row.title: Lymphoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Lymphoma refers to cancers that form in the lymphatic system, including Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, AIDS-related lymphoma, and primary CNS lymphoma. Find evidence-based information on lymphoma treatment, research, genomics, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about lymphoma.

row.title: Lymphoma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on lymphoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Cryosurgery in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes cryosurgery, the technique of using extreme cold to treat tumors. Lists the indications, risks, benefits, and side effects of cryotherapy.

row.title: Formaldehyde and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that discusses formaldehyde and its possible association with cancer. Includes resources for more information.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet that discusses formaldehyde and its possible association with cancer.

row.title: NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory: Search Results
row.field_short_title: NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory: Search Results

row.title: Paying for Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Learn about the different types of costs related to taking part in a clinical trial, who is expected to pay for which costs, and tips for working with insurance companies.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the different types of costs related to taking part in a clinical trial, who is expected to pay for which costs, and tips for working with insurance companies.

row.title: Refining Post-Surgical Therapy for Women with Lymph Node-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Refining Post-Surgical Therapy for Women with Lymph Node-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, women with HER2-negative, HR-positive breast cancer and 1-3 positive lymph nodes with recurrence scores of 25 or lower will be randomized to undergo adjuvant chemotherapy before starting endocrine therapy or to begin endocrine therapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this trial, women with HER2-negative, HR-positive breast cancer and 1-3 positive lymph nodes with recurrence scores of 25 or lower will be randomized to undergo adjuvant chemotherapy before starting endocrine therapy or to begin endocrine therapy.
row.field_list_description: In this phase III trial, women with HER2-negative, HR-positive breast cancer and 1-3 positive lymph nodes with recurrence scores of 25 or lower will be randomly assigned either to undergo adjuvant chemotherapy before starting endocrine therapy or to begin endocrine therapy without chemotherapy.

row.title: Comment Policy
row.field_page_description: Learn the policy about how comments are managed on National Cancer Institute websites.

row.title: FDA Approves Panobinostat for Some Patients with Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Panobinostat for Some Patients with Multiple Myeloma
row.field_page_description: The FDA granted accelerated approval of panobinostat for the treatment of multiple myeloma that has progressed after at least two prior standard therapies.

row.title: National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN) Steering Committees
row.field_page_description: The National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN) Steering Committees review concepts, or proposals, for large phase 2 or phase 3 treatment or imaging trials conducted in the NCTN.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCTN Steering Committees review concepts for large phase 2 or phase 3 treatment or imaging trials conducted in the NCTN.
row.field_list_description: The National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN) Steering Committees review concepts for large phase 2 or phase 3 treatment or imaging trials conducted in the NCTN. A concept is a proposal describing the key design elements of the study.

row.title: FDA Alters Approved Use of Two Checkpoint Inhibitors for Bladder Cancer
row.field_short_title: Checkpoint Inhibitor Use Changed for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has altered the approved uses of pembrolizumab (Keytruda) and atezolizumab (Tecentriq) to treat the most common form of bladder cancer. The change is based on whether patients’ tumors have a specific biomarker.
row.field_feature_card_description: For some patients, tumors must have specific biomarker.
row.field_list_description: FDA has changed the approved uses of the immunotherapy drugs pembrolizumab (Keytruda) and atezolizumab (Tecentriq) to treat the most common form of bladder cancer. The change is based on whether patients’ tumors have a specific biomarker.

row.title: Developing Biomarkers for Immunotherapy: A Conversation with Drs. Magdalena Thurin and Helen Chen
row.field_page_description: Identifying biomarkers for cancer immunotherapy is the goal of a new NCI-supported research network. Such markers can help to identify patients most likely to benefit from immune-based treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: New NCI network is focused on identifying who will benefit from immune-based treatments.
row.field_list_description: NCI is supporting a new research network to develop biomarkers for cancer immunotherapy. In this interview, NCI’s Dr. Helen Chen and Magdalena Thurin explain the networks’ structure and its goals.

row.title: Develop Ways to Overcome Cancer’s Resistance to Therapy
row.field_page_description: Cancer cells can develop resistance to drugs that were previously effective. This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to increase understanding of how this resistance develops, and to use biomarkers to predict who will develop it, and ways to counteract it to improve patient care and survival.
row.field_feature_card_description: This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to improve our understanding of drug resistance in cancer and how to overcome it.
row.field_list_description: Identify therapeutic targets to overcome drug resistance through studies that determine the mechanisms that lead cancer cells to become resistant to previously effective treatments.

row.title: More Chemotherapy May Help after Initial Treatment for Childhood Leukemia Fails
row.field_short_title: More Chemotherapy May Help after Initial Treatment for Childhood Leukemia Fails
row.field_page_description: A study suggests that at least some children diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia who respond poorly to initial chemotherapy may do better if they receive additional chemotherapy rather than a stem cell transplant.
row.field_feature_card_description: A study suggests that at least some children diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia who respond poorly to initial chemotherapy may do better if they receive additional chemotherapy rather than a stem cell transplant.

row.title: About CCCT
row.field_page_description: An overview of how the Coordinating Center for Clinical Trials supports NCI's clinical trials and translational research enterprises. Includes CCCT contact information.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn more about how CCCT supports NCI's clinical trials and translational research enterprises and how to contact us.
row.field_list_description: Learn more about how CCCT supports NCI's clinical trials and translational research enterprises and how to contact us.

row.title: Use of Placebos
row.field_page_description: Information about placebos and their role in cancer clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about placebos and their role in cancer clinical trials.

row.title: CGH and OCC Announce a New, Two-Year Funding Opportunity for NCI-designated Cancer Centers
row.field_short_title: CGH and OCC Announce a New, Two-Year Funding Opportunity for NCI-designated Cancer Centers
row.field_page_description: CGH and OCC announce a new funding opportunity available from CGH for cancer prevention and control (CPC) researchers at NCI-designated cancer centers: Administrative Supplements to Promote Cancer Prevention and Control Research in Low and Middle Income Countries.

row.title: Metastatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: Metastatic cancer is cancer that spreads from its site of origin to another part of the body. Learn how cancer spreads, possible symptoms, common sites where cancer spreads, and how to find out about treatment options.
row.field_feature_card_description: Understand how and where cancer spreads, possible symptoms, and how to find information about treatment.

row.title: Prostate Cancer Screening Results from the Prostate, Lung, Colorectal, and Ovarian Cancer Randomized Screening Trial: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Prostate Cancer Screening Results from PLCO
row.field_page_description: Learn the results of the Prostate, Lung, Colorectal, and Ovarian (PLCO) Cancer Screening Trial, a large-scale clinical trial to determine whether certain cancer screening tests can help reduce deaths from prostate, lung, colorectal, and ovarian cancer.

row.title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on ovarian, fallopian tube, and primary peritoneal cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Penile Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Penile cancer is most commonly squamous cell carcinoma. When diagnosed early, penile cancer is highly curable. Some studies suggest an association between human papillomavirus (HPV) infection and penile cancer. Find evidence-based information on penile cancer treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Penile Cancer.

row.title: Thyroid Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Thyroid cancer can be of four main types. Anaplastic thyroid cancer is hard to cure with current treatments, whereas papillary (the most common), follicular, and medullary thyroid cancer can usually be cured. Start here to find information on thyroid cancer treatment, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about thyroid cancer.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Prevention
row.field_page_description: Risk factors and methods to increase chances of preventing specific types of cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Can you lower your risk of getting cancer? Learn more from our evidence-based information summaries.

row.title: Find NCI-Supported Clinical Trials
row.field_feature_card_description: Find an NCI-supported clinical trial—and learn how to locate other research studies—that may be right for you or a loved one.

row.title: FDA Terminology
row.field_page_description: FDA works with NCI EVS to develop regulatory and other controlled terminology standards.
row.field_feature_card_description: FDA works with NCI EVS to develop regulatory and other controlled terminology in several areas. Some 15,000 terms are stored in NCIt.
row.field_list_description: U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) works with NCI EVS to develop regulatory and other controlled terminology in several areas. Some 15,000 terms are stored in NCI Thesaurus (NCIt).

row.title: Genitourinary Cancers Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Genitourinary Cancers Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials in genitourinary cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Genitourinary Cancers Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Genitourinary Cancers Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: After Lung Cancer Screening, Follow-Up Procedures May Be Riskier than Thought
row.field_short_title: Risks of Follow-Up Procedures after Lung Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: After lung cancer screening, complication rates from diagnostic procedures may be higher than indicated by results of the NLST trial, a new study suggests.
row.field_feature_card_description: Complication rates in everyday care may be higher than thought, study suggests.
row.field_list_description: In everyday medical care, there may be more complications from invasive diagnostic procedures performed after lung cancer screening than has been reported in large studies.

row.title: NCI Awardee Skills Development Consortium: Research Education Short Courses (UE5)
TCGA's Study of Thymoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of TCGA's study of thymic epithelial cancer (thymoma), including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Thymoma

row.title: TCGA's Study of Uterine Carcinosarcoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Uterine Carcinosarcoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Uterine Carcinosarcoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of uterine carcinosarcoma endometrial cancer, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: NCI/NIH Meeting Room
row.field_page_description: Researchers can arrange a meeting with their Program Directors ahead of AACR to discuss individual grants and learn about new research initiatives at NCI. See the NCI Resource Room hours.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers interested in meeting with their Program Directors should contact them ahead of AACR to arrange a time to meet at the NCI Resource Room. This space will be used for one-on-one consultations with NCI staff as well as small group meetings facili
row.field_list_description: Researchers interested in meeting with their Program Directors should contact them ahead of AACR to arrange a time to meet at the NCI/NIH Meeting Room. This space will be used for one-on-one consultations with NCI staff as well as small group meetings facilitated by the NCI.

row.title: Making Cancer Clinical Trials Available to More Patients
row.field_short_title: Making Cancer Clinical Trials Available to More Patients
row.field_page_description: NCI is expanding eligibility criteria for cancer clinical trials in the hope that more patients will join trials, leading to more rapid advances in cancer care.
row.field_feature_card_description: By expanding eligibility criteria, NCI hopes to speed advances in cancer care.
row.field_list_description: NCI is expanding eligibility criteria for its cancer clinical trials in the hope that more patients will join, leading to more rapid advances. The goal is to maximize the number of patients who are eligible to enroll while maintaining their safety.

row.title: Blog Posts by the NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless
row.field_short_title: Blog Posts by the NCI Director
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless writes posts regularly for NCI's Cancer Currents Blog that highlight his vision for NCI, meetings with and partnerships in the cancer community, and strategic and scientific initiatives to advance cancer research and care.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI Director Dr. Sharpless writes posts for NCI's Cancer Currents Blog.
row.field_list_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless writes posts for NCI's Cancer Currents Blog that highlight his vision for NCI, meetings with and partnerships in the cancer community, and strategic and scientific initiatives to advance cancer research and care.

row.title: Grant Resources
row.field_page_description: Resources to help with the NCI and NIH grants and funding process.
row.field_feature_card_description: Resources to help with the NCI and NIH grants and funding process.

row.title: Research Areas
row.field_page_description: Making sustained progress against cancer requires advances across the research continuum. Learn about the breadth of NCI's work and the programs the institute supports to advance cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the breadth of NCI's work and the programs the institute supports to advance cancer research.

row.title: Cancer Biology Research
row.field_page_description: The broad base of knowledge created by studying the differences between normal cells and cancer cells has been critical to progress against the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Studying the differences between normal cells and cancer cells is critical to progress against the disease.

row.title: Cancer Diagnosis Research
row.field_page_description: Accurate information derived from diagnostic tools is critical for making decisions at all stages of cancer care. NCI supports research on the development of tests and imaging technologies that can provide specific information about an individual’s cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI supports research on the development of tests and imaging technologies vital to progress against cancer.

row.title: Cancer Screening and Early Detection Research
row.field_short_title: Cancer Screening and Early Detection Research
row.field_page_description: Information about cancer screening and early detection research, including a summary of NCI programs dedicated to advancing screening and early detection.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI supports and directs research on screening and the early detection of cancer, including studies to develop and validate biological markers.
row.field_list_description: NCI supports and directs research on screening and the early detection of cancer, including studies to develop and validate biological markers.

row.title: Choices for Care When Treatment May Not Be an Option
row.field_page_description: Know your choices for cancer care when coping with advanced cancer. Learn about palliative care, hospice care, and trying a clinical trial.
row.field_feature_card_description: When cancer treatment is no longer working, you still have choices for your care. Learn about palliative care, hospice care, and clinical trials for advanced cancer.
row.field_list_description: When standard cancer treatment is no longer working, you still have choices for your care. Learn about palliative care, hospice care, and clinical trials for advanced cancer.

row.title: Coping with Your Feelings During Advanced Cancer
row.field_short_title: Coping with Your Feelings During Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: There are many difficult feelings that you can have when going through cancer. Having an advanced or metastatic cancer diagnosis can cause them to be more intense than ever. Know that you're not alone. Learn tips on how to cope with your feelings with an advanced cancer diagnosis.
row.field_feature_card_description: There are many intense feelings that you can have when going through cancer. Know that you're not alone. Learn tips on coping with your emotions during advanced cancer.

row.title: Alcohol
row.field_page_description: Brief information about cancer risk due to drinking alcohol.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Advanced Cancer
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: Suggested questions to ask your doctor, if you find out you have advanced cancer.

row.title: Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: The FNLCR combines private sector business practices with government infrastructure to conduct research and development in cancer and AIDS.
row.field_feature_card_description: The FNLCR provides cancer researchers a bridge between basic research and clinical practice.

row.title: Stimulating the Immune System Shrinks Some Slow-Growing Lymphomas
row.field_short_title: Stimulating Immune System Shrinks Some Lymphomas
row.field_page_description: Injecting SD-101 into a single tumor, plus radiation, in patients with indolent B-cell lymphoma shrank tumors elsewhere in the body, trial results show.
row.field_feature_card_description: Low-dose radiation and SD-101 shrank slow-growing B-cell lymphomas in small trial.
row.field_list_description: In a small trial involving patients with slow-growing B-cell lymphoma, injecting the compound SD-101 directly into tumors (in situ vaccination) and giving low-dose radiation shrank the injected tumors and, frequently, tumors elsewhere in the body.

row.title: Using Artificial Intelligence to Classify Lung Cancer Types, Predict Mutations
row.field_short_title: Using Artificial Intelligence to Classify Lung Cancer Types
row.field_page_description: Using artificial intelligence, cancer researchers have trained a computer program to read slides of tissue samples and accurately identify the two most common forms of lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The computer program can differentiate the two most common forms of lung cancer.
row.field_list_description: Cancer researchers have trained a computer program to scan images of tissue samples to differentiate normal lung tissue from the two most common forms of lung cancer. The program also learned to detect cancer-related genetic mutations in the samples.

row.title: Trial Results Highlight Changing Lung Cancer Treatment Landscape
row.field_short_title: Trials Highlight Changing Lung Cancer Treatment Landscape
row.field_page_description: The ALK inhibitor brigatinib (Alunbrig) and checkpoint inhibitor durvalumab (Imfinzi) can improve outcomes in patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer, results from two large clinical trials have affirmed.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results affirm benefit of targeted agent and immunotherapy drug.
row.field_list_description: Results from two large clinical trials should cement the value of the drugs brigatinib (Alunbrig) and durvalumab (Imfinzi) in treating non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). The trial results, several experts said, confirm that the drugs can improve the outcomes of patients with advanced NSCLC.

row.title: Immunotherapy Drug Cemiplimab Approved for Advanced Squamous Cell Skin Cancer
row.field_short_title: Cemiplimab Approved for Advanced Squamous Cell Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: The immunotherapy drug cemiplimab (Libtayo) has been approved by FDA for advanced cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma, a common type of skin cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The immunotherapy is the first agent to be approved by FDA for advanced SCC.
row.field_list_description: The Food and Drug Administration approved the immunotherapy drug cemiplimab (Libtayo) for an advanced form of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), a common type of skin cancer. It is the first agent to be approved specifically for advanced SCC.

row.title: Making the Case for Biomarkers in Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Making the Case for Biomarkers in Cancer Treatment-T.J. Sharpe
row.field_page_description: Read how melanoma survivor T.J. Sharpe’s experience on two clinical trials highlights the need for biomarkers to predict benefit from immunotherapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: T.J. Sharpe’s melanoma tumors shrank within weeks of starting treatment with a PD-1 checkpoint inhibitor.

row.title: ATAC-seq on TCGA: Insights Into the Noncoding Region in Primary Cancers
row.field_page_description: Using a chromatin accessibility assay to examine the noncoding genome in TCGA.
row.field_feature_card_description: The ATAC-seq chromatin accessibility assay provides insights into the puzzle of DNA regulatory elements and cancer.
row.field_list_description: Researchers used ATAC-seq to profile the chromatin accessibility of 410 TCGA samples representing 23 primary cancers. The study uncovered a vast number of novel DNA regulatory elements and their potential roles in cancer development, prognosis, and response to therapy.

row.title: Special Spotlight: 2014 AACR Conference: The Science of Cancer Health Disparities in Racial/Ethnic Minorities and the Medically Underserved
row.field_page_description: A focus of the 7thAACR annual conference was community engagement and how to attract and retain racial and ethnic populations. Three community health educators from CRCHD’s National Outreach Network program delivered presentations in this area.
row.field_feature_card_description: CHEs from CRCHD’s NON program presented at the 7th AACR annual conference.

row.title: Immunotherapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Immunotherapy is treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer. Get information about the different types of immunotherapy and what you can expect during treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Immunotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer.
row.field_list_description: Immunotherapy is a type of treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer. Get information about the types of immunotherapy and what you can expect during treatment.

row.title: Research on Causes of Cancer
row.field_page_description: Understanding the exposures and risk factors that cause cancer, as well as the genetic abnormalities associated with the disease, has helped us to reduce certain exposures and to ameliorate their harmful effects.
row.field_feature_card_description: Resesarch to understand the risk factors and mutations associated with cancer is vital to reducing cancer's harmful effects.

row.title: Planning for Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: Find out what issues need to be addressed when dealing with an advanced or metastatic cancer diagnosis. Completing advance directives, looking at health insurance, organizing records and documents, and looking at the meanings in your life are some of the things to think about.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn what issues to plan for with an advanced cancer diagnosis

row.title: Smoking’s Disease Burden: Worse than Previously Thought?
row.field_short_title: Smoking’s Disease Burden: Worse than Previously Thought?
row.field_page_description: According to a new study, smoking may be responsible for far more deaths each year than previously thought.
row.field_feature_card_description: According to a new study, smoking may be responsible for far more deaths each year than previously thought.

row.title: Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer
row.field_page_description: The Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer is an update of rates for new cases, deaths, and trends for the most common cancers in the United States.
row.field_feature_card_description: Report provides an annual update of cancer incidence and mortality rates and trends in the United States.

row.title: Resources
row.field_page_description: Find standardized case reporting forms (CRFs) and standard terms of agreement for research trial (START) clauses.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find standardized case reporting forms (CRFs) and standard terms of agreement for research trial (START) clauses.

row.title: Cancer Care Delivery Research Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Care Delivery Research (CCDR) Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes cancer care delivery research study concepts for trials conducted through NCORP.
row.field_feature_card_description: The CCDR Steering Committee evaluates cancer care delivery concepts for trials conducted through NCORP.
row.field_list_description: The Cancer Care Delivery Research (CCDR) Steering Committee evaluates cancer care delivery research study concepts for trials conducted through NCORP.

row.title: Grants Management Contacts
row.field_page_description: Contact a grants management specialist assigned to your institution.
row.field_feature_card_description: FY2019 INSTITUTION ASSIGNMENTS

row.title: Childhood Cancers Research
row.field_page_description: Learn about NCI-supported research efforts to address pediatric cancers, from basic science to clinical research on new treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the range of research that NCI supports to address pediatric cancers, from basic science to clinical research.
row.field_list_description: Learn about the range of research that NCI supports to address pediatric cancers, from basic science to clinical research on new treatments, all aimed at providing the best care for childhood cancer patients and survivors.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Joseph Kofi Agyin, PhD, MBA - Exploring Bone-Targeted Proteasome Inhibitors to Cure Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Joseph Kofi Agyin, PhD, MBA
row.field_page_description: Dr. Joseph Kofi Agyin, a CRCHD R21 Grantee, is studying the design and synthesis of bone-targeted proteasome inhibitors for treating multiple myeloma.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Agyin studies bone-targeted proteasome inhibitors to treating multiple myeloma.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Dana-Lynn Koomoa-Lange, Ph.D.- Exploring Chemical Pathways to Hinder Development of Neuroblastoma
row.field_page_description: Dr. Dana-Lynn Koomoa-Lange, a CRCHD K01 grantee, is exploring signaling pathways in the progression of neuroblastoma, a nervous system cancer, in an effort to develop new drugs to thwart the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Koomoa-Lange researches signaling pathways of neuroblastoma progression.

row.title: NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) - Cancer Control Steering Committees
row.field_page_description: Information about Cancer Care Delivery Research (CCDR) and Symptom Management and Health-Related Quality of Life (SxQOL) Steering Committees, including membership, clinical trial planning meetings, publications and approved trials conducted through NCORP.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCORP Steering Committees review concepts for clinical trials to control cancer symptoms and cancer treatment side effects, concepts for studies of cancer care delivery, and cancer prevention, screening, and surveillance concepts.
row.field_list_description: The NCORP Steering Committees review concepts for clinical trials to control cancer symptoms and cancer treatment side effects, concepts for studies of cancer care delivery, and cancer prevention, screening, and surveillance concepts.

row.title: NCI Advisory Boards, Committees, and Review Groups
row.field_page_description: NCI relies on advisory committees to provide objective and expert advice on coordination of the National Cancer Program, NCI scientific priorities, and more.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI relies on advisory committees to provide advice on the National Cancer Program, NCI scientific priorities, and more.

row.title: TCGA Research Network Publications
row.field_page_description: An up-to-date list of publications by The Cancer Genome Atlas, including analyses performed after the original cancer type-specific studies were completed.

row.title: From Ignoring Features to Machine Learning Features: Computational Biology Then and Now
row.field_page_description: How various aspects of the computational biology field has changed over the years
row.field_feature_card_description: Computational Biology Then & Now
row.field_list_description: Dr. John Weinstein discusses progress in computational biology over the 12-year span of TCGA. The field has expanded greatly, with researchers taking on more complex problems and trying different approaches.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Breast Ductal Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Breast Ductal Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Breast Ductal Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Breast Ductal Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of breast ductal carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Step 1: Application Development & Submission
row.field_page_description: There are nine research grant application types, each with specific procedures. Learn more about developing, submitting, and tracking a cancer research grant application.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about specific procedures and required documentation for grant applications.
row.field_list_description: There are nine research grant application types, each with specific procedures and required documentation. Learn more about developing, submitting, and tracking a grant application.

row.title: Step 2: Application Receipt & Assignment
row.field_page_description: Information on the assignment numbers the Center for Scientific Review (CSR) creates once an application is submitted and other submission policies.
row.field_feature_card_description: After you develop and submit your application, the Center for Scientific Review (CSR) will assign your application to an Institute or Center (IC) at NIH based on the focus and mission of the IC.

row.title: Fatigue and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Fatigue is a common side effect of many cancer treatments such as chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, and surgery. Anemia and pain can also cause fatigue. Learn about symptoms and way to manage fatigue.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes cancer-related fatigue, a side effect of some cancer treatments. Symptoms and ways to manage fatigue during cancer treatment is also covered.

row.title: Center for Cancer Genomics Videos
row.field_page_description: Find video presentations, meeting addresses, and discussions about work by the NCI Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG).
row.field_list_description: Find video presentations, meeting addresses, and discussions about work by the NCI Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG). Watch scientific experts and Mr. Joe Biden speak about the importance of genomics.

row.title: Insights & Innovations Blog
row.field_page_description: Read interviews with investigators, updates from CCG's Director and others, CCG's latest news and announcements, and overviews of new influential papers in cancer genomics.
row.field_feature_card_description: Read interviews with investigators, updates from CCG's Director and others, CCG's latest news and announcements, and overviews of new influential papers in cancer genomics.

row.title: Sunlight
row.field_page_description: Exposure to UV radiation from the sun, sunlamps, and tanning booths causes early aging and skin damage that can lead to skin cancer. Find information, including tips, on how to protect your skin.
row.field_feature_card_description: Exposure to UV radiation from the sun, sunlamps, and tanning booths causes damage that can lead to skin cancer.
row.field_list_description: Exposure to UV radiation from the sun, sunlamps, and tanning booths causes damage that can lead to skin cancer.

row.title: Tobacco
row.field_page_description: Tobacco use is a leading cause of cancer and of death from cancer. Find resources on the harms of tobacco use and how to get help quitting.
row.field_feature_card_description: Tobacco use is a leading cause of cancer and of death from cancer.

row.title: Research Grants
row.field_page_description: NCI funds a range of cancer research activities through various mechanisms and pay lines. Find cancer research funding opportunities.
row.field_feature_card_description: Funding opportunities, contact information, and funding patterns.
row.field_list_description: Find information about funding opportunities, strategy behind decisions on competing and non-competing applications, contact information for program directors, and funding patterns for previous years.

row.title: FDA Grants Palbociclib Accelerated Approval for Advanced Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Grants Palbociclib Accelerated Approval for Advanced Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Palbociclib (Ibrance) is approved to be used in combination with letrozole (Femara) to treat postmenopausal women with metastatic breast cancer.

row.title: New from NCI: Resources, Tools, and News
row.field_short_title: New from NCI: Resources, Tools, and News
row.field_page_description: NCI is constantly publishing new information on its websites, so periodically we provide updates on new content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Global Health Diplomacy Begins at Home
row.field_short_title: Global Health Diplomacy Begins at Home
row.field_page_description: Global Health Diplomacy Begins at Home

row.title: Apply for a Grant
row.field_page_description: The NCI Grants Process provides an overview of the end-to-end lifecycle of grant funding. Learn about the types of funding available and the basics for application, review, award, and on-going administration within the NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: Understand the submission and review process and find resources to prepare your application.
row.field_list_description: The NCI Grants Process provides an overview of the end-to-end lifecycle of grant funding. Learn about the types of funding available and the basics for application, review, award, and on-going administration.

row.title: Treating High-grade Lesions to Prevent Anal Cancer in HIV-infected People
row.field_short_title: Treating High-grade Lesions to Prevent Anal Cancer in HIV-infected People
row.field_page_description: This study, called the ANCHOR trial, will investigate whether screening and prevention methods similar to those used to prevent cervical cancer can help prevent anal cancer in HIV-infected men and women.
row.field_feature_card_description: This study will investigate whether certain screening and prevention methods can help prevent anal cancer in HIV-infected men and women.

row.title: Treatment Helps Preserve Fertility for Some Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Treatment Helps Preserve Fertility for Some Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: In a large clinical trial, giving a hormone-suppressing drug helped some younger women with breast cancer get pregnant after completing cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a large clinical trial, giving a hormone-suppressing drug helped some younger women with breast cancer get pregnant after completing cancer treatment.

row.title: Grant Closeout
row.field_page_description: Requirements and reports to comply with grant closeout, including Final Federal Financial Report (FFR, SF425); Final Research Performance Progress Report (FRPPR); Interim Research Performance Progress Report (IRPPR); Final Invention Statement (FIS, HHS
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the administrative actions and requirements to comply with grants closeout.
row.field_list_description: Find requirements and reports to comply with grant closeout, including Final Federal Financial Report (FFR, SF425); Final Research Performance Progress Report (FRPPR); Interim Research Performance Progress Report (IRPPR); Final Invention Statement (FIS, HHS 568); and Termination Notice (PHS, 416-7).

row.title: Radiation
row.field_page_description: Radiation of certain wavelengths, called ionizing radiation, has enough energy to damage DNA and cause cancer. Ionizing radiation includes radon, x-rays, gamma rays, and other forms of high-energy radiation.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for skin cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Finasteride Reduces the Risk of Low-Grade Prostate Cancer in Men 55 and Older
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a phase III trial that tested whether the drug finasteride could help prevent prostate cancer in men age 55 and older.
row.field_feature_card_description: Long-term follow-up results from a phase III trial show that regular use of finasteride (Proscar®) for up to 7 years decreased the risk of low-grade prostate cancer in men age 55 and older compared with that in men who received a placebo. Although high-gr
row.field_list_description: Long-term follow-up results from a phase III trial show that regular use of finasteride (Proscar®) for up to 7 years decreased the risk of low-grade prostate cancer in men age 55 and older compared with that in men who received a placebo. Although high-grade cancers were more common in the finasteride group, the finasteride and placebo groups had similar 15-year overall survival rates.

row.title: Resources for You
row.field_page_description: Let us help you find information and resources that fit your needs as a patient, health professional, researcher, or other visitor.
row.field_feature_card_description: Let us help you find information and resources that fit your needs as a patient, health professional, researcher, or other visitor.
row.field_list_description: Find information and resources that fit your needs as a patient, caregiver, health professional, researcher, or other visitor.

row.title: Resources for Advocates and Policymakers
row.field_page_description: Information for advocates and policy makers about NCI's priorities and the progress that has been made against cancer, how the institute conducts research and manages its budget, how investing in cancer research benefits the nation, and the Congressional activities relevant to cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Understand NCI priorities and funding and find resources to help you work with NCI to advance cancer research and improve patient outcomes.

row.title: The Opioid Epidemic and Cancer Pain Management: A Conversation with Dr. Judith Paice
row.field_short_title: The Opioid Epidemic and Cancer Pain Management
row.field_page_description: The opioid epidemic is having a significant impact on cancer patients, says Dr. Judith Paice of Northwestern University. In this Cancer Currents post, she explains how oncologists can address concerns about opioid misuse when managing cancer pain.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Judith Paice discusses the epidemic’s impact on cancer patients.
row.field_list_description: Dr. Judith Paice, of the Cancer Pain Program at Northwestern University’s Feinberg School of Medicine, discusses the impacts of the opioid epidemic on cancer patients and how providers can address concerns about opioid misuse when managing cancer pain.

row.title: Intensify Research on the Major Drivers of Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: Fusion oncoproteins can lead to the development of childhood cancers. This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to improve our understanding of these proteins and develop inhibitors that target them.
row.field_feature_card_description: Fusion oncoproteins are a major driver of childhood cancers. This research effort will help to improve understanding of these proteins and develop targeted treatments.
row.field_list_description: Improve our understanding of fusion oncoproteins in pediatric cancer and use new preclinical models to develop inhibitors that target them.

row.title: Analyze Patient Data and Biospecimens from Past Clinical Trials to Predict Future Patient Outcomes
row.field_short_title: Mine Past Patient Data to Predict Future Patient Outcomes
row.field_page_description: Tumor samples and other biospecimens can be analyzed retrospectively to develop hypotheses about which tumor features can help predict clinical benefit. Ideally, this information can be used to improve treatment and outcomes for cancer patients.
row.field_feature_card_description: A Cancer Moonshot initiative created to retrospectively analyze patient tumor samples to improve patient outcomes.
row.field_list_description: Predict response to standard treatments through retrospective analysis of patient specimens.

row.title: Message from the Center for Global Health's Interim Director
row.field_short_title: Message from the Center for Global Health's Interim Director
row.field_page_description: Center for Global Health Interim Director, Dr. Robert Croyle, discusses CGH accomplishments and plans for the new leadership.
row.field_feature_card_description: CGH Interim Director, Dr. Croyle, discusses CGH accomplishments and plans for the new leadership.
row.field_list_description: Center for Global Interim Director, Dr. Robert Croyle, discusses CGH accomplishments and plans for the new leadership.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Cervical Cancer
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Cervical Cancer
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Cervical Cancer
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of cervical cancer, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Develop New Cancer Technologies
row.field_page_description: The development of cancer technologies to characterize tumors and test therapies can transform cancer research and clinical care.
row.field_feature_card_description: Advancing the development of technologies to characterize tumors and test therapies can increase the options available for clinical care patients.
row.field_list_description: Develop new enabling cancer technologies to characterize tumors and test therapies.

row.title: Expand Use of Proven Cancer Prevention and Early Detection Strategies
row.field_short_title: Expand Use of Prevention and Early Detection Strategies
row.field_page_description: This initiative aims to develop, test, and adopt proven cancer prevention and early detection approaches to reduce cancer risk and cancer health disparities in all populations.
row.field_feature_card_description: Development, implementation, and broad adoption of proven cancer prevention and detection approaches can reduce cancer risk in all populations.
row.field_list_description: Reduce cancer risk and cancer health disparities through the development, implementation, and broad adoption of proven cancer prevention and detection approaches.

row.title: Liquid Biopsy May Predict Risk of Breast Cancer Returning Years Later
row.field_short_title: Liquid Biopsy May Help Predict Breast Cancer Relapse
row.field_page_description: The presence of circulating tumor cells found with a liquid biopsy may identify women treated for breast cancer who may be at higher risk of their disease returning years later. The findings may have implications for treatment, as this Cancer Currents post explains.
row.field_feature_card_description: Test results could help determine which patients need additional treatment.
row.field_list_description: Using a liquid biopsy to test for tumor cells circulating in blood, researchers found that, in women with breast cancer, the presence of these cells could identify women at risk of their cancer returning years later.

row.title: Ribociclib Approval Expanded for Some Women with Advanced Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Ribociclib Approval Expanded for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has expanded the approval of ribociclib (Kisqali) for advanced breast cancer, including new uses in pre- and postmenopausal women. As this Cancer Currents post explains, it’s the first approval under a new FDA program to speed cancer drug reviews.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approval is the first under a new FDA program to speed drug reviews.
row.field_list_description: FDA has expanded the approved uses of ribociclib (Kisqali) for women with advanced breast cancer, including new uses in pre- and postmenopausal women. It’s the first approval under a new FDA program to speed the review of cancer drugs.

row.title: Finding Pediatric Cancer Genomic Data through PGDI
row.field_page_description: The Pediatric Genomic Data Inventory (PGDI) connects researchers with valuable pediatric cancer data.
row.field_feature_card_description: Finding Pediatric Data with PGDI
row.field_list_description: The Pediatric Genomic Data Inventory (PGDI), developed by the Office of Cancer Genomics (OCG), is a new public resource informing researchers how and where to access globally generated pediatric cancer genomic datasets. Connecting researchers with data and fostering collaborations is key to furthering our understanding of childhood cancers.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of ovarian serous adenocarcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Study Identifies New Opportunities for Targeted Immunotherapy
row.field_short_title: Study Identifies New Opportunities for Targeted Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: A team of NCI researchers has reported that several types of gastrointestinal cancer have tumor-specific mutations that can be recognized by the immune system, thereby offering a new therapeutic opportunity for patients with these tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI researchers have shown that several gastrointestinal cancers have tumor-specific genetic mutations that can be recognized by the immune system.

row.title: Precision Medicine in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Precision medicine helps doctors select cancer treatments that are most likely to help patients based on a genetic understanding of their disease. Learn about the promise of precision medicine and the role it plays in cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Precision medicine helps doctors select cancer treatments that are most likely to help patients based on a genetic understanding of their disease. Learn about the promise of precision medicine and the role it plays in cancer treatment.
row.field_list_description: Precision medicine helps doctors select treatments that are most likely to help patients based on a genetic understanding of their disease. Learn about the role precision medicine plays in cancer treatment, including how genetic changes in a person's cancer are identified and used to select treatments.

row.title: Low Income Is a Barrier to Clinical Trial Enrollment, Study Suggests
row.field_short_title: Low Income Is a Barrier to Clinical Trial Enrollment, Study Suggests
row.field_page_description: A new study has found that patients with annual household incomes below $50,000 were less likely to participate in a cancer clinical trial than those with higher incomes.
row.field_feature_card_description: A new study has found that patients with lowest incomes are least likely to enroll.

row.title: Current Congress
row.field_page_description: Find legislation introduced in the 116th Congress that is relevant to the NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find legislation introduced in the 116th Congress that is relevant to the NCI.

row.title: Recent Public Laws
row.field_page_description: Read about legislation related to the mission of NCI that has been signed into law in recent years.
row.field_feature_card_description: Read about legislation related to the mission of NCI that has been signed into law in recent years.

row.title: OGCR Staff
row.field_page_description: Find OGCR staff contact information for questions on current or past legislative activities that relate to the mission of NCI.

row.title: Lung Cancer Precision Medicine Trials: Adapting to Progress
row.field_page_description: Patients with lung cancer are benefiting from the boom in targeted and immune-based therapies. With a series of precision medicine trials, NCI is keeping pace with the rapidly changing treatment landscape for lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients with lung cancer are benefiting from the boom in our understanding of the molecular drivers of tumors.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Thyroid Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for thyroid cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names.

row.title: Education and Training for Health Professionals
row.field_short_title: Education and Training for Health Professionals
row.field_page_description: A collection of cancer education and training tools from NCI and NIH for health care providers, public health program planners, and cancer registrars. Courses are available in a variety of formats.
row.field_list_description: The Cancer Classroom Series is a collection of webinars that highlights topics that provide the educational content, tools, and resources necessary for health professionals, especially those working in public health, to address cancer as a public health problem.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Harold "Bo" Netwon Lovvorn, III, M.D. - Molecular Analysis of Ethnic Variations in Wilms tumor
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Dr. Harold "Bow" Netwon Lovvorn
row.field_page_description: Lovvorn's research focuses particularly on Wilms Tumor (WT), also known as nephroblastoma, which forms in the kidneys and often metastasizes to the lung, and sometimes to the liver.
row.field_feature_card_description: Lovvorn's research focuses particularly on Wilms Tumor (WT), also known as nephroblastoma, which forms in the kidneys and often metastasizes to the lung, and sometimes to the liver.

row.title: Community Networks Program Centers (CNPC)
Rituximab Retreatment after Disease Progression Is Comparable to Rituximab Maintenance Therapy in Patients with Low-Tumor Burden Follicular Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: Rituximab Retreatment for Low-Tumor Burden Follicular Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a randomized clinical trial of patients with low–tumor burden follicular lymphoma that compared maintenance therapy with rituximab versus retreatment with rituximab only when there was evidence of disease progression.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a randomized clinical trial, patients with low–tumor burden follicular lymphoma who responded to initial treatment with rituximab experienced similar disease control whether they received rituximab maintenance therapy or were retreated with rituximab.
row.field_list_description: In a randomized clinical trial, patients with low–tumor burden follicular lymphoma whose cancer responded to initial treatment with rituximab (Rituxan®) experienced similar disease control regardless of whether they subsequently received maintenance therapy with rituximab or were retreated with rituximab only when there was evidence of disease progression.

row.title: Caring for the Caregiver
row.field_page_description: A condensed version of “When Someone You Love Is Being Treated for Cancer,” it covers practical, coping, and communication tips for friends and family members caring for loved ones with cancer.

row.title: The Mexican President, NCI’s Dr. Varmus, and Cancer Control in Mexico
row.field_short_title: The Mexican President, NCI’s Dr. Varmus, and Cancer Control in Mexico
row.field_page_description: The Mexican President, NCI’s Dr. Varmus, and Cancer Control in Mexico
row.field_feature_card_description: The Mexican President, NCI’s Dr. Varmus, and Cancer Control in Mexico

row.title: What are rare vascular tumors?
row.field_page_description: Rare vascular tumors form in cells that make blood or lymph vessels, and can occur anywhere in the body, such as the skin, in the tissues below the skin, or in an organ. There are specific tumors that affect children, teens, and young adults.
row.field_list_description: Rare vascular tumors form in cells that make blood or lymph vessels. They can occur anywhere in the body, such as the skin, in the tissues below the skin, or in an organ.

row.title: Curbing Production of Immune Checkpoint Protein Slows Liver Cancer in Mice
row.field_short_title: Blocking Cancer’s Production of an Immune Checkpoint Protein
row.field_page_description: Production of PD-L1, an immune checkpoint protein, can be blocked in mice with liver cancer by an investigational drug called eFT508, a new study shows.
row.field_feature_card_description: An experimental drug disrupts production of an immune checkpoint protein.
row.field_list_description: Researchers have found an unconventional way to unleash the immune system against liver cancer in mice. The researchers used an investigational drug to curb the production of a checkpoint inhibitor protein that shields tumors from the immune system.

row.title: FNLCR Acquisitions FedBizOpps Notices
row.field_page_description: Browse the list of FedBizOpps Notices regarding the FNLCR prime contractor competitive acquisition process.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Prostate Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Prostate Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Prostate Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of prostate carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Adult Soft Tissue Sarcoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of TCGA's study of adult soft tissue sarcoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Adult Soft Tissue Sarcoma

row.title: TCGA'S Study of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA'S Study of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA'S Study of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA'S Study of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of papillary thyroid carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: MyPART Search Results
Drugs Approved for Different Types of Cancer
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Different Types of Cancer
row.field_page_description: Find drugs approved by the FDA for specific types of cancer.
row.field_list_description: This page lists and links to NCI's pages of drugs approved for specific types of cancer.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Penile Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for penile cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI’s Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Palbociclib Improves Survival in Women with Hormone Receptor-Positive Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: An interim analysis of the PALOMA3 trial shows that women with hormone receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer who received palbociclib plus fulvestrant had longer progression-free survival rates than women who received a placebo plus fulvestrant.
row.field_feature_card_description: Palbociclib plus fulvestrant extends the progression-free survival of some women with hormone receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer.
row.field_list_description: An interim analysis of the PALOMA3 trial shows that palbociclib plus fulvestrant extends the progression-free survival of some women with hormone receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer.

row.title: Cancer Risk in Childhood Cancer Survivors Continues for Decades
row.field_short_title: Cancer Risk for Childhood Cancer Survivors
row.field_page_description: Survivors of childhood cancer have an elevated risk of developing second, distinct cancers into their forties and beyond, according to a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Survivors of childhood cancer face decades of elevated risk for second cancers.

row.title: Overdiagnosis of Cancer: Bringing an Important Problem into Focus
row.field_page_description: Experts are convening for a conference on the dilemmas posed by overdiagnosis in many types of diseases. Overdiagnosis is generally defined as the diagnosis of a disease or condition that is unlikely to ever cause harm.
