Through an open-access web interface, users can view validated data and results assembled from multiple projects or CTD<sup>2</sup> Centers.

row.title: Drug Combination Improves Outlook for Some Patients with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: New Drug Combination Shows Promise for CLL
row.field_page_description: Venetoclax (Venclexta) and rituximab (Rituxan) substantially improved progression-free survival in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) compared with chemotherapy, MURANO trial shows.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment with venetoclax plus rituximab may better prevent cancer progression.
row.field_list_description: Interim results from an ongoing clinical trial show that patients with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia treated with rituximab plus venetoclax have longer progression-free survival compared with patients treated with chemotherapy.

row.title: The Challenging Landscape of Cancer and Aging: Charting a Way Forward
row.field_short_title: The Challenging Landscape of Cancer and Aging
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless discusses research to bettter understand the biology of aging and its relationship to cancer, as well as participation in cancer clinical trials by older patients.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless discusses research on the intersection of aging and cancer.
row.field_list_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless discusses research on aging and cancer, including understanding the biology of aging and its relationship to cancer, the treatment of older patients, and ensuring older patients participate in cancer clinical trials.

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Childhood Embryonal Tumors
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Childhood Embryonal Tumors

row.title: TEST - What's New in Pancreatic Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: TEST - What's New in Pancreatic Cancer Research

row.title: Don't Miss the Connection: The Role of RAF1 and ROKα in RAS-Driven Cancers
row.field_short_title: Cancer Caused by Mutant KRAS Requires RAF1 and ROKα
row.field_page_description: Cancer caused by a mutant KRAS gene is dependent on the presence RAF1. Kinase-independent interaction of RAF1 with ROKα accounts for this dependence.
row.field_feature_card_description: A new RAS Dialogue describes the essential role of RAF1 and ROKα in some cancers driven by mutant KRAS.
row.field_list_description: Cancer caused by a mutant KRAS gene is dependent on the presence of one of its downstream effectors, RAF1 (aka CRAF), but not on ARAF or BRAF. Kinase-independent interaction of RAF1 with ROKα accounts for at least some of this dependence.

row.title: CCG News and Events
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG) has been widely recognized for its research efforts to facilitiate advances in cancer genomic research and improve patient outcomes. Find the latest news about and events featuring CCG.
row.field_list_description: The Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG) has been widely recognized for its research efforts to facilitiate advances in cancer genomic research and improve patient outcomes. Find the latest news about and events featuring CCG.

row.title: Anemia and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Anemia is a side effect of cancer treatments, including chemotherapy and radiation therapy. It can make women and men feel fatigued, dizzy, and short of breath. Learn how to manage fatigue caused by anemia during cancer treatment.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes anemia, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to prevent, treat, or lessen it.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Bill Nelson, M.D., Ph.D. - Steering a Partnership to Improve Cancer Outcomes for African Americans in Maryland and DC
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Bill Nelson, M.D., Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Dr. William (Bill) Nelson is playing an integral role in advancing our understanding of cancer health disparities and helping to foster the interests of young students from underrepresented backgrounds in cancer/cancer health disparities research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Nelson is advancing cancer health disparities research and supporting students.

row.title: Program Spotlight: Arizona's Partnership for Native American Cancer Prevention - Fostering the Next Generation of Native American Cancer Researchers
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: Arizona's Partnership for Native American Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: Monica Yellowhair is a promising young Navajo cancer researcher with the Partnership for Native American Cancer Prevention Training Program funded through the CRCHD’s PACHE program.
row.field_feature_card_description: Monica Yellowhair is a Navajo cancer researcher with the NACP Training Program.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Daniel Petereit, M.D. - A "Frontier" Oncologist Studying Smoking Cessation in American Indians
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Daniel Petereit, M.D. - A "Frontier" Oncologist Studying Smoking Cessation
row.field_page_description: Dr. Daniel G. Petereit, is a frontier doctor who often travels as far as 200 miles to care for cancer patients and work with American Indian tribal leaders on a smoking cessation study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Petereit works with American Indian tribal leaders on a smoking cessation study.

row.title: Precision Medicine Initiative® and Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Precision Medicine Initiative® and Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Under the Precision Medicine Initiative, NCI is working to accelerate the pace of research that will help identify which treatments work best for which patients.
row.field_feature_card_description: This initiative accelerates a more individual molecular approach to cancer.

row.title: Nausea and Vomiting in People with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Types of nausea and vomiting caused by cancer treatment include: anticipatory, acute, and delayed. Controlling these side effects will help to prevent serious problems such as malnutrition and dehydration in people with cancer.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes nausea and vomiting, side effects of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage it.

row.title: Genome Study Yields Clues to Head and Neck Cancers
row.field_short_title: Genome Study Yields Clues to Head and Neck Cancers
row.field_page_description: Researchers have surveyed the genetic changes in nearly 300 head and neck cancers, revealing some previously unknown alterations that may play a role in the disease, including in patients whose cancer is associated with the human papillomavirus (HPV).
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers have surveyed the genetic changes in nearly 300 head and neck cancers, revealing some previously unknown alterations that may play a role in the disease.

row.title: Requests for TCGA Materials
PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Supportive and Palliative Care
row.field_page_description: Side effects of cancer treatment, management of cancer-related complications and pain, and psychosocial concerns.

row.title: Antioxidants and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about antioxidants, substances that may protect cells from the damage caused by unstable molecules known as free radicals. Free radical damage may lead to cancer.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet about antioxidants, substances that may protect cells from the damage caused by unstable molecules known as free radicals. Free radical damage may lead to cancer.

row.title: Social Media at NCI
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) has a presence on Twitter, YouTube, and Facebook and maintains numerous RSS feeds by which you can automatically receive NCI updates.
row.field_feature_card_description: Connect with us (in Spanish, too) on one or more of NCI's social media channels.

row.title: Palliative Care in Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes the role of palliative care, which is comfort care given to patients from the time of cancer diagnosis and throughout the course of illness.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet about palliative care, which is comfort care given to those with a serious or life-threatening disease.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet that describes the role of palliative care, which is comfort care given to a patient who has a serious or life-threatening disease, such as cancer, from the time of diagnosis and throughout the course of illness.

row.title: Smokeless Tobacco and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the health risks associated with the use of smokeless tobacco.

row.title: About NCI
row.field_page_description: Information about the National Cancer Institute, including information about NCI's organization, budget, advisory boards, and employment opportunities.

row.title: Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma are rare tumors that can be benign (not cancer) or malignant. Pheochromocytomas form in the adrenal glands, and paragangliomas usually along nerve pathways in the head, neck, and spine. Start here to find information on pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma treatment, and research.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Pediatric Treatment
row.field_page_description: Find treatment information for different types of cancer in children. Includes information about diagnosis, staging, and prognosis.
row.field_list_description: Treatment options for childhood cancers.

row.title: PDQ® Adult Treatment Editorial Board
row.field_page_description: Experts in the fields of medical oncology, radiation oncology, and surgical oncology.

row.title: Strengthening National Cancer Planning Efforts and Building on 20 Years of US-Vietnam Relations
row.field_short_title: Strengthening National Cancer Planning Efforts and Building on 20 Years of US-Vietnam Relations
row.field_page_description: CGH's Dr. Paul Pearlman discusses his detail in Vietnam as an Embassy Science Fellow: this detail has given me the opportunity to work side by side with the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the World Health Organization’s Vietnam Country Office, Hospital K, and other key organizations to engage on these i

row.title: Head and Neck Cancer International Group (HNCIG)
row.field_page_description: The Head and Neck Cancer International Group was established in 2014 with the mission to promote and conduct high quality head and neck cancer clinical trials worldwide to improve outcomes in patients diagnosed with these diseases.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Head and Neck Cancer International Group was established in 2014 with the mission to promote and conduct high quality head and neck cancer clinical trials worldwide.

row.title: Mouth and Throat Problems during Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments may cause dental, mouth, and throat side effects such as changes in taste (dysgeusia), dry mouth (xerostomia), infections, mouth sores, pain or swelling in your mouth (oral mucositis), sensitivity to foods, and swallowing problems.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer treatment can cause oral complications. Learn what causes oral problems and ways to prevent or manage them.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes mouth and throat problems, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to prevent or manage them.

row.title: CGH Celebrates World Cancer Day 2015
row.field_page_description: CGH activities celebrating World Cancer Day 2015

row.title: Support Services
row.field_page_description: Various services to help you cope during and after your cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Various services to help you cope during and after your cancer treatment.

row.title: Memory or Concentration Problems and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments, such as chemo, may cause difficulty thinking, concentrating, or other cognitive problems. Learn about steps people with cancer can take to manage these side effects. See a list of helpful questions for families to ask the doctor.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes memory or concentration problems, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage it.

row.title: Medicare to Cover Annual Lung Cancer Screening for Some Beneficiaries
row.field_short_title: Medicare to Cover Annual Lung Cancer Screening for Some Beneficiaries
row.field_page_description: For the first time, Medicare will cover the costs of lung cancer screening for some beneficiaries, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) announced on February 5.
row.field_feature_card_description: For the first time, Medicare will cover the costs of lung cancer screening for some beneficiaries, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) announced on February 5.

row.title: Pain in People with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Controlling pain is an important part of your cancer treatment plan. Learn how to track levels of pain. Find out how pain, a side effect of cancer treatment, is treated using acupuncture, biofeedback, and physical therapy.
row.field_list_description: What causes pain? How can I treat or lessen pain during cancer treatment? Pain is a side effect of some cancer treatments. Learn how to prevent pain, treat pain, or lessen pain in cancer patients. Get a list of questions to ask your doctor about pain.

row.title: Urinary and Bladder Problems
row.field_page_description: Problems such as radiation cystitis and urinary tract infections, which are sometimes caused by cancer treatments, are discussed along with ways to prevent or manage them.
row.field_list_description: Information about the causes and symptoms of urinary and bladder problems, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to prevent or manage them.

row.title: Edema (Swelling) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Edema is a condition in which fluid builds up in your body’s tissues. The swelling may be caused by chemotherapy, cancer, and conditions not related to cancer. Learn about signs of edema, including swelling in your feet, ankles, and legs.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes edema, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to prevent or lessen it.

row.title: Sexual Health Issues in Men with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments such as chemotherapy, radiation therapy and prostate surgery may affect a man’s sexual function, lower libido, and make it difficult to get an erection. Learn how to manage and treat these sexual problems, during cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer treatment may have side effects that affect a man's sexual life, but there are ways to manage.
row.field_list_description: Men receiving cancer treatment may have side effects that affect their sexual life. Learn about factors that determine whether sexual health is affected and ways to manage changes during treatment for cancer.

row.title: Modified Stem Cells Deliver Chemotherapy to Metastatic Tumors
row.field_short_title: Stem Cells Deliver Chemo to Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Using modified stem cells, researchers delivered a cancer drug selectively to metastatic breast cancer tumors in mice, as this NCI Cancer Currents post explains.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment targets ‘stiff’ environment around metastases.
row.field_list_description: Researchers have used modified stem cells to deliver a cancer drug selectively to metastatic breast cancer tumors in mice. The stem cells target metastatic tumors by homing in on the stiff environment that typically surrounds them.

row.title: Cancer Prevention Steering Committee Roster
row.field_page_description: Roster of members on the Cancer Prevention Steering Committee.
row.field_feature_card_description: Roster of members on the Cancer Prevention Steering Committee.

row.title: Dr. John M. Carethers to Deliver Second NCI CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar
row.field_short_title: Dr. John M. Carethers to Deliver CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar
row.field_page_description: Dr. John M. Carethers will deliver the second CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar on Oct. 5, 2017.
row.field_feature_card_description: On October 5, 2017, Dr. John M. Carethers will deliver the second CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar.
row.field_list_description: On October 5, 2017, Dr. John M. Carethers will deliver the second CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar. Dr. Carethers will present highlights from his research in hereditary colon cancer, tumor progression, and colorectal cancer disparities.

row.title: FDA Expands Approval of Fulvestrant for Advanced Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Expands Approval of Fulvestrant for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Fulvestrant (Faslodex®) has been approved by FDA for some women with advanced breast cancer, this Cancer Currents post reports.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approval is for fulvestrant alone in some women with advanced breast cancer.
row.field_list_description: FDA has expanded its approval of fulvestrant (Faslodex®) as a standalone treatment for postmenopausal women with advanced HR-positive, HER2-negative breast cancer who have not previously undergone endocrine therapy.

row.title: OncoArray Links Dozens of DNA Variants to Risk for Common Cancers
row.field_short_title: Linking DNA Variants and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: Researchers with the NCI-supported GAME-ON initiative and OncoArray Network are publishing studies identifying dozens of new genetic variants associated with the risk for developing some of the most common cancers, as this Cancer Currents blog post reports.
row.field_feature_card_description: An NCI-supported network is unearthing data on genetic links to common cancers.
row.field_list_description: Researchers with the NCI-supported GAME-ON initiative and OncoArray Network are publishing studies identifying dozens of new genetic variants associated with the risk for developing some of the most common cancers.

row.title: Access to Experimental Cancer Drugs
row.field_page_description: An experimental drug has been tested in the lab and with animals and approved for testing in people by the FDA, but can’t yet be advertised, sold, or prescribed. Experimental drugs may be available through clinical trials or expanded access programs - learn more about these programs and how to talk to your doctor.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn how you might gain access to drugs that have been approved for testing in people but can't yet be advertised, sold, or prescribed.
row.field_list_description: An experimental drug is one that has been tested in the lab and with animals and approved for testing in people by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), but can’t yet be advertised, sold, or prescribed. Experimental drugs may be available through clinical trials or expanded access programs.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Your Diagnosis
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Your Diagnosis
row.field_page_description: Suggested questions for patients to ask their doctors when they learn they have cancer and want to know what to expect next.
row.field_feature_card_description: These questions may help you learn more about your cancer and what you can expect next.
row.field_list_description: These questions may help you learn more about your cancer what you can expect next.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Cancer
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Cancer
row.field_page_description: Sets of questions, organized by topic, that cancer patients may want to ask their doctors or other members of their health care team to learn more about their cancer and what to expect.
row.field_feature_card_description: When you meet with your doctor or other members of your health care team, take a list of questions with you.

row.title: Carryover Unobligated Funds
row.field_page_description: Carryover is the process by which unobligated funds remaining at the end of a budget period may be carried forward to cover allowable costs in the next budget period. Learn more about how to carryover NCI grants.
row.field_feature_card_description: Carryover is the process by which unobligated funds remaining at the end of a budget period may be carried forward to cover allowable costs in the next budget period. Learn more about how to carryover NCI grants.
row.field_list_description: Carryover is the process by which unobligated funds remaining at the end of a budget period may be carried forward to cover allowable costs in the next budget period. The carryover of funds enables recipients to use unexpended prior year grant funds in another budget period.

row.title: NAVIGATE: NCI and VA Interagency Group to Accelerate Trials Enrollment
row.field_page_description: The NAVIGATE program will make it easier for veterans to access promising new cancer treatments via clinical trials. This partnership between NCI and the VHA will increase the number of VA Medical Centers participating in and conducting NCI-supported cancer clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The NAVIGATE program is a partnership between NCI and the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) to facilitate enrollment of veterans into NCI funded clinical trials.

row.title: Do Frequent Follow-Up Tests Benefit Colorectal Cancer Survivors?
row.field_short_title: Do Frequent Follow-Up Tests Help Colorectal Cancer Survivors?
row.field_page_description: Two studies of colorectal cancer survivors examined whether more frequent follow-up testing for recurrence improved how long people lived. Read this Cancer Currents blog post to learn whether testing frequency affects survival.
row.field_feature_card_description: Studies show testing more than once a year doesn’t improve survival.
row.field_list_description: Two studies examined the impact of more frequent follow-up testing for cancer recurrence in colorectal cancer survivors. Learn whether the studies showed that frequent testing improved survival.

row.title: A to Z List of Cancer Drugs
row.field_short_title: A to Z List of Cancer Drugs
row.field_page_description: List of cancer drug information summaries providing details about cancer drugs and cancer drug combinations.
row.field_feature_card_description: Consumer-friendly information about drugs and drug combinations used to prevent and treat cancer.
row.field_list_description: Consumer-friendly information about cancer drugs and drug combinations used to prevent and treat cancer.

row.title: RAS Image-Based Screens
row.field_page_description: This laboratory develops screens based on live cell imaging of labeled RAS molecules.
row.field_feature_card_description: This laboratory develops screens based on live cell imaging of labeled RAS molecules.

row.title: RAS Informatics
row.field_page_description: The RAS Informatics lab group develops tools to track and analyze “big data” from the RAS Initiative, as well as analyzes data from external projects. By integrating internal and external data, this group helps improve understanding of RAS-driven cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: This lab group develops tools to track and analyze “big data” from the RAS Initiative and the larger RAS community.
row.field_list_description: This lab group develops tools to track and analyze “big data” from the RAS Initiative and the larger RAS community.

row.title: NCI Scientists Identify New Gene Mutation that Predisposes Families to Melanoma
row.field_short_title: NCI Scientists Identify New Gene Mutation that Predisposes Families to Melanoma

row.title: Modeling Different Breast Cancer Screening Strategies
row.field_short_title: Modeling Different Breast Cancer Screening Strategies
row.field_page_description: A modeling study for breast cancer screening found that regular mammography screening for women ages 50 to 74 reduces the risk of dying due to breast cancer, with a smaller benefit for women 40 to 49.
row.field_list_description: A study that uses modeling to summarize the benefits and harms of breast cancer screening finds that regular mammography screening for women ages 50 to 74 reduces the risk of dying due to breast cancer, with a smaller benefit for women 40 to 49.

row.title: Three New Therapies Approved for Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: Three New Therapies Approved for Multiple Myeloma
row.field_page_description: In November 2015, the FDA approved three new therapies for patients with multiple myeloma.

row.title: Mutation-Specific Approaches to KRAS Cancers: What We Can Learn from G12C-Directed Inhibitors
row.field_page_description: Dr. Sharon Campbell discusses recent advances in targeting specific mutant forms of KRAS proteins in cancers.

row.title: Strengthening relations with Latin American countries through health diplomacy
row.field_short_title: Strengthening relations with Latin American countries through health diplomacy
row.field_page_description: Ambassador of Peru to the United States, Luis Miguel Castilla, visited the Center for Global Health (CGH) at the National Cancer Institute a year ago with the objective of strengthening collaboration between US NCI and the Instituto Nacional de Enfermedades Neoplasicas of Peru and Ministry of Health of Peru. As part of

row.title: Venetoclax Approved for Some Patients with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved venetoclax for patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) whose tumors have a specific genetic alteration.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment led to substantial, enduring tumor responses.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved venetoclax for patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia whose tumors have a specific genetic alteration.

row.title: Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy
row.field_page_description: The NIH Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy was issued to promote broad sharing of genomic research data and ensure oversight and protections for research involving human data.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about this policy, which applies to all NIH-funded research that generates large-scale genomic data.
row.field_list_description: The NIH Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy was issued to promote broad and robust sharing of genomic research data and ensure proper oversight and appropriate protections for research involving human data.

row.title: Online Tool Helps Users Distinguish Moles from Melanoma
row.field_short_title: Online Tool Helps Users Distinguish Moles from Melanoma
row.field_page_description: “Moles to Melanoma: Recognizing the ABCDE Features” presents photos that show changes in individual pigmented lesions over time, and describes the different appearances of moles, dysplastic nevi, and melanomas.
row.field_feature_card_description: An online tool presents photos that show changes in individual pigmented lesions over time.

row.title: Clinical Trial Registration, Amendments, and Updates
row.field_page_description: Policies on clinical trial registration, amendments and updates related to CTRP.

row.title: The Genomic Data Commons Launches
row.field_page_description: The NCI Genomic Data Commons is a next generation knowledge network that enables the access, analysis, and submission of cancer genomic data. The GDC facilitates data sharing and promotes precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI GDC, a data sharing platform to facilitate precision oncology, lauches today.

row.title: Tumor Microenvironment Influences Metabolism of Cancer Cells
row.field_short_title: Tumor Microenvironment Influences Metabolism of Cancer Cells
row.field_page_description: In a new blog post in RAS Dialogue, Dr. Cosimo Commisso discusses how the metabolism of cancer cells might be different in different parts of solid tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a new blog post in RAS Dialogue, Dr. Cosimo Commisso discusses how the metabolism of cancer cells might be different in different parts of solid tumors.
row.field_list_description: Solid tumors have disregulated blood, oxygen, and nutrient supplies that influence metabolism in different parts of the tumors. Attacking these differences will require an intimate knowledge of how cancer cells detect and adapt to their environment.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Breast Lobular Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Breast Lobular Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Breast Lobular Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Breast Lobular Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of invasive breast lobular carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Biosimilars for Cancer Emerge as Patents on Widely Used Biological Drugs Expire
row.field_page_description: As the patents on widely used biological drugs to treat cancer expire, biosimilar drugs are being developed for the treatment of patients with cancer. You can learn how biosimilars may expand treatment options in this Cancer Currents blog post.
row.field_feature_card_description: Biosimilars could potentially enable greater access to biological therapies.
row.field_list_description: As the patents on some widely used drugs to treat cancer expire in the coming years, biosimilar drugs are being developed for the treatment of patients with cancer. Are biosimilars effective and will they expand treatment options for patients?

row.title: Dr. Alan S. Rabson, Long-Time NCI Deputy Director and Cancer Research Stalwart, Dies
row.field_short_title: Long-Time NCI Deputy Director Dr. Alan Rabson Dies
row.field_page_description: Long-time NCI senior leader Alan Rabson, M.D., passed away on July 4, at the age of 92. His career spanned 6 decades, including research on tumor virology and cancer pathology and senior NCI leadership roles.
row.field_feature_card_description: Revered scientist and leader’s career at NCI spanned 6 decades.
row.field_list_description: Many in the cancer research and NIH community are mourning the loss of long-time NCI senior leader Alan Rabson, M.D., who passed away on July 4, at the age of 92. His career spanned 6 decades, including research on tumor virology and cancer pathology and senior NCI leadership roles.

row.title: Sodium Thiosulfate Prevents Cisplatin-Induced Hearing Loss in Some Children
row.field_short_title: Drug Prevents Chemo-Related Hearing Loss in Some Children
row.field_page_description: Sodium thiosulfate protected cisplatin-related hearing loss in children with a form of liver cancer, results from a clinical trial show. As this Cancer Currents post explains, the findings should affect clinical practice.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment addresses common side effect of chemo drug cisplatin.
row.field_list_description: The drug sodium thiosulfate can protect the hearing of children with cancer undergoing treatment with the chemotherapy drug cisplatin, results from a new clinical trial show. The trial involved children with a form of liver cancer called hepatoblastoma.

row.title: Liver and Bile Duct Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Liver cancer includes hepatocellular carcinoma and bile duct cancer (cholangiocarcinoma). Risk factors for HCC include chronic infection with hepatitis B or C and cirrhosis of the liver. Start here to find information on liver and bile duct cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about liver and bile cancer.

row.title: E-mail Us
row.field_page_description: NCI Web e-mail contact form.

row.title: NCI Organization
row.field_page_description: Links to NCI's 30 divisions, offices, and centers who work together to build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda.
row.field_feature_card_description: Links to NCI's divisions, offices, and centers.
row.field_list_description: As the nation's leading federal agency for cancer research, NCI has 30 divisions, offices, and centers who work together to build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda.

row.title: Diethylstilbestrol (DES) and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about DES (a synthetic form of estrogen) and the health problems of children who were exposed to DES while in the womb.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet about DES (a synthetic form of estrogen) and the health problems of children who were exposed to DES while in the womb.

row.title: CGH Hosts the Regional Centers of Research Excellence Program Launch Meeting for Cohort 1 Investigators
row.field_short_title: CGH Hosts the Regional Centers of Research Excellence Program Launch Meeting for Cohort 1 Investigat
row.field_page_description: CGH convened the first meeting of the principal investigators funded in the first cohort. These investigators gathered to share their Research Center plans and provide feedback to one another.

row.title: Structural Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics uses structural cancer genomics to identify genomic alterations that contribute to cancer growth, metastasis, and recurrence.
row.field_feature_card_description: Structural genomics identifies alterations in cancer that contribute to cancer growth, metastasis, and recurrence.
row.field_list_description: Structural genomics identifies alterations in cancer that contribute to cancer growth, metastasis, and recurrence. CCG's structural genomics programs include The Cancer Genome Atlas and TARGET.

row.title: About the Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy
row.field_short_title: About the Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy
row.field_page_description: The Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy (OHAM) enhances NCI’s research in the field of HIV/AIDS and facilitates coordination of this effort. Learn more about the clinical and programmatic initiatives that OHAM oversees.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn how OHAM enhances and facilitates NCI’s HIV/AIDS research initiatives.
row.field_list_description: The Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy enhances NCI’s research in the field of HIV/AIDS and facilitates the NCI-wide coordination of this effort. Learn more about the clinical and programmatic initiatives that OHAM oversees.

row.title: A Panel of Isogenic RAS-Dependent Cell Lines Developed at the Frederick National Laboratory
row.field_short_title: A Panel of Isogenic RAS-Dependent Cell Lines Developed at the Frederick National Laboratory
row.field_page_description: Cells lacking all RAS genes but those that have been modified and introduced by viral transduction are highly useful for drug screens.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cell lines engineered to express single RAS isoforms and mutants are available from the FNL.
row.field_list_description: Mouse embryonic fibroblasts have been engineered to lack all RAS genes on demand. Then individual RAS genes can be introduced. Such cells allow effects of drugs to be tested with more precision.

row.title: FDA Approves Niraparib as Maintenance Therapy for Recurrent Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Niraparib as Maintenance Therapy for Recurrent Ovarian Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s approval of niraparib as maintenance therapy for some women with recurrent ovarian cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: FDA approval is for patients with or without BRCA mutations.
row.field_list_description: The FDA approved the PARP inhibitor niraparib for use as a maintenance therapy for some women with advanced ovarian cancer.

row.title: Multiple Myeloma Awareness and African American Disparities
row.field_short_title: Multiple Myeloma Awareness and African American Disparities
row.field_page_description: As part of National Minority Cancer Awareness Week, we discuss multiple myeloma, a cancer that disproportionately affect minorities, and awareness of this cancer in African American communities.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about multiple myeloma and disparities in the African American community.

row.title: Cancer Driver Discovery Program
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Driver Discovery Program aims to sequence a large number of cancer cases in order to increase statistical power for identifying recurrent driver mutations.

row.title: FDA Approves Immunotherapy Drugs for Patients with Bladder Cancer
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Drugs Approved for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s approval of four immunotherapy drugs for patients with bladder cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approvals for four checkpoint inhibitors expand treatment options for patients.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved four immunotherapy drugs—avelumab, atezolizumab, durvalumab, and pembrolizumab—for the treatment of patients with bladder cancer. All four drugs belong to a class of cancer therapies known as checkpoint inhibitors.

row.title: Clinical Trial Concept Submission Guidelines
row.field_page_description: A guide to current NCI procedures for submitting phase 3 or large phase 2 clinical trial concepts to be evaluated by Scientific Steering Committees.
row.field_feature_card_description: A guide to current NCI procedures for submitting phase 3 or large phase 2 clinical trial concepts to be evaluated by Scientific Steering Committees.

row.title: Clinical Imaging Steering Committee Roster
NCI Summer Curriculum in Cancer Prevention - Additional Lectures for International Participants
row.field_short_title: NCI Summer Curriculum in Cancer Prevention - Additional Lectures for International Participants

row.title: NCI Congressional Justification
row.field_page_description: The NCI budget Congressional Justification is prepared to justify the President's annual budget request to Congress. View and download the 2018 Congressional Justification.
row.field_feature_card_description: Take a look at the FY 2019 NCI Congressional Justification to see an outline of our goals and objectives for the coming fiscal year.
row.field_list_description: The Congressional Justification is a document that justifies the President’s budget request by explaining NCI’s mission, outlining the institute’s goals and objectives for the coming fiscal year, and providing comparative data and analysis for the previous, current, and proposed budgets.

row.title: RAS Target Identification at FNLCR
row.field_page_description: Discover the cutting edge technologies being used to better define target vulnerabilities in RAS proteins and pathways essential to cancer cells.
row.field_feature_card_description: Discover the cutting edge technologies being used to better define target vulnerabilities in RAS proteins and pathways essential to cancer cells.
row.field_list_description: The RAS Initiative is using cutting edge technologies to better define target vulnerabilities in RAS proteins, complexes of RAS proteins with its effector and regulatory partners, cell surface proteins that are enriched in cancer cells driven by mutant RAS, and pathways that are essential to cancer cells but not normal cells.

row.title: RAS Dialogue
row.field_page_description: Post comments, ask questions, share information, and stay up-to-date with expert Rasologists.
row.field_feature_card_description: Post comments, ask questions, and share information with RAS experts.

row.title: RAS Meetings and Videos
row.field_page_description: Find upcoming RAS-related workshops, seminars, and conferences and previously recorded webcasts of such events.
row.field_feature_card_description: Explore upcoming RAS-related workshops, seminars, and conferences and previously recorded webcasts of such events.
row.field_list_description: Explore upcoming RAS-related workshops, seminars, and conferences and previously recorded webcasts of such events.

row.title: The NCI Outstanding Investigator Award (R35)
row.field_page_description: The NCI Outstanding Investigator Award (OIA) supports investigators with outstanding records of productivity in cancer research by providing extended funding stability and encouraging investigators to continue or embark on projects of unusual potential in cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI established the Outstanding Investigator Award (R35) for principal investigators who have achieved significant research accomplishments.

row.title: Head and Neck Steering Committee Roster
row.field_short_title: Head and Neck Steering Committee Roster

row.title: Pediatric and Adolescent Solid Tumor Steering Committee
row.field_short_title: Pediatric and Adolescent Solid Tumor Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Pediatric and Adolescent Solid Tumor Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization and evaluation of concepts for large phase 2 and phase 3 clinical trials in extracranial solid tumors of children and youth.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Pediatric and Adolescent Solid Tumor Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Pediatric and Adolescent Solid Tumor Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: CGH’s Third Year with NCI: Progress, Partnerships, & Possibilities
row.field_short_title: CGH’s Third Year with NCI: Progress, Partnerships, & Possibilities
row.field_page_description: The Center for Global Health is embarking on its third year within the National Cancer Institute, and I am pleased with the extraordinary progress and achievements made in this time by our dedicated staff members. CGH has established new, and strengthened ongoing, initiatives and programs with great success, including

row.title: 2013 Awardees: Request for Proposals for Pilot Collaborations with Low- and Mid-Income Countries (LMICs) in Global Cancer Research or Global Health Research at NCI-Designated Cancer Centers
row.field_page_description: The National cancer institute, CENTER FOR GLOBAL HEALTH, in collaboration with the OFFICE OF CANCER CENTERS, is pleased to announce the 2013 awardees of the Request for Proposals for Pilot Collaborations with Low- and Mid-Income Countries (LMICs) in Global Cancer Research or Global Health Research at NCI-Designated Can

row.title: Redefining Adjuvant Therapy for Stage III Resected Colon Cancer
row.field_short_title: Redefining Adjuvant Therapy for Stage III Resected Colon Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with resected stage III colon cancer are being randomly assigned to receive FOLFOX chemotherapy for either 3 or 6 months and to take either a pill called celecoxib or a matching placebo pill for 3 years.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this trial, patients with resected stage III colon cancer are being randomly assigned to receive FOLFOX chemotherapy for either 3 or 6 months and to take either a pill called celecoxib or a matching placebo pill for 3 years.
row.field_list_description: In this trial, patients with resected stage III colon cancer are being randomly assigned to receive a type of chemotherapy called FOLFOX for either 3 months or 6 months and to take either an aspirin-like pill called celecoxib (Celebrex®) or a matching placebo pill for 3 years.

row.title: The Cancer Moonshot Summit: Reaching New Heights
row.field_short_title: The Cancer Moonshot Summit: Reaching New Heights
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog from acting NCI Director Dr. Doug Lowy on the Cancer Moonshot national summit hosted by Vice President Joe Biden in Washington, D.C., including a summary of the NCI-related activities stimulated by the Cancer Moonshot.
row.field_feature_card_description: Vice President Biden urges participants, cancer community to double rate of research progress.
row.field_list_description: A recap of the Cancer Moonshot national summit hosted by Vice President Joe Biden in Washington, D.C., on June 29, 2016, including a summary of the NCI-related activities that have been stimulated by the Cancer Moonshot.

row.title: Inherited Mutations in DNA-Repair Genes Found in Advanced Prostate Cancers
row.field_short_title: Inherited Mutations Identified in Advanced Prostate Cancers
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about the discovery in men with advanced prostate cancer of inherited mutations in genes that play a role in repairing damaged DNA.
row.field_feature_card_description: In the future, men who have prostate cancer with these inherited mutations may be candidates for particular treatments.
row.field_list_description: Researchers estimate that nearly 12% of men with advanced prostate cancer have inherited mutations in genes that play a role in repairing damaged DNA.

row.title: Partner-Aided Skin Exams Increase Early Detection of New Melanomas
row.field_short_title: Partner-Aided Skin Exams Increase Early Detection of New Melanomas
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study which showed that people previously treated for melanoma can team up with a partner and be trained to find new melanomas.
row.field_feature_card_description: Training helps family, friends detect new melanomas in previously treated patients.
row.field_list_description: People previously treated for melanoma can team up with a spouse, family member, or a friend and be trained to find new melanomas, a new study shows.

row.title: RAS Spokes/Funding
Nanoparticle Delivers Cancer Drugs to Tumor Blood Vessels
row.field_short_title: Nanoparticle Delivers Cancer Drugs to Tumor Blood Vessels
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study showing that, in cancer mouse models, nanoparticles that target P-selectin on tumor blood vessels shrank tumors and extended survival.
row.field_feature_card_description: In mice, treatment approach improved delivery of cancer drugs to tumors.
row.field_list_description: In cancer mouse models, nanoparticles that bind to a protein called P-selectin on tumor blood vessels shrank tumors and extended survival.

row.title: Approach May Allow for Stem Cell Transplant without Radiation, Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Study Tests Safer Stem Cell Transplant
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a study testing a potentially safer way to perform stem cell transplants for treating cancer and other diseases.
row.field_feature_card_description: In mice, a new approach produces stem cell transplantation without using high-dose chemotherapy or radiation.
row.field_list_description: In a recent study, researchers showed that a new approach may provide a safer way to perform stem cell transplants for treating cancer and other diseases.

row.title: CGH Supports World Cancer Day Every Day
row.field_short_title: CGH Supports World Cancer Day Every Day
row.field_page_description: We celebrate World Cancer Day every year on February 4th. This year the theme “We can. I can.” invites us to think not only about how we can work with one another to reduce the global burden of cancer, but how we as individuals can make a difference. Every day the staff at CGH work to establish and build upon programs

row.title: Faint Light at the End of the Tunnel
row.field_short_title: Faint Light at the End of the Tunnel
row.field_page_description: Gideon Bollag describes progress and some of the challenges in inhibiting RAF, the primary effector of RAS in the MAPK pathway.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a new blog in RAS Dialogue, Dr. Gideon Bollag discusses the challenges and opportunities of drugging the RAS pathway.
row.field_list_description: Many cancers are dependent on an overactive MAPK pathway. While progress in inhibiting mutant RAS proteins is still in its early phase, third-generation drugs that inhibit the next protein in the pathway, RAF, are being tested. Gideon Bollag of Plexxikon describes some of the challenges of developing inhibitors of RAF.

row.title: FDA Approves Eribulin Mesylate for Advanced Liposarcoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Eribulin Mesylate for Advanced Liposarcoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved eribulin mesylate for patients with liposarcoma whose cancers are advanced or cannot be removed by surgery and are no longer responding to anthracycline-based chemotherapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: Offers new option for patients for whom there are few effective therapies.

row.title: Learning to Relax
row.field_page_description: Relaxation and imagery exercises to help reduce pain and stress from cancer and its treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Relaxation and imagery exercises can help cancer patients cope with pain and stress.
row.field_list_description: Relaxation and imagery exercises to help reduce pain and stress.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Blue Ribbon Panel
row.field_page_description: The Blue Ribbon Panel Report outlines 10 recommendations to accelerate progress against cancer. The panel was established to ensure that the Cancer Moonshot's approaches are grounded in the best science.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Blue Ribbon Panel (BRP) outlined 10 research recommendations to accelerate progress against cancer. Learn about the panel and its report.
row.field_list_description: A Blue Ribbon Panel of experts was established as a working group of the NCAB to ensure that the Cancer Moonshot's approaches are grounded in the best science. Their report outlines 10 recommendations to accelerate progress against cancer.

row.title: A Milestone in Cancer Research and Treatment in India
row.field_short_title: A Milestone in Cancer Research and Treatment in India
row.field_page_description: Tata Memorial Center is celebrating 75 years of leadership service towards cancer control and research in India. In honor of this anniversary, TMC is hosting A Conference of New Ideas in Cancer – Challenging Dogmas on February 26-28th, 2016 as part of its platinum jubilee events. CGH Director, Dr. Ted Trimble, will g

row.title: BRCA Testing Rates High in Young Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: BRCA Testing Increasing in Young Breast Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Testing for genetic mutations strongly associated with an increased breast cancer risk has risen dramatically among women younger than age 40 who are diagnosed with the disease, according to a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Testing for genetic mutations associated with breast cancer risk has risen dramatically among young women diagnosed with the disease.
row.field_list_description: Testing for genetic mutations strongly associated with an increased risk of breast cancer has risen dramatically among women younger than age 40 who are diagnosed with the disease, according to a new study.

row.title: Center for Research Strategy (CRS)
row.field_page_description: CRS develops recommendations on scientific opportunity, funding gaps and mechanisms, while monitoring the direction and application of knowledge and resources.
row.field_feature_card_description: Identifies research opportunities and funding gaps while monitoring the direction and application of NCI’s scientific knowledge and resources.
row.field_list_description: The Center for Research Strategy (CRS) develops recommendations for addressing scientific opportunity, identifying funding gaps, and managing funding mechanisms, while monitoring the direction and application of scientific knowledge and resources.

row.title: Screening and Early Detection - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on cancer screening and early detection research—including diagnostic biomarkers and advances or trends in screening practices—from NCI Cancer Currents.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer screening and early detection research blog posts from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: Survivorship and Supportive Care - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on survivorship and supportive care research—including the physical, psychosocial, and economic issues faced by cancer survivors and their caregivers—from NCI Cancer Currents.
row.field_feature_card_description: Survivorship and supportive care research blog posts from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: Study Identifies Genetic Mutations in Tumors From 10,000 Patients with Metastatic Cancer
row.field_short_title: Mutations in 10,000 Patients with Metastatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers have reported the results of an initiative to characterize the genetic mutations in tumors from more than 10,000 patients with advanced cancer treated at the center.
row.field_feature_card_description: The genetic information was used to match hundreds of patients to treatments or clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: Researchers at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center have reported the results of an initiative to characterize the genetic mutations in tumors from more than 10,000 patients with advanced cancer treated at the center.

row.title: Less Chemotherapy May Be Best Choice for Some Patients with Colon Cancer, Study Shows
row.field_short_title: Less Adjuvant Chemotherapy for Colon Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on a study which showed a shorter chemotherapy course following surgery may be preferred for some patients with colon cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Shorter post-surgery chemotherapy may be safer, equally effective for patients at low risk of recurrence.
row.field_list_description: A shorter course of chemotherapy following surgery may be preferred to longer treatment for some patients with colon cancer, results of an international collaborative study suggest.

row.title: Powering Off Cancer
row.field_page_description: Many cancers are more dependent on metabolic reactions that occur in mitochondria than normal cells. New therapies that target these reactions are being tested.
row.field_feature_card_description: The laboratory of Dr. Costas Lyssiotis is investigating how the metabolism of mitochondria in cancer cells can be targeted.
row.field_list_description: The uncontrolled growth of cancers is dependent on altered metabolism. For example, many cancers are highly dependent on the altered metabolic reactions that occur in their mitochondria. New therapies that target these reactions are being tested.

row.title: RAS Reference Reagents
row.field_page_description: NCI researchers have developed unique and powerful reagents at the NCI labs. Learn about and purchase the latest RAS pathways and reagents.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about and purchase the latest RAS pathways and reagents.
row.field_list_description: RAS Initiative researchers have developed unique reagents at the FNLCR. We hope that by widely distributing these to the larger RAS community, we can increase the efficiency of all research on RAS.

row.title: RAS Cell Lines
row.field_page_description: Cell lines expressing mutant RAS genes are essential tools for finding ways to intervene in RAS cancers. Learn about the work of NCI RAS Initiative scientists to engineer and characterize these cell lines, creating a reliable resource.
row.field_list_description: Cell lines expressing mutant RAS genes are essential tools for finding ways to intervene in RAS cancers. NCI's RAS Initiative scientists have devoted significant effort to engineering and characterizing these cell lines so they will be a reliable resource for themselves and the larger RAS community.

row.title: About the Office of Budget and Finance
row.field_page_description: The Office of Budget and Finance (OBF) advises the NCI Office of the Director and senior NCI staff on the effective management of financial and other resources to ensure that NCI operates in an efficient and fiscally responsible manner.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn more about who we are, what we do, and why.
row.field_list_description: OBF advises the NCI Office of the Director and senior NCI staff on the effective management of financial, personnel and other resources to ensure that NCI operates in an efficient and fiscally responsible manner.

row.title: Reducing the Burden of Cancer in East Africa
row.field_short_title: Reducing the Burden of Cancer in East Africa
row.field_page_description: The mission of CGH is to advance global cancer research, build expertise, and leverage resources across nations to reduce cancer deaths worldwide. To carry out that mission, we facilitate the sharing of knowledge and expertise. CGH's latest effort, the East Africa Cancer Control Leadership Forum, carried out this missi

row.title: Office of Communications and Public Liaison
row.field_short_title: Office of Communications and Public Liaison
row.field_page_description: The NCI Office of Communications and Public Liaison (OCPL) supports NCI by disseminating cancer research findings, providing evidence-based information on cancer for the public, including patients, caregivers, health professionals, researchers, advocates, the news media, and other stakeholders, and disseminating cancer
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about NCI's Office of Communications and Public Liaison (OCPL)

row.title: Managing Costs and Medical Information
row.field_page_description: People with cancer may face major financial challenges and need help dealing with the high costs of care. Cancer treatment can be very expensive, even when you have insurance. Learn ways to manage medical information, paperwork, bills, and other records.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn ways to manage healthcare information, paperwork, bills, and other records.
row.field_list_description: People with cancer and their families may face major financial challenges. Cancer treatment can be very expensive, even when you have insurance. Learn ways to manage and track tests and treatments, paperwork, bills, and other records.

row.title: A Harmful Trend: Increased Waterpipe Smoking
row.field_short_title: A Harmful Trend: Increased Waterpipe Smoking

row.title: Profiles in Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Written profiles highlighting the work of NCI and NCI-funded researchers, clinicians, and others who contribute to cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Meet a few of the NCI-funded researchers, clinicians, and others at work in cancer research.

row.title: Cancer Immunology, Hematology, and Etiology Research
row.field_short_title: Cancer Immunology, Hematology, and Etiology Research
row.field_page_description: Part of NCI’s Division of Cancer Biology’s research portfolio, studies supported include the characterization of basic mechanisms relevant to anti-tumor immune responses and hematologic malignancies.
row.field_feature_card_description: Studies supported include the characterization of basic mechanisms relevant to anti-tumor immune responses and hematologic malignancies.

row.title: Researcher Interview: Jinghui Zhang
row.field_page_description: Center for Cancer Genomics Interview with Jinghui Zhang, Ph.D.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researcher Interview: Jinghui Zhang
row.field_list_description: In this interview, Jinghui Zhang, Ph.D., Chair of Computational Biology at St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, discusses why developing new computational methods is critical to progress against cancer. She also explains how differences between adult and pediatric cancers impact the way they are studied.

row.title: Recurrent Cancer: When Cancer Comes Back
row.field_page_description: Cancer can recur when treatment doesn’t fully remove or destroy all the cancer cells. Learn about the different types of recurrence and how recurrent cancer is restaged and treated.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn the different types of recurrent cancer and why it returns.
row.field_list_description: Cancer can come back, or recur, when treatment doesn’t fully remove or destroy all the cancer cells. Learn about the different types of recurrence and how recurrent cancer is restaged and treated.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Moonshot is marshalling resources across the federal government to speed progress in cancer research and lead to improved cancer prevention, detection, and treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: This broad-based effort is making new investments to accelerate progress against cancer.
row.field_list_description: An introduction to the Cancer Moonshot, which is marshalling resources across the federal government to speed progress in cancer research and lead to improved cancer prevention, detection, and treatment.

row.title: The ‘Crisis’ of Low HPV Vaccination Rates: A Conversation with Dr. Noel Brewer
row.field_short_title: A Conversation about the HPV Vaccination Crisis
row.field_page_description: Following the release of a consensus statement from the NCI-Designated Cancer Centers urging HPV vaccination in the United States, Dr. Noel Brewer discusses the country’s low vaccination rates and how clinicians can help to improve them.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Noel Brewer discusses how clinicians can help to improve the country’s low vaccination rates.

row.title: Mouse Study Points to Mechanism Linking Obesity and Colorectal Cancer Risk
row.field_short_title: Mouse Study Points to Mechanism Linking Obesity and Colorectal Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A missing hormone in obese mice may help explain a longstanding association between obesity and an increased risk of colorectal cancer in humans.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study points to mechanism linking obesity and colorectal cancer risk.

row.title: A Conversation with Elizabeth Jaffee
row.field_page_description: In this RAS Dialogue blost post, Dr. Elizabeth Jaffee talks about her career developing immunotherapies for cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a new blog in RAS Dialogue, Dr. Elizabeth Jaffee discusses the recent increased interest in harnessing patients' own immune systems to treat cancer.
row.field_list_description: Immunotherapy uses the patient's own immune system to fight cancer, but some tumors lack significant numbers of immune cells. Elizabeth Jaffee has invented new therapies that are designed to attract immune cells to penetrate tumors.

row.title: Reports
row.field_page_description: Information about major NCI reports as well as other reports released by government health agencies and nonprofit groups that provide information about cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about major NCI reports as well as other reports released by government health agencies and nonprofit groups that provide information about cancer.

row.title: What’s New on NCI’s Websites?
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Crizotinib Approval Expanded for Advanced Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: Crizotinib Approval Expanded for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved uses of the targeted therapy crizotinib (Xalkori®) for patients with advanced lung cancer whose tumors have alterations in the ROS1 gene.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approval covers patients whose tumors have specific genetic changes.

row.title: Drug Combination Shrinks Duodenal Polyps in People with Familial Adenomatous Polyposis
row.field_short_title: Drug Combo Shrinks Duodenal Polyps in FAP
row.field_page_description: In a small clinical trial of people with an inherited condition that greatly increases gastrointestinal cancer risk, a two-drug combination shrank precancerous lesions in the duodenum.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study result raises possibility of lowering duodenal cancer risk.

row.title: Nanoparticle Generator Slips Chemotherapy Past Tumor Cells’ Protective Barriers
row.field_short_title: Nanoparticle Generator Targets Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers have developed a new injectable nanoparticle-generating technology that can deliver a cancer drug to the nucleus of metastatic breast cancer cells.
row.field_feature_card_description: Technology delivers cancer drugs directly to lung, liver metastases.

row.title: Vitamin D Deficiency May Promote Spread of Some Breast Cancers
row.field_short_title: Vitamin D Deficiency May Promote Spread of Some Breast Cancers
row.field_page_description: Low vitamin D levels are associated with metastasis in women with breast cancer, suggests a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study also identifies association between vitamin D and a cancer-causing gene.

row.title: Improving Public Health through Increased Tobacco Regulation
row.field_short_title: Improving Public Health with Increased Tobacco Regulation
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Dr. Robert Croyle discusses the Food and Drug Administration’s release of a rule that extends its regulatory authority over tobacco products to include cigars, e-cigarettes, hookah tobacco, and others.
row.field_feature_card_description: FDA extends its regulatory authority over tobacco products.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Dr. Robert Croyle discusses the Food and Drug Administration’s release of a rule that extends its regulatory authority over tobacco products to include cigars, e-cigarettes, hookah (waterpipe) tobacco.

row.title: Adrenocortical Carcinoma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on adrenocortical carcinoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Colorectal Cancer Survival Linked to Primary Tumor Location
row.field_short_title: Colorectal Cancer Survival Linked to Primary Tumor Location
row.field_page_description: In patients with metastatic colorectal cancer, the location in the colon where the tumor originated appears to strongly influence how long patients live, according to a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients whose tumors originated in left colon lived longer after treatment.
row.field_list_description: A blog post on a study showing that in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer, the location in the colon where the tumor originated appears to strongly influence how long patients live.

row.title: Two New Therapies Approved by FDA for Advanced Kidney Cancer
row.field_short_title: Two New Therapies Approved for Advanced Kidney Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI’s Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s recent approval of cabozantinib (Cometriq®) and lenvatinib (Lenvima®) for the treatment of patients whose advanced kidney cancers have progressed after prior treatment with antiangiogenic therapies.
row.field_feature_card_description: Both approvals are for patients whose cancers have progressed after prior treatment with drugs that block tumor blood vessel growth.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved two drugs, cabozantinib and lenvatinib, for patients whose advanced kidney cancers have progressed after prior treatment with antiangiogenic therapies.

row.title: NCI and the Chinese National Cancer Center pursue new collaborations in cancer research
row.field_short_title: NCI and the Chinese National Cancer Center pursue new collaborations in cancer research
row.field_page_description: CGH Director, Dr. Ted Trimble, and East Asia Program Director, Dr. Ann Chao, traveled to Beijing with Mr. Matthew Brown from the Department of Health and Human Services Office of Global Affairs to attend the Joint Meeting of the NCC and the U.S. NCI.

row.title: The Genomic Data Commons Expands with New Data Sharing Agreement
row.field_page_description: The Genomic Data Commons (GDC) will gain data from 18,000 patients through an agreement signed today with Foundation Medicine, Inc.
row.field_feature_card_description: The GDC will gain data from 18,000 patients through an agreement signed today with Foundation Medicine, Inc.
row.field_list_description: Foundation Medicine, Inc., a molecular profiling company, will contribute data from 18,000 patients in the FoundationOne database to the Genomic Data Commons (GDC).

row.title: The Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel: Moving Toward a Final Report
row.field_short_title: Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel Moving Toward Final Report
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog from acting NCI Director Dr. Doug Lowy providing an update on the activities of the National Cancer Moonshot Initiative’s Blue Ribbon Panel and its work to develop a final report.
row.field_feature_card_description: The panel's working groups are reviewing ideas and will present final recommendations in August.
row.field_list_description: An update on the activities of the National Cancer Moonshot Initiative’s Blue Ribbon Panel and its work to develop a final report for research ideas to be pursued under this initiative.

row.title: Mouse Study Illuminates the Spread of Breast Cancer to Bone
row.field_short_title: Mouse Study Illuminates the Spread of Breast Cancer to Bone
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about research into the mechanisms that allow breast cancer cells to invade bone and remain there for years before emerging to cause cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study provides clues on how cancer cells move in and out of bone.
row.field_list_description: Researchers have identified proteins that may regulate the movement of breast cancer cells into and out of bone marrow.

row.title: Adolescents Who Wouldn’t Have Smoked May Be Drawn to E-Cigarettes
row.field_short_title: Adolescents Who Wouldn’t Have Smoked May Be Drawn to E-Cigarettes
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on a recent study that suggest adolescents are not just using e-cigarettes as a substitute for conventional cigarettes but that e-cigarettes are attracting new users to tobacco products.
row.field_feature_card_description: E-cigarettes may be attracting adolescents who wouldn't have smoked to conventional tobacco products.
row.field_list_description: The findings from a recent study suggest that adolescents are not just using e-cigarettes as a substitute for conventional cigarettes but that e-cigarettes are attracting new users to tobacco products.

row.title: TCGA Data Leveraged for Developing FDA-Designated Breakthrough Therapy
row.field_short_title: TCGA Data Inform LOXO-101 Drug Development
row.field_page_description: Pharmaceutical company Loxo Oncology used TCGA data in research that led them to develop FDA-designated breakthrough therapy LOXO-101, a targeted therapy.
row.field_list_description: Pharmaceutical company Loxo Oncology used TCGA data in research that led them to develop FDA-designated breakthrough therapy LOXO-101, a promising new targeted therapy for treating cancers with TRK fusions.

row.title: Blue Ribbon Panel Report: The Power of the Cancer Community Coming Together
row.field_short_title: Blue Ribbon Panel Report: The Power of Coming Together
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog by the NCI acting director thanking the cancer community for contributing to the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel report, which was presented to the National Cancer Advisory Board on September 7.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI acting director thanks the cancer community for contributing to the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel report.
row.field_list_description: NCI Acting Director Dr. Douglas R. Lowy, M.D., thanks the cancer community for contributing to the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel report, which was presented to the National Cancer Advisory Board on September 7.

row.title: The Impact and Future of the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study: An Interview with Greg Armstrong, M.D.
row.field_short_title: Impact and Future of the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study
row.field_page_description: Dr. Greg Armstrong of the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study discusses this long-running study and its future.

row.title: RAS Screens and Assays at FNLCR
row.field_page_description: A primary goal of the RAS Initiative is to develop assays for RAS activity, localization, and signaling and adapt those assays so they can be used for finding new drug candidates. Explore the work leading to highly validated screening protocols.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the groups working to both develop assays for RAS activity, localization, and signaling and then adapt those assays to be used for finding new drug candidates.
row.field_list_description: A primary goal of the RAS Initiative at the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research (FNLCR) is to develop assays for RAS activity, localization, and signaling and adapt those assays so they can be used for finding new drug candidates.

row.title: Chromosomal Instability Score May Predict Response to Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Novel Cancer Biomarker May Predict Prognosis, Treatment Response
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a study of a new type of cancer biomarker that measures the extent of chromosomal instability as a way to potentially predict patient prognosis and help guide cancer treatment choices.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approach that measures extent of chromosomal instability may provide insight into tumor behavior.
row.field_list_description: A new study suggests that a chromosomal instability score may help guide treatment choices for patients with cancer.

row.title: Treatment Prevents Chemotherapy Side Effects for Children with Cancer
row.field_short_title: Treatment Prevents Chemotherapy Side Effects for Children with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Adding aprepitant to the anti-nausea drug ondansetron, with or without dexamethasone, effectively prevents chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in children.
row.field_feature_card_description: Adding aprepitant to the anti-nausea drug ondansetron, with or without dexamethasone, effectively prevents chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in children.
row.field_list_description: Final results from a phase III randomized clinical trial show that addition of aprepitant to the anti-nausea drug ondansetron, with or without dexamethasone, effectively prevents chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in pediatric patients.

row.title: NCI and the Precision Medicine Initiative®
row.field_short_title: NCI and the Precision Medicine Initiative®
row.field_page_description: NCI's activities related to precision medicine focuses on new and expanded precision medicine clinical trials; mechanisms to overcome drug resistance to cancer treatments; and developing a shared digital repository of precision medicine trials data.
row.field_feature_card_description: To improve patient outcomes, NCI is accelerating research on the molecular abnormalities that drive cancer.
row.field_list_description: Under this initiative, NCI is focusing on four broad areas: new and expanded precision medicine clinical trials; overcoming drug resistance to cancer treatments; developing new laboratory models for cancer research; and building and sharing a digital repository of data resulting from NCI-sponsored precision medicine clinical trials, all with the aim of bringing precision medicine into everyday clinical practice.

row.title: Nanotechnology for Treating Cancer: Pitfalls and Bridges on the Path to Nanomedicines
row.field_short_title: Nanotechnology for Treating Cancer: Pitfalls and Bridges on the Path to Nanomedicines
row.field_page_description: Despite their promise, only a few nano-formulated drugs are used in humans. The NCI Nanotechnology Characterization Lab helps companies and academic investigators maximize their chance of successful clinical use.

row.title: TAS-102 Improves Overall Survival in Patients with Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial that compared TAS-102 with placebo in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer whose disease progressed following prior treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: The drug extended the lives of patients whose disease had progressed following standard therapy.
row.field_list_description: In an international randomized phase III trial, the investigational drug TAS-102 extended the lives of patients with metastatic colorectal cancer whose disease had progressed following standard therapies.

row.title: Webinar Summary: A Conversation with NCI Acting Director, Dr. Douglas R Lowy
row.field_short_title: A Conversation with NCI Acting Director, Dr. Douglas R. Lowy

row.title: Extramural Funding
row.field_page_description: Find details about obligations for the NCI extramural research program, including grants and contracts.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find details about obligations for grants and contracts this fiscal year.
row.field_list_description: See the dollar amount and percent of NCI budget for grants and contracts.

row.title: Special Sources of Funds
row.field_page_description: Find details about Cooperative Research and Development Agreements (CRADAs) and other special funding sources, including the Stamp Out Breast Cancer Act.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find details about Cooperative Research and Development Agreements (CRADAs) and other special funding sources.
row.field_list_description: Find budget information for Cooperative Research and Development Agreements (CRADAs), royalty income, and the Stamp Out Breast Cancer Act funding.

row.title: Childhood Cancer Genomics Gaps and Opportunities: Identification of Research Priorities Workshop Summary
row.field_short_title: Childhood Cancer Genomics Gaps and Opportunities - Workshop Summary
row.field_page_description: NCI convened a workshop of representative research teams that have been leaders in defining the genomic landscape of childhood cancers to discuss the influence of genomic discoveries on the future of childhood cancer research.

row.title: NCI Historical Trends
row.field_page_description: Find information about the history of NCI appropriations and the Professional Judgment (Bypass) Budget, as well as data on funding trends and staffing levels.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about the history of NCI appropriations and the Professional Judgment (Bypass) Budget, as well as data on funding trends and staffing levels.
row.field_list_description: Since its establishment in 1937, the National Cancer Institute has served as a scientific cornerstone of the National Institutes of Health. Find information about the history of NCI appropriations and the Professional Judgment (Bypass) Budget, as well as data on funding trends and staffing levels.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Bone Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for bone cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Tool Weighs Benefits, Risks of Raloxifene or Tamoxifen to Prevent Breast Cancer
