row.field_feature_card_description: Information about NCI Director Norman Sharpless, M.D., and other senior NCI leaders.

row.title: Digital Standards for NCI Websites and Social Media
row.field_page_description: NCI digital standards provide content managers and developers guidance on content standards, visual design and branding, and policies and procedures in effect for NCI digital media.
row.field_feature_card_description: Content standards, visual design and branding standards, and policies and procedures in effect for NCI digital media.
row.field_list_description: The National Cancer Institute's digital standards provide content managers and developers guidance on content standards, visual design and branding standards, as well as policies and procedures in effect for NCI digital media.

row.title: Pembrolizumab Improves Overall Survival in Patients with Advanced Melanoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a randomized phase III study that showed pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) improved survival in patients with advanced melanoma compared with Ipilimumab (Yervoy®).
row.field_feature_card_description: Pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) improves survival in patients with advanced melanoma compared with Ipilimumab (Yervoy®).
row.field_list_description: In a randomized phase III study, pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) improved survival in patients with advanced melanoma compared with Ipilimumab (Yervoy®).

row.title: Download the NCI FYI Mobile App
row.field_short_title: Download the NCI FYI Mobile App
row.field_page_description: The NCI FYI mobile application offers a centralized source of available resources to fellows and trainees working at NCI in Maryland.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI FYI mobile application offers a centralized source of available resources to fellows and trainees working on the NIH main Campus in Bethesda, MD, off campus in the surrounding area in Rockville, MD and Frederick, MD.

row.title: CURE Spotlight: Cesar Castro, M.D. Develops Smartphone Technology for Cancer Detection in Underserved Communities
row.field_page_description: Dr. Cesar Castro, a former K12 CURE scholar, and a team of researchers have developed a smartphone-based technology that converts a smartphone into a tool for cancer diagnosis.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Castro developed technology that uses a smartphone as cancer diagnosis tool.

row.title: Preventing High-Risk Adenomas and Second Cancers in Colon Cancer Survivors
row.field_short_title: Preventing High-Risk Adenomas and Second Cancers in Colon Cancer Survivors
row.field_page_description: In this phase III trial, people who have had curative surgery for colon cancer will be randomly assigned to take sulindac and a placebo, eflornithine and a placebo, both sulindac and eflornithine, or two placebo pills for 36 months.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this phase III trial, people who have had curative surgery for colon cancer will be randomly assigned to take sulindac and a placebo, eflornithine and a placebo, both sulindac and eflornithine, or two placebo pills for 36 months.
row.field_list_description: In this phase III trial, people who have undergone curative surgery for stage 0-3 colon cancer, with or without adjuvant chemotherapy, will be randomly assigned to take sulindac and a placebo, eflornithine and a placebo, both sulindac and eflornithine, or two placebo pills for 36 months.

row.title: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on soft tissue sarcoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Uterine Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Most uterine cancers start in the endometrium, which is called endometrial cancer. Uterine sarcoma is a form of uterine cancer of the muscle and tissue that support the uterus. Find evidence-based information on uterine cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about uterine cancer.

row.title: Vulvar Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Vulvar cancer forms in a woman's external genitalia, and most often affects the outer vaginal lips. Having vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia or HPV infection can affect the risk of vulvar cancer. Find evidence-based information on vulvar cancer treatment, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about vulvar cancer.

row.title: Causes and Prevention Research
row.field_page_description: Find the latest research articles on cancer causes and risk factors for cancers and how some cancers may be prevented.
row.field_feature_card_description: The latest research on causes and risk factors for cancers and how some cancers may be prevented.
row.field_list_description: Find research articles on cancer causes and prevention, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Resources for Patients
row.field_page_description: Authoritative information about your type of cancer, as well as information on a wide range of cancer topics and the latest cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: We offer authoritative information about your type of cancer as well as general information about cancer, coping and other supportive care resources, and the latest cancer research. Also find NCI-supported clinical trials.

row.title: Information for the Cancer Research Community
row.field_short_title: Resources for the Cancer Research Community
row.field_page_description: Find research and development tools, datasets, information about research training programs, and basics about applying for and managing grants.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find NCI grants, training opportunities, information about the NCI grants process, and the latest research news.

row.title: Welcome to the New Cancer.gov
row.field_page_description: NCI has launched a new, dynamic, and easier-to-use version of NCI’s main websites, Cancer.gov and its counterpart in Spanish, Cancer.gov/espanol.
row.field_feature_card_description: What’s true for cancer research is true for websites: there’s no progress without change.

row.title: Building a Diverse Workforce
row.field_page_description: Find information about cancer research training for those from backgrounds underrepresented in cancer biomedical and behavioral sciences.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about training opportunities for those from populations typically underrepresented in cancer research careers.

row.title: Whole Brain Radiation for Some Patients with Brain Metastases Worsens Cognitive Decline
row.field_short_title: Brain Metastases Treatment Worsens Cognitive Decline
row.field_page_description: In some patients with cancer that has spread to the brain, whole brain radiation following radiosurgery causes more severe cognitive decline and does not improve survival compared with radiosurgery alone, a new study has found.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treating brain metastases with two forms of radiation may cause worse cognitive decline than just using one.

row.title: Enhancing the Clinical Trials Search Function on Cancer.gov
row.field_short_title: Enhancing the Clinical Trials Search Function on Cancer.gov
row.field_page_description: The enhanced clinical trials search function on Cancer.gov will allow users to more easily find accurate and timely information about active and recruiting NCI-supported clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find accurate, timely information about NCI-supported clinical trials.

row.title: Using Tandem Transplants to Treat Neuroblastoma
row.field_short_title: Using Tandem Transplants to Treat Neuroblastoma-Julie Park, M.D.
row.field_page_description: Learn how an NCI-supported trial led by Julie Park established a new standard of care for children with high-risk neuroblastoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: Julie Park, M.D., led a trial for neuroblastoma that changed the way the disease is treated in the United States.

row.title: Meticulous Reconstructions of Tumor Origins With Single-Cell DNA Sequencing: Researcher Interview with Nicholas Navin
row.field_short_title: Nicholas Navin on Single-Cell DNA Sequencing
row.field_page_description: A pioneer in single-cell DNA sequencing talks about the technology and the research it enables.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researcher Interview on Single-Cell DNA Sequencing
row.field_list_description: Dr. Nicholas Navin talks about single-cell DNA sequencing and his research, considerations for working in the single-cell sequencing space, and what’s next for his lab.

row.title: Olaparib after Initial Treatment Delays Ovarian Cancer Progression
row.field_short_title: Olaparib Maintenance Therapy Delays Ovarian Cancer Progression
row.field_page_description: Could results from the SOLO-1 trial change the standard of care for women with newly diagnosed ovarian cancer that harbors a BRCA mutation?
row.field_feature_card_description: The PARP inhibitor delayed progression of tumors with a BRCA mutation.
row.field_list_description: In a recent trial, the PARP inhibitor olaparib substantially delayed ovarian cancer from coming back after the first line of chemotherapy. Could the findings change the standard of care for newly diagnosed ovarian cancer with a BRCA mutation?

row.title: National CryoEM Facility Acknowledged User Publications
row.field_short_title: Acknowledged Publications from National CryoEM Facility’s Users
row.field_page_description: The National CryoEM Facility provides cancer researchers access to the latest technology for high resolution imaging. View a list of acknowledged publications from National CryoEM Facility’s users.
row.field_feature_card_description: View a list of acknowledged publications from National CryoEM Facility’s users.
row.field_list_description: View a list of acknowledged publications from National CryoEM Facility’s users. The National CryoEM Facility provides cancer researchers access to the latest technology for high resolution imaging.

row.title: TCGA Contact Information
row.field_page_description: Find contact information for The Cancer Genome Atlas Program.
row.field_list_description: For more information about The Cancer Genome Atlas program, reach out to a member of the team.

row.title: Teaching in Medical Education
row.field_page_description: The Teaching in Medical Education (TIME) course provides NCI postdoctoral fellows with basic knowledge in teaching methods, course planning, writing a syllabus and developing examinations. This course is for postdoctoral fellows interested in pursing an academic career at a medical school.

row.title: Vitamin D Supplements Don’t Reduce Cancer Incidence, Trial Shows
row.field_short_title: Vitamin D Supplements Don’t Reduce Cancer Incidence
row.field_page_description: Taking vitamin D supplements doesn’t decrease cancer risk, according to results from VITAL, the largest-ever clinical trial of vitamin D for cancer prevention.
row.field_feature_card_description: In the VITAL trial, the supplement did not lower the risk of developing cancer.
row.field_list_description: In the largest-ever randomized trial testing vitamin D for cancer prevention, the supplement did not lower the risk of developing cancer. The Vitamin D and Omega-3 Trial (VITAL) includes a nationally representative sample of nearly 26,000 participants.

row.title: Complementary and Alternative Medicine for Health Professionals
row.field_page_description: Health professional information about healing philosophies, approaches, and therapies used in complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) in cancer care.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Sunday O. Akintoye, B.D.S., D.D.S., M.S.- Studying the Biology of Bone Cells to Reduce Head and Neck Cancer Treatment Complications
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Sunday O. Akintoye, B.D.S., D.D.S., M.S.- Studying the Biology of Bone Cells
row.field_page_description: Dr. Sunday O. Akintoye, a CRCHD CURE grantee, is studying the behavior of jaw bone stem cells and complications related to cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Akintoye studies jaw bone stem cells and cancer-related complications.

row.title: Resources for News Media
row.field_page_description: Resources to help the news media provide accurate, timely information and disseminate cancer research news.
row.field_feature_card_description: Resources to help the news media provide accurate, timely information and disseminate cancer research news.

row.title: Who Will Respond to PD-1 Inhibition? Study Provides Clues
row.field_short_title: Who Will Respond to PD-1 Inhibition? Study Provides Clues
row.field_page_description: A new study shows that specific DNA changes in a tumor may help determine which patients are most likely to respond to treatment with PD-1 inhibitors

row.title: Mapping International Cancer Activities – Global Cancer Project Map Launch
row.field_short_title: Mapping International Cancer Activities – Global Cancer Project Map Launch
row.field_page_description: CGH’s Dr. Sudha Sivaram, Dr. Makeda Williams, and Ms. Kalina Duncan have partnered with Drs. Ami Bhatt and Franklin Huang at Global Oncology, Inc. (GO) to develop the Global Cancer Project Map - a web-based tool designed to facilitate cancer research and control activity planning.

row.title: Blogs and Newsletters
row.field_page_description: Blogs and newsletters featured on the Cancer.gov website.
row.field_feature_card_description: Blogs and newsletters featured on Cancer.gov.

row.title: Data Types Collected by TCGA
row.field_page_description: Learn about the molecular and clinical data generated for TCGA samples.
row.field_list_description: Documentation of sample processing and the molecular and clinical data generated for TCGA's samples, including case enrollment, processing of biospeciments into molecular analytes, and the different types of molecular characterization.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of clear cell renal cell (kidney) carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: FDA Approves First Immunotherapy Treatment for Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves First Immunotherapy Treatment for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved nivolumab to treat patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer that has progressed during or after treatment with platinum-based chemotherapy.

row.title: Sleep Problems (Insomnia) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Sleep problems are a common side effect during cancer treatment. Learn how a polysomnogram can assess sleep problems. Learn about the benefits of managing sleep disorders in men and women with cancer.
row.field_list_description: Information about sleep problems, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage them.

row.title: Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, 1975 -2011: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, 1975 -2011: Questions and Answers
row.field_page_description: This report provides a yearly update of cancer incidence (new cases) and mortality (death) rates, and trends in these rates in the United States. The special feature section of this year’s report highlights the incidence of breast cancer subtypes by race,
row.field_list_description: This report provides a yearly update of cancer incidence (new cases) and mortality (death) rates, and trends in these rates in the United States. The special feature section of this year’s report highlights the incidence of breast cancer subtypes by race, ethnicity, poverty level and state.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Tailored Psychotherapy Eases Depression in People with Advanced Cancer
row.field_short_title: Easing Depression in People with Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: In people recently diagnosed with advanced cancer, a tailored psychotherapy approach called CALM lessened symptoms of depression, results from a clinical trial show. The approach also may help prevent depression, this Cancer Currents post explains.
row.field_feature_card_description: Tailored psychotherapy approach helps combat common problem.
row.field_list_description: Just three to six sessions of a tailored psychotherapy approach called CALM helped to lessen symptoms of depression in people recently diagnosed with advanced cancer, results from a clinical trial show. The approach also may help prevent depression, researchers found.

row.title: Enhancements to NCI’s SEER Program Creating New Research Opportunities
row.field_page_description: NCI’s SEER program is expanding and operating a series of pilot studies that, as Dr. Lynne Penberthy explains, are focused on the routine collection of more clinical and genomic data to help researchers better understand cancer and its impact.
row.field_feature_card_description: Pilot studies focused on collecting more clinical, genomic data.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s SEER program is expanding in size and operating a series of innovative pilot studies. As Dr. Lynne Penberthy explains, these studies are setting the stage for the routine collection of more clinical and genomic data that will help researchers better understand cancer and its impact.

row.title: Two Drugs Work Together to Block ‘Master Regulator’ of Breast, Other Cancers
row.field_short_title: Drug Combination Blocks Driver of Breast and Other Cancers
row.field_page_description: Arsenic trioxide and retinoic acid work together to target Pin1, a master regulator protein that drives breast and other cancers. The findings could spur clinical trials, as this Cancer Currents blog explains.
row.field_feature_card_description: Drugs work together to slow triple-negative breast cancer in mice.
row.field_list_description: Arsenic trioxide and retinoic acid work together to target the master regulator protein Pin1, a new study shows. In cancer cell lines and mice, the drug combination slowed the growth of triple-negative breast cancer tumors.

row.title: Public Health Research and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Population-based cancer research can provide important information that influences practices, policies, and programs that directly affect and could improve public health.
row.field_feature_card_description: Studying cancer and its burden on a population-wide scale can provide information that directly affects the health of millions of people.
row.field_list_description: Studying cancer and its burden on a population-wide scale can provide important information that influences practices, policies, and programs that directly affect the health of millions of people in the United States each year.

row.title: Talking about Your Advanced Cancer
row.field_feature_card_description: Knowing your options and sharing them with others will make it easier for you to move forward with your care.

row.title: Advanced Cancer and Caregivers
row.field_page_description: Learn tips for taking care of yourself, coping with your feelings and grief, asking for help, ,communicating with your loved one about their wishes for care, talking to children about death
row.field_list_description: Being a caregiver an advanced or metastatic cancer patient can be very hard and challenging in many ways. Learn tips for taking care of yourself and how to handle the challenges that arise during this time.

row.title: Planning for the Caregiver
row.field_page_description: Caring for someone with advanced cancer brings its own challenges and concerns. Here are some planning tips that may help.
row.field_feature_card_description: Caring for someone with advanced cancer brings its own challenges and concerns. Here are some planning tips that may help.

row.title: Accrual Reporting
row.field_page_description: An overview of accrual reporting requirements of clinical trials into the Clinical Trial Reporting Program.
row.field_feature_card_description: An overview of accrual reporting requirements of clinical trials.

row.title: Complementary and Alternative Medicine for Patients
row.field_page_description: Patient information about philosophies, approaches, and therapies used in complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) in cancer care.

row.title: DNA "Minicircles" Could Improve Cancer Detection, Study Suggests
row.field_short_title: DNA "Minicircles" Could Improve Cancer Detection, Study Suggests
row.field_page_description: Injecting customized DNA “rings” into tumor-bearing mice caused the tumor cells to release a biomarker that can be detected with a simple blood test.

row.title: Previous NCI Directors
row.field_page_description: Find a listing of the previous directors of NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find a listing of the previous directors of NCI.

row.title: The Exceptional Responders Initiative: Welcoming More Cases
row.field_short_title: The Exceptional Responders Initiative: Welcoming More Cases
row.field_page_description: The initiative is studying tissue, clinical, and genomic data from patients with cancer who have had dramatic and long-lasting responses to standard and experimental treatments that were not seen in similar patients who received the same treatment.

row.title: Mouse Study Links Immune Cells to Diarrhea Caused by Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Immune Cells Linked to Diarrhea Caused by Chemotherapy
row.field_page_description: A study in mice sheds light onto how some chemotherapies cause diarrhea. The findings could be the basis for developing new treatments for patients with cancer who develop gastrointestinal side effects from chemotherapy, explains this Cancer Currents blog post.
row.field_feature_card_description: The findings in mice may lead to new treatments for this common side effect.
row.field_list_description: A study in mice sheds light onto how some chemotherapies cause diarrhea. The findings could be the basis for developing new treatments for patients with cancer who develop gastrointestinal side effects from chemotherapy.

row.title: CAR T Cells: Engineering Patients’ Immune Cells to Treat Their Cancers
row.field_short_title: CAR T Cells: Engineering Immune Cells to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Research on CAR T-cell therapy—a rapidly emerging form of cancer treatment, primarily for blood cancers like leukemia and lymphoma—is moving at a swift pace.
row.field_feature_card_description: The field is poised to deliver new approved treatments.
row.field_list_description: CAR T-cell therapy is a rapidly emerging form of cancer treatment, primarily for blood cancers like leukemia and lymphoma. An article about research to improve CAR T-cell therapy and expand its use.

row.title: Contact the Office of Advocacy Relations
row.field_page_description: Contact information for the Office of Advocacy Relations, including staff directory.
row.field_feature_card_description: OAR contact information, including staff directory.

row.title: Research Career Awards “K” Program
row.field_page_description: Career development "K" awards are a significant component of NCI’s training effort. See funding amounts and the percentage of total research career award funding.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find information about "K" awards and the percentage of total research career award funding.
row.field_list_description: See the number and dollar amount for career development "K" awards and the percent of total research career award funding.

row.title: Program Spotlight: CURE Scholars Participate in Annual Mock Grant Review to Prepare for Independent Research Careers
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: CURE Scholars Participate in Annual Mock Grant Review
row.field_page_description: As part of its 2015 Professional Development Workshop, CRCHD held a mock review session for CURE scholars, trainees, and investigators to enhance their understanding of the grant review process and provide insight on successful grant applications.
row.field_feature_card_description: CRCHD held a mock grant review to enhance understanding of the grant review process.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Cholangiocarcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Cholangiocarcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Cholangiocarcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of cholangiocarcinoma (bile duct cancer), including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Colorectal Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Colorectal Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Colorectal Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of colorectal (colon and rectal) carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Glioblastoma Multiforme
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Glioblastoma Multiforme
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Glioblastoma Multiforme
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of glioblastoma multiforme brain tumors, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma

row.title: The International Rare Cancer Initiative
row.field_page_description: The International Rare cancer Initiative focuses on rare cancers because they are a pressing public health priority. Read more to learn about how CGH pushes for practice-changing clinical trials in rare cancers.
row.field_list_description: The International Rare cancer Initiative focuses on rare cancers because they are a pressing public health priority, and pushes for practice-changing clinical trials in rare cancers.

row.title: Create a Pediatric Immunotherapy Discovery and Development Network (PI-DDN)
row.field_page_description: This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to establish a pediatric cancer immunotherapy network to discover and characterize new targets for immunotherapies and ultimately develop new, effective immunotherapy treatments for children and adolescents with cancer.
row.field_list_description: Generate a cancer immunotherapy research network to overcome challenges in the development of immunotherapies for childhood cancers.

row.title: Moxetumomab Approved by FDA for Hairy Cell Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Moxetumomab Approved for Hairy Cell Leukemia
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved moxetumomab pasudotox (Lumoxiti), a bacterial toxin–based drug, for the treatment of hairy cell leukemia (HCL). The approval covers the use of moxetumomab in patients with HCL who have already undergone standard treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Bacterial-toxin based drug developed at NCI.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved moxetumomab pasudotox (Lumoxiti), a bacterial toxin–based drug, for the treatment of some patients with hairy cell leukemia (HCL). Moxetumomab is approved to treat patients with HCL who have already undergone at least two lines of standard treatments.

row.title: Reflections on My First Year as NCI Director
row.field_short_title: Reflections on My First Year as NCI Director
row.field_page_description: October 2018 marked Dr. Norman Sharpless’s one-year anniversary as NCI director. He reflects on noteworthy events from the past 12 months.
row.field_feature_card_description: Norman Sharpless, M.D., reflects on noteworthy events from the past 12 months.
row.field_list_description: October 2018 marked Dr. Norman Sharpless’s one-year anniversary as NCI director. He reflects on noteworthy events from the past 12 months and his excitement about leading NCI at such a critical juncture in the history of cancer research.

row.title: Eight Factors May Link Disparities in Cancer Death Rates and Income
row.field_short_title: Factors May Link Disparities in Cancer Death Rates, Income
row.field_page_description: Eight factors may explain more than 80% of the relationship between poverty and disparities in cancer death rates, according to a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Eight factors may explain the link between poverty and cancer death disparities.
row.field_list_description: Eight factors may explain more than 80% of the relationship between poverty and disparities in cancer death rates at the county level, according to a new study. The largest mediator was a surprise to the researchers.

row.title: Study Improves the Quality of Biopsy Specimens for Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Improving the Quality of Cancer Research Biopsy Specimens
row.field_page_description: NCI researchers have developed and tested recommendations for improving the quality of biopsy specimens collected from patients in cancer clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study provides recommendations for research teams.
row.field_list_description: An NCI-led team of researchers has developed and tested recommendations for improving the quality of biopsy specimens collected from patients participating in cancer clinical trials.

row.title: SDH-deficient gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST)
row.field_page_description: SDH-deficient gastrointestinal stromal tumor, or SDH-deficient GIST, is a type of digestive tract cancer. GIST is a fairly common type of cancer, but SDH-deficient GIST makes up only about 6% of GIST diagnoses. Learn more about how this tumor an run in families, the treatment, and the prognosis.
row.field_list_description: SDH-deficient gastrointestinal stromal tumor, or SDH-deficient GIST, is a type of digestive tract cancer. GIST is a fairly common type of cancer, but SDH-deficient GIST makes up only about 6% of GIST diagnoses.

row.title: Rare Tumor Workshops
row.field_page_description: MyPART holds workshops to help scientists learn what to study about rare cancer and share research. Also, advocates discuss issues important to patients, clinicians share their experience treating the rare cancer, and FDA representatives help design experiments and clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Workshops help scientists learn what to study about rare cancer and connect them with advocates, clinicians, and FDA representatives.
row.field_list_description: We hold workshops in the Center for Cancer Research to help scientists learn what to study about rare cancer. During the workshops, scientists share research, advocates discuss issues important to patients, clinicians share their experience treating the rare cancer, and FDA representatives help design experiments and clinical trials with the best chance of drug approval.

row.title: Alveolar soft part sarcomas
Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor
row.field_page_description: Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, or IMT, forms in tissues called mucosal surfaces and mesentery. IMT usually starts in the lung, but it can also begin in many other places. IMTs are mostly found in children and young adults but can occur at any age. Learn more about treatment and the prognosis for IMT.
row.field_feature_card_description: Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, or IMT, forms in tissues called mucosal surfaces and mesentery. IMTs are mostly found in children and young adults but can occur at any age.
row.field_list_description: Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, or IMT, forms in tissues called mucosal surfaces and mesentery. IMT usually starts in the lung, but it can also begin in many other places, including the bladder, uterus, larynx, stomach, liver, and intestine. IMTs are mostly found in children and young adults but can occur at any age.

row.title: Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma
row.field_page_description: Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma (EHE or eHAE), is a rare cancer that grows from the cells that make up blood vessels.Because EHE is so rare, there is no standard treatment. Learn more about the diagnosis, treatment, and prognosis for this rare tumor.
row.field_feature_card_description: Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma (EHE or eHAE), is a rare cancer that grows from the cells that make up blood vessels.
row.field_list_description: Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma (EHE or eHAE), is a rare cancer that grows from the cells that make up blood vessels. This cancer can occur anywhere in the body with the most common sites being the bones, liver, and lungs.

row.title: Natural History Study of Rare Solid Tumors
row.field_short_title: Natural History Study of Rare Solid Tumors
row.field_page_description: By taking part in a natural history study, you can speed up the development of new treatments by giving researchers the tools they need to understand how cancer forms and grows and to find new treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: You can help speed up the development of new treatments by giving researchers the tools they need.
row.field_list_description: The purpose of a natural history study is to collect information, tissue and tumor samples, and data from patients to better understand how cancer develops and grows. When researchers don’t know how cancer grows it is much harder to design trials to test new treatments. Natural history studies help researchers understand cancer better.

row.title: New Research
Rare Tumors
row.field_page_description: Rare tumors can form anywhere in the body. MyPART is studying tumors in several different body systems.

row.title: Research
row.field_page_description: MyPART is working to address the challenges researchers face in studying rare cancers so we can find new treatments faster.
row.field_feature_card_description: MyPART is working to address the challenges researchers face in studying rare cancers.

row.title: The Pathway to Independence Award for Outstanding Early Stage Postdoctoral Researchers (K99/R00)
row.field_page_description: The early K99/R00 will help researchers to complete n needed mentored training and transition in a timely manner to independent, tenure-track or equivalent.
row.field_list_description: The NIH Pathway to Independence Award for Outstanding Early Stage Postdoctoral Researchers (K99/R00) supports outstanding postdoctoral researchers who do not require extended periods of mentored research training beyond their doctoral degrees before transitioning to research independence, which is common for those working in data science and cancer control science.

row.title: NIH Fellows Editorial Board Editorial Process Guidelines
row.field_page_description: Board members will review submitted documents following an editorial process and prepare final reports.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of lung squamous cell carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Nivolumab and Ipilimumab Effective against Melanoma That Has Spread to the Brain
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Drugs Shrink Brain Metastases from Melanoma
row.field_page_description: In patients with melanoma that has spread to the brain, the combination of the immune checkpoint inhibitors nivolumab (Opdivo) and ipilimumab (Yervoy) halted the growth of or shrank metastatic brain tumors, an early phase clinical trial shows.
row.field_feature_card_description: Tumors shrink in some patients treated with checkpoint inhibitor combination.
row.field_list_description: Results from a clinical trial show that the combination of nivolumab (Opdivo) and ipilimumab (Yervoy) halted the growth of or shrank metastatic brain tumors in more than half of participants with melanoma that had spread to the brain.

row.title: Annual Plan and Budget Proposal FY 2020 Coming Soon
row.field_short_title: Annual Plan and Budget Proposal FY 2020 Coming Soon
row.field_page_description: Annual Plan and Budget Proposal FY 2020 Coming Soon

row.title: The R50 Research Specialist Award: Ensuring a Stable Cancer Research Workforce
row.field_short_title: Ensuring a Stable Cancer Research Workforce
row.field_page_description: NCI’s R50 Research Specialist Award was launched in 2016 to help sustain a stable workforce of experienced scientists who can take fullest advantage of advanced technologies and the era of big data.
row.field_feature_card_description: R50 award supports experienced cancer research specialists.
row.field_list_description: With the increasing reliance on advanced technologies and the rise of big data in cancer research, NCI launched the R50 Research Specialist Award to help sustain a stable workforce of experienced scientists who can take fullest advantage of these tools and resources.

row.title: Resources for Researchers
row.field_page_description: Resources for Researchers is a directory of NCI-supported tools and services for cancer researchers.

row.title: Shining a Spotlight on Tumor Exosomes
row.field_short_title: Shining a Spotlight on Tumor Exosomes-David Lyden M.D., Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Learn how NCI support is helping researcher David Lyden understand how cancer cell exosomes create a nurturing environment for the growth of metastatic tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Pediatric neuro-oncologist David Lyden, M.D., Ph.D., studies exosomes to uncover the steps of cancer cell metastasis.

row.title: Working to Reduce the Cancer Burden Caused by Tobacco
row.field_short_title: Working to Reduce the Cancer Burden Caused by Tobacco-Michael Fiore, M.D., M.P.H., M.B.A.
row.field_page_description: Tobacco use in the US continues to cause great harm. Learn about Dr. Michael Fiore and his NCI working group’s recommendations on Tobacco Control Research Priorities for the Next Decade.
row.field_feature_card_description: Michael Fiore, M.D., M.P.H., M.B.A., helped to spearhead an NCI working group that recommended tobacco research priorities.

row.title: Combination of Immunotherapy Drugs Approved for Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Combination Approved for Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: The combination of the immune checkpoint inhibitors ipilimumab (Yervoy) and nivolumab (Opdivo) has been approved by FDA for the treatment of patients with metastatic colorectal cancer whose tumor cells have DNA repair defects.
row.field_feature_card_description: Ipilimumab plus nivolumab approved to treat tumors with DNA repair defects.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved the combination of the immune checkpoint inhibitors ipilimumab (Yervoy) and nivolumab (Opdivo) for the treatment of patients with metastatic colorectal cancer whose tumor cells have defects that affect their ability to repair DNA.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Cutaneous Melanoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Cutaneous Melanoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Cutaneous Melanoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of cutaneous (skin) melanoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Lower Grade Glioma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Lower Grade Glioma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Lower Grade Glioma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Lower Grade Glioma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of lower grade glioma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Targeted Drug Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia with IDH1 Gene Mutations
row.field_short_title: Ivosidenib Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved ivosidenib (Tibsovo) for the treatment of adults with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) that has a specific mutation in a gene called IDH1. Ivosidenib becomes the first FDA-approved treatment that targets IDH1.
row.field_feature_card_description: First FDA-approved drug that targets IDH1 gene mutations.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved ivosidenib (Tibsovo) for the treatment of adults with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) that has a specific mutation in a gene called IDH1. Ivosidenib becomes the first FDA-approved IDH1-targeted treatment.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma
row.field_page_description: Find information about drugs for Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma. The drugs listed have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and include both generic and brand names.

row.title: Study Provides Closer Look at Postmenopausal Bleeding and Endometrial Cancer
row.field_short_title: Closer Look at Postmenopausal Bleeding and Endometrial Cancer
row.field_page_description: A new study shows that 90% of postmenopausal women diagnosed with endometrial cancer reported vaginal bleeding before their diagnosis. Approximately 9% of women who saw a doctor for bleeding, the study showed, later received an endometrial cancer diagnosis.
row.field_feature_card_description: Bleeding after menopause common prior to diagnosis.
row.field_list_description: A new study has found that 90% of postmenopausal women diagnosed with endometrial cancer reported vaginal bleeding before their diagnosis. Approximately 9% of postmenopausal women who saw a doctor for bleeding, the study showed, later received an endometrial cancer diagnosis.

row.title: Program Spotlight: 2015 Scientific Poster Winners at CRCHD Professional Development Workshop
row.field_page_description: As part of its 2015 Professional Development Workshop, CURE scholars, trainees, and investigators participated in a competitive poster session – providing participants with an opportunity to present research findings and future research plans.
row.field_feature_card_description: CURE scholars participated in a poster session at the 2015 PDW.

row.title: U.S. Indoor Tanning Rates Are Dropping, But Still High
row.field_short_title: U.S. Indoor Tanning Rates Are Dropping, But Still High
row.field_page_description: Study estimates about 1.6 million fewer women and 400,000 fewer men tan indoors, but it’s still a common practice.
row.field_feature_card_description: Millions of women and men continue to use devices such as tanning beds that raise the risk of skin cancer.

row.title: NCI-Designated Cancer Centers Expand, Four Awarded Comprehensive Designation
row.field_short_title: NCI-Designated Cancer Centers Expand, Four Awarded Comprehensive Designation
row.field_page_description: NCI’s cancer centers program added a new institution and awarded the comprehensive designation to four existing NCI-designated centers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The program has added a new institution and awarded the comprehensive designation to four existing NCI cancer centers.
row.field_list_description: In July 2015, the NCI’s cancer centers program expanded by adding a new institution and awarding the comprehensive designation to four existing NCI-designated cancer centers.

row.title: FDA Approves Talimogene Laherparepvec to Treat Metastatic Melanoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves T-VEC to Treat Metastatic Melanoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved the first oncolytic virus therapy, talimogene laherparepvec (T-VEC). The drug was approved for the treatment of metastatic melanoma that cannot be removed surgically.
row.field_feature_card_description: The drug is the first oncolytic virus therapy to be approved.

row.title: Public Health Service Act
row.field_page_description: Information on the Public Health Service Act and related legislation that directly impacted the mission of NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: Public Health Service Act

row.title: NCI's Clinical Trials Programs and Initiatives
row.field_page_description: Information about NCI programs and initiatives that sponsor, conduct, develop, or support clinical trials, including NCI’s Clinical Trial Network (NCTN) and NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) initiatives.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about NCI programs and initiatives that sponsor, conduct, develop, or support clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: Information about NCI programs and initiatives that sponsor, conduct, develop, or support clinical trials, including NCI’s Clinical Trial Network (NCTN) and NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) initiatives to transform cancer clinical trials to be more flexible and responsive to the rapid advances being made in oncologic sciences.

row.title: Clinical Trials Information for Patients and Caregivers
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials Information for Patients and Caregivers
row.field_page_description: Explains clinical trials, including what they are, why they are important, things to think about when deciding to take part, and questions to ask your doctor.
row.field_feature_card_description: What clinical trials are, why they are important, and things to think about and ask when deciding to take part.
row.field_list_description: This section contains basic information about clinical trials, including why clinical trials are important, things to think about when deciding to take part, and questions to ask your doctor.

row.title: Treating Multiply Relapsed or Refractory Hairy Cell Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Treating Multiply Relapsed or Refractory Hairy Cell Leukemia
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with hairy cell leukemia who have not responded or relapsed after initial chemotherapy will be randomly assigned to receive rituximab combined with either pentostatin or bendamustine.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this trial, patients with hairy cell leukemia who have not responded or relapsed after initial chemotherapy will be randomly assigned to receive rituximab combined with either pentostatin or bendamustine.
row.field_list_description: In this trial, patients with hairy cell leukemia who have not responded to initial chemotherapy followed by second-line treatment with rituximab, or who have relapsed following two courses of chemotherapy, will be randomly assigned to receive rituximab combined with either pentostatin or bendamustine.

row.title: Cancer Research Education Grants Program (R25)
Cancer Education and Career Development Program (R25T)
row.field_page_description: Institutional award for predoctoral or postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who are pursuing careers in cancer prevention, control, behavioral, and population sciences or transdisciplinary sciences.

row.title: Mentored Quantitative Research Career Award (K25)
row.field_page_description: For postdoctoral candidates, mentored junior faculty and senior faculty who are pursuing careers in transdisciplinary sciences.

row.title: Established Investigator Award in Cancer Prevention and Control (K05)
Eating Hints: Before, during, and after Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Eating Hints: Before, during, and after Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Eating Hints covers eating problems that may be caused by cancer and its treatment. Learn about common eating problems and ways to manage them.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about eating problems patients may have during treatment for cancer and ways to manage.
row.field_list_description: Covers eating problems that patients may have during treatment for cancer and ways to manage them.

row.title: Adding Chemotherapy to Radiation Improves Survival for Some Patients with Rare Brain Cancer
row.field_short_title: Adding Chemotherapy to Radiation Improves Survival for Some Patients with Rare Brain Cancer
row.field_page_description: Long-term results from two clinical trials confirm that certain patients with anaplastic oligodendrogliomas live substantially longer if they are treated with a combination of chemotherapy and radiation therapy rather than radiatiation alone.
row.field_feature_card_description: Long-term results from two clinical trials confirm that certain patients with anaplastic oligodendrogliomas live substantially longer if they are treated with a combination of chemotherapy and radiation therapy rather than radiatiation alone.
row.field_list_description: Long-term results from two clinical trials confirm that certain patients with rare brain tumors called anaplastic oligodendrogliomas live substantially longer if they are treated with a combination of chemotherapy and radiation therapy rather than radiation alone.

row.title: Daratumumab Improves Progression-Free Survival for Patients with Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: Daratumumab for Multiple Myeloma Improves Progression-Free Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that daratumumab plus lenalidomide and dexamethasone improved progression-free survival for patients with relapsed or refractory disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Daratumumab plus lenalidomide and dexamethasone improved survival for patients with relapsed or refractory disease.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial showed that adding daratumumab to lenalidomide and dexamethasone improved progression-free survival among patients with relapsed or refractory disease, compared with lenalidomide and dexamethasone alone.

row.title: Selected Interviews with Dr. Doug Lowy
row.field_page_description: In these selected interviews, Douglas R. Lowy, M.D., Deputy Director of the National Cancer Institute (NCI), talks with media and scientific institutions about basic science, clinical research, and the work of NCI.

row.title: U.S. Cancer Mortality Rates Falling, But Some Regions Left Behind, Study Finds
row.field_short_title: County-Level Disparities Found in Cancer Deaths
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a study that showed the rate of cancer deaths in the U.S. is declining overall but increasing in some counties.
row.field_feature_card_description: Despite overall improvements, study shows deaths from cancer distributed unequally in the U.S.
row.field_list_description: A study of nationwide mortality data found that, while cancer deaths in the U.S. dropped between 1980 and 2014, disparities persisted, and in 160 counties cancer mortality rose substantially.

row.title: TMEN Investigators
row.field_page_description: TMEN funded cancer research grants investigating the mechanisms of a tumor’s interaction with its surrounding environment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Research Projects studying the tumor microenvironment funded by TMEN
row.field_list_description: A list of grants funded by the Tumor Microenvironment Network to conduct cancer research investigating the mechanisms of tumor-host interactions in human cancer.

row.title: OHAM Research Activities
row.field_page_description: OHAM manages HIV/AIDS research and shares oversight for activities across NCI and NIH. Learn how OHAM is addressing the diverse population of HIV/AIDS patients.
row.field_feature_card_description: OHAM manages four research programs and shares oversight for HIV/AIDS research activities across NCI and NIH.
row.field_list_description: OHAM manages four research programs and shares oversight for trans-NIH and international activities that extend across the spectrum of research, training, international studies, and clinical trials to address the diverse population of HIV/AIDS patients.

row.title: Specialized Programs of Research Excellence (SPOREs)
row.field_page_description: SPOREs enable the rapid movement of basic findings into clinical settings and help determine the biological basis for research observations. See funding for SPORE programs by mechanism and cancer site.
row.field_feature_card_description: See funding for SPORE programs by mechanism and cancer site.
row.field_list_description: Displays the number and dollar amount of P50 and co-funded SPOREs.

row.field_feature_card_description: Find information about funding by mechanism in past fiscal years.

row.title: What’s New Online from NCI?
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.
row.field_feature_card_description: Update about new websites and online content from NCI

row.title: Improved Strategies for Cancer Prevention and Early Detection
row.field_short_title: Improved Strategies for Cancer Prevention and Early Detection
row.field_page_description: The prevention of cancer and the development of more effective strategies to detect cancer precursors and early stage cancers, when treatment may be most effective, remain critical goals.

row.title: Bioinformatics, Big Data, and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers take on challenges and opportunities to mine big data for answers to complex biological questions. Learn how bioinformatics uses advanced computing, mathematics, and technological platforms to store, manage, analyze, and understand data.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers take on challenges and opportunities to mine big data for answers to complex biological questions.
row.field_list_description: The focus of bioinformatics is to establish an infrastructure to store, analyze, integrate, and visualize large amounts of biological data and related information—big data—as well as provide access to it.

row.title: Genomic Data Access
row.field_page_description: Information for NIH staff and extramural investigators on how to get a dbGaP account and how to request controlled-access data.

row.title: Advisory Board Meetings
row.field_page_description: Upcoming meetings and recent meeting proceedings for NCAB and BSA.
row.field_feature_card_description: Stay up to date on upcoming meetings and recent meeting proceedings for advisory boards that advise the National Cancer Institute and the NCI Director.
row.field_list_description: Stay up to date on upcoming meetings and recent meeting proceedings for the National Cancer Advisory Board (NCAB) and the Board of Scientific Advisors (BSA).

row.title: TAILORx Trial Shows Women at Low Risk for Breast Cancer Recurrence May Forgo Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: TAILORx Trial Shows Women at Low Risk for Breast Cancer Recurring May Forgo Chemo
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from the Trial Assigning Individualized Options for Treatment, or TAILORx, finds that women with early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer have a low risk of recurrence based on a test for the expression of 21 genes.
row.field_feature_card_description: The TAILORx trial finds that a molecular test associated with breast cancer recurrence can predict who may benefit from chemotherapy.
row.field_list_description: Initial findings from the Trial Assigning Individualized Options for Treatment, or TAILORx, finds that women with early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer have a low risk of recurrence based on a test for the expression of 21 genes.

row.title: Targeting RAL-GEF signaling and cytokines in KRAS driven lung cancer
row.field_short_title: Targeting RAL-GEF signaling and cytokines in KRAS driven lung cancer
row.field_page_description: David Barbie's laboratory seeks to understand how cytokine production stimulated by mutant KRAS influences cancer growth. Inhibitors could improve treatments of cancers driven by mutant KRAS.

row.title: Hormone Replacement Therapy May Improve Survival for Women with Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: Hormone Replacement Therapy May Improve Survival for Women with Ovarian Cancer
row.field_page_description: The randomized, controlled Adjuvant Hormone Therapy trial was launched in 1990 to assess the effects of estrogen-alone hormone replacement therapy in women treated for epithelial ovarian cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Estrogen may benefit women treated for ovarian cancer
row.field_list_description: Study suggests that the use of estrogen-alone hormone replacement therapy may improve overall survival of women treated for epithelial ovarian cancer.

row.title: Funding Opportunity: Genomic Data Analysis Network Centers
row.field_page_description: Funding Opportunity CCG, Funding Opportunity Center for Cancer Genomics, CCG, Center for Cancer Genomics, CCG RFA, Center for cancer genomics rfa, genomic data analysis network, genomic data analysis network centers,
row.field_feature_card_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) has published three companion Funding Opportunity Announcements (FOAs) for Genomic Data Analysis Network Centers to support programs of the Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG).
row.field_list_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) has published three companion Funding Opportunity Announcements (FOAs) for Genomic Data Analysis Network Centers to support programs of the Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG). The FOAs are managed by CCG and solicit applications for a Processing Genomic Data Center, a Visualization Genomic Data Center, and a Specialized Genomic Data Center.

row.title: Shared Decision Making to Improve Cancer Screening Choices
row.field_short_title: Shared Decision Making in Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: A research update article about helping patients make informed decisions about cancer screening that reflect their own values and preferences.
row.field_feature_card_description: Shared decision making helps patients make informed decisions about cancer screening that reflect their own values and preferences.
row.field_list_description: In an effort to help patients make informed decisions and involve them more directly in critical medical decisions related to cancer screening, experts are turning to shared decision making.

row.title: NCI Research Specialist Award (R50)
row.field_page_description: Award enables scientists to pursue stable research careers within an existing cancer research program, but not serve as independent investigators.
row.field_feature_card_description: Enables scientists to pursue stable careers within an existing, NCI-funded cancer research program. Applications due by Jan. 11, 2019.

row.title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Some Melanomas and Lung Cancers
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Some Melanomas and Lung Cancers
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved nivolumab in combination with ipilimumab for advanced melanoma and nivolumab alone for advanced nonsquamous lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The FDA has approved nivolumab for use against some melanomas and lung cancers.

row.title: Legislative Activities
row.field_page_description: Find information on current and past legislation along with resources to learn more on congressional activities impacting NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about NCI-specific legislation, past and present, and related congressional information.

row.title: FDA Approves Irinotecan Liposome to Treat Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Irinotecan Liposome to Treat Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: Patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer that has progressed after receiving gemcitabine-based chemotherapy now have a new treatment option: irinotecan liposome in combination with fluorouracil and leucovorin.
row.field_feature_card_description: When combined with fluorouracil and leucovorin, the three-drug combination is used to treat pancreatic cancer.

row.title: The Cancer Genome Atlas: More Than a Large Collection of Data
row.field_short_title: TCGA: More Than a Large Collection of Data
row.field_page_description: Though TCGA will wrap up in 2016 with a concluding symposium, cancer genomics projects built upon the success of TCGA will continue to play a major part in the NCI’s mission to better understand and treat cancer in the years to come.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Cancer Screening
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: In this audio clip, Drs. Lisa Schwartz and Steven Woloshin of the Dartmouth Institute for Health Policy discuss the benefits and harms of cancer screening and highlight popular misconceptions about cancer screening statistics.
row.field_feature_card_description: An audio clip of Drs. Lisa Schwartz and Steven Woloshin of the Dartmouth Institute for Health Policy discussing the benefits and harms of cancer screening.

row.title: Tackling the Conundrum of Cachexia in Cancer
row.field_short_title: Tackling the Conundrum of Cachexia in Cancer
row.field_page_description: An article about why and how some patients with cancer develop a wasting syndrome that causes dramatic loss of muscle mass and substantial weight loss.
row.field_feature_card_description: An article about why and how some patients with cancer develop a wasting syndrome that causes dramatic loss of muscle mass and substantial weight loss.

row.title: NCI Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities (CRCHD)
row.field_page_description: The Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities (CRCHD) is central to NCI’s efforts to reduce the unequal burden of cancer in our society via basic and community research, as well as networks, and to train the next generation of competitive researchers from diverse populations in cancer and cancer health disparities res
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI established CRCHD to help reduce the unequal burden of cancer in our society.

row.title: Cancer Detection, Diagnosis, and Treatment Technologies for Global Health: Supporting the development of low-cost technologies for LMICs
row.field_short_title: Cancer Detection, Diagnosis, and Treatment Technologies for Global Health
row.field_page_description: NCI, Center for Global Health supports the development and validation of low-cost, portable technologies that can improve cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment in low-and middle-income countries.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI, CGH supports low-cost technology awards

row.title: CRCHD Offices and Branches
CRCHD Integrated Networks
row.field_page_description: INB supports two network-based programs—the National Outreach Network (NON) and the Geographic Management of Cancer Health Disparities Program (GMaP)—as well as advising on women’s health and sexual and gender minority opportunities within and across the NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: INB supports the National Outreach Network, the Geographic Management of Cancer Health Disparities Program, and advises on women’s health and sexual and gender minority opportunities within and across NCI.

row.title: If You Want to Find Ways to Prevent Cancer...Learn About Prevention Clinical Trials

row.field_page_description: Covers things you should know when deciding to take part in a clinical trial that may help find ways to prevent cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers things you should know when deciding to take part in a clinical trial that may help find ways to prevent cancer.

row.title: With FDA Approval, Gefitinib Returns to U.S. Market for Some Patients with Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: Gefitinib Approved for Some Lung Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: The FDA last month approved gefitinib (Iressa) for the treatment of some patients with lung cancer, marking the drug’s return to the U.S. market after an earlier withdrawal.
row.field_feature_card_description: The FDA has approved gefitinib as an initial treatment for lung cancer patients whose tumors have EGFR mutations.

row.title: About the Division of Cancer Biology
row.field_page_description: Learn about DCB’s offices and branches as well as how it prioritizes programs, facilitates research, and communicates with scientists.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about DCB’s offices and branches as well as how it prioritizes programs, facilitates research, and communicates with scientists.
row.field_list_description: Learn about DCB's offices and branches as well as how it prioritizes programs, facilitates research, and communicates with scientists.

row.title: Enhancing Drug Discovery and Development
row.field_page_description: Cancer drug discovery and development has long been a priority for the National Cancer Institute, most importantly in areas of need that are not being adequately addressed by the private sector.

row.title: NCI Releases Budget Proposal for Fiscal Year 2017
row.field_short_title: NCI Releases FY2017 Annual Plan & Budget Proposal
row.field_page_description: The NCI Annual Plan and Budget Proposal for Fiscal Year 2017 provides an overview of NCI’s priorities and key initiatives and the institute’s funding request.
row.field_feature_card_description: Acting Director Doug Lowy, M.D., calls this a "transformational moment" in cancer research, requests sustained budget increases.

row.title: Regional Centers of Research Excellence in Non-communicable Diseases in LMICs FAQs
row.field_short_title: Regional Centers of Research Excellence in Non-communicable Diseases in LMICs FAQs

row.title: David Q. Matus, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: David Matus studies cellular invasion--a characteristic behavior of metastatic cancer cells--in an evolutionary context.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Stony Brook University evolutionary developmental biologist studies cellular invasion, a characteristic behavior of metastatic cancer cells.
row.field_list_description: David Matus studies cellular invasion during normal development in the worm, C. elegans, as a model for understanding this behavior in metastatic cancer cells.

row.title: Patients with Advanced Cancer May Benefit from Discussing Prognosis with Physicians
row.field_short_title: Patients with Advanced Cancer May Benefit from Discussing Prognosis with Physicians
row.field_page_description: Patients with advanced cancer may benefit from having discussions about their prognoses with their physicians.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients with advanced cancer may benefit from having discussions about their prognoses with their physicians.

row.title: Antioxidants Accelerate the Growth and Invasiveness of Tumors in Mice
row.field_short_title: Antioxidants Accelerate the Growth and Invasiveness of Tumors in Mice
row.field_page_description: Metastatic tumor cells are particularly sensitive to oxidative stress, and antioxidant supplementation increases their ability to grow and metastasize.
row.field_feature_card_description: Studies in mice show that antioxidant supplements may help tumors to grow and metastasize.

row.title: How Genomics Is Shaping Precision Medicine in Oncology
row.field_short_title: How Genomics Is Shaping Precision Medicine in Oncology
row.field_page_description: In laboratories at NCI and around the world, researchers are using advanced genomic technologies to study the differences between cancer cells and normal cells, leading to new and more effective treatments for patients with cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The director of NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics discusses precision medicine and its use in the treatment of lymphoma.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Brain Tumors
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the FDA for use in brain tumors. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries. The list includes generic names and brand names.

row.title: About the Annual Plan and Budget Proposal
row.field_short_title: About the Annual Plan & Budget Proposal
row.field_page_description: Learn about the annual budget plan and proposal NCI submits to the President and Congress each fiscal year, including an archive of plans from previous years.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the annual budget plan NCI submits to the President and Congress each fiscal year.
row.field_list_description: Learn about the annual budget plan and proposal NCI submits to the President and Congress each fiscal year and find an archive of plans from previous years.

row.title: Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award (NRSA) for Individual Predoctoral Fellows (F31)
Accidents at Nuclear Power Plants and Cancer Risk
row.field_short_title: Accidents at Nuclear Power Plants and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about cancer risks associated with accidents at nuclear power plants.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet about cancer risks associated with accidents at nuclear power plants. Includes information for cancer patients who live in an area that may be affected by a nuclear power plant accident. Also contains links to information about NCI-supported research on ionizing radiation and cancer risk.

row.title: Federal Government Programs
row.field_page_description: Information about government health programs that may cover some costs associated with clinical trial participation.
row.field_feature_card_description: Government health programs that may cover some costs associated with clinical trial participation.

row.title: Treating KSHV-Associated Multicentric Castleman Disease
row.field_page_description: In this study, patients with KSHV-associated multicentric Castleman disease will receive IV tocilizumab every other week for up to 12 weeks. Patients who do not benefit may go on to receive high-dose AZT and valganciclovir as well.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this study, patients with KSHV-associated multicentric Castleman disease will receive IV tocilizumab every other week for up to 12 weeks. Patients who do not benefit may go on to receive high-dose AZT and valganciclovir as well.
row.field_list_description: In this pilot study, patients with KSHV-associated multicentric Castleman disease will receive intravenous tocilizumab every other week for up to 12 weeks. Patients who do not benefit from tocilizumab therapy alone may go on to receive high-dose AZT and valganciclovir in addition to tocilizumab.

row.title: Facing Forward: Life After Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Facing Forward: Life After Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Covers both the physical and emotional post-treatment issues for cancer survivors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers both the physical and emotional post-treatment issues for cancer survivors.

row.title: Milestones in Cancer Research and Discovery
row.field_short_title: Milestones in Cancer Research and Discovery
row.field_page_description: During the past 250 years, we have witnessed many landmark discoveries in our efforts to make progress against cancer, an affliction known to humanity for thousands of years. This timeline shows a few key milestones in the history of cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Timeline featuring selected milestones in 250 years of cancer research and discovery.

row.title: Celebrating National Minority Health Month 2017
row.field_page_description: NCI and other organizations recognize National Minority Health Month in April 2017.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find out how NCI and other organizations recognized National Minority Health Month in April 2017.
row.field_list_description: In recognition of National Minority Health Month, learn more about NCI programs, funding mechanisms, tools, and events that focus on cancer health disparities research, cancer types and disparities, and building a diverse biomedical workforce.

row.title: Mentor Spotlight: Elva M. Arredondo, PhD
row.field_short_title: Mentor Spotlight: Elva M. Arredondo, PhD
row.field_page_description: Lilian G. Perez shares how her mentor, Dr. Elva M. Arredondo, has supported her career development.
row.field_feature_card_description: Lilian G. Perez shares how her mentor, Dr. Elva M. Arredondo, has supported her career development.
row.field_list_description: Lilian G. Perez, MPH, a fifth-year PhD Candidate, shares how being mentored by Elva M. Arredondo, PhD, a Professor in the Division of Health Promotion and Behavioral Science at San Diego State University, has positively influenced her career development.

row.title: Leadership and Expert Views - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts featuring the views of NCI leaders and other scientific experts—including first-person commentaries and Q&As about research trends and new research programs—from NCI Cancer Currents.
row.field_feature_card_description: Views of NCI leaders and other scientific experts posted on NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: TRACERx: Trailblazing Longitudinal Cancer Genomics
row.field_page_description: The Center for Cancer Genomics is supporting TRACERx, a longitudinal lung cancer genomics study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about TRACERx, a novel longitudinal cancer genomics study.
row.field_list_description: The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) has been analyzed in more than one thousand scientific publications and enabled countless discoveries, but mostly using cross-sectional studies. To study in depth how cancer evolves and progresses, NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG) is supporting the innovative, longitudinal study Tracking Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer Evolution through Therapy (TRACERx).

row.title: FDA Expands Approval of Pembrolizumab for First-Line Treatment of Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Expands Approval of Pembrolizumab for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on FDA’s approval of pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) to be used with chemotherapy as a first-line treatment for non-small cell lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The immunotherapy is used with chemotherapy as a first-line treatment for NSCLC.
row.field_list_description: FDA approved the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab to be used with chemotherapy as a first-line treatment for non-small cell lung cancer.

row.title: Colorectal Cancer Incidence Rising in Young Adults: An Interview with Drs. Philip Rosenberg and William Anderson
row.field_short_title: Colorectal Cancer Incidence Rising in Young Adults
row.field_page_description: An interview with NCI’s Drs. Philip Rosenberg and William Anderson on NCI’s Cancer Currents blog about a new study showing rising colorectal cancer incidence rates in adults under age 50.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI experts discuss recent findings and their implications for future research.
row.field_list_description: Drs. Philip Rosenberg and William Anderson of NCI discuss a recent study on which they were coauthors that reported an increase in colorectal cancer incidence among adults under age 50 in the United States.

row.title: 2014 Social Media Events
row.field_page_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2014.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2014.

row.title: Screen to Save Community Spotlight: UT Health San Antonio
row.field_short_title: Screen to Save Spotlight: UT Health San Antonio
row.field_page_description: As Screen to Save outreach activities are in progress, CRCHD will highlight education and outreach activities taking place in communities across the country. This week, CRCHD is spotlighting the work of our community health educators at the Cancer Therapy and Research Center of the University of Texas Health Science Ce
row.field_feature_card_description: CRCHD spotlights community health educators at the Cancer Therapy and Research Center of the University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio.

row.title: AIDS and Cancer Specimen Resource
row.field_page_description: The AIDS Cancer Specimen Resource (ACSR) is a biorepository for HIV-infected human biospecimens. Learn how ACSR encourages pivotal understanding of the epidemic and its impact on cancer incidence.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn how ACSR encourages pivotal study of the HIV/AIDS epidemic and its impact on cancer incidence.
row.field_list_description: The AIDS Cancer Specimen Resource (ACSR) is a biorepository for HIV-infected human biospecimens and associated clinical information. Learn how ACSR encourages pivotal understanding of the HIV/AIDS epidemic and its impact on cancer incidence.

row.title: Bleeding and Bruising (Thrombocytopenia) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments, such as chemotherapy and targeted therapy, can increase patients’ risk of bleeding and bruising, also called thrombocytopenia. Learn about steps to take if you are at increased risk of a low platelet count.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes bleeding and bruising, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage it.

row.title: Special Spotlight: World Cancer Day - Ending Cancer Health Disparities is Not Beyond Us
row.field_short_title: Special Spotlight: World Cancer Day - Ending Cancer Health Disparities is Not Beyond Us
row.field_page_description: CRCHD observes World Cancer Day 2015, joining the global fight against cancer and cancer health disparities so that everyone can live healthy lives.
row.field_feature_card_description: CRCHD observes World Cancer Day 2015

row.title: Crizotinib Shows Promise for Childhood Cancers
row.field_short_title: Crizotinib Shows Promise for Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: Crizotinib (Xalkori®) shrank tumors in children with anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALCL) and inflammatory myofibroblastic tumors (IMT).
row.field_feature_card_description: In early-stage trial, crizotinib shrank tumors in most patients.
row.field_list_description: In a small clinical trial, the drug crizotinib shrank tumors in children with cancers that have alterations in the ALK gene.

row.title: FDA Approves Inotuzumab for Adults with B-Cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Inotuzumab Approved for Adults with B-Cell ALL
row.field_page_description: Inotuzumab (Besponsa®) has been approved by FDA for some adults with B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) that has returned or doesn’t respond to chemotherapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: Adds another option for patients with ALL that has returned.
row.field_list_description: FDA has approved inotuzumab (Besponsa®) for some adults with B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). The approval covers patients with B-cell ALL whose disease has relapsed or is refractory to standard chemotherapy.

row.title: Study Identifies Crucial Characteristic of High-Risk HPV
row.field_short_title: Study Identifies Crucial Characteristic of High-Risk HPV
