row.field_list_description: Signaling by RAS proteins is regulated by the interactions with substrates, protein partners, and membranes that are investigated by this lab.

row.title: Meeting Patients Where They Are: Liberating Clinical Trials Data Under the Cancer Moonshot
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a new application programming interface (API) that allows anyone to build online tools that help people find NCI-supported clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI’s clinical trials application programming interface (API) allows anyone to build online tools that help people find NCI-supported clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s new application programming interface (API) that allows anyone to build online tools that help people find NCI-supported clinical trials.

row.title: Message from Dr. Lowy
row.field_page_description: A message from NCI Acting Director, Douglas Lowy, about the progress of the RAS Initiative and its goal to create a virtual network of scientists working collaboratively to solve the RAS problem.

row.title: Program Spotlight: 2016 NCI/CRCHD Professional Development Workshop Scientific Poster Winners
row.field_page_description: Professional Development and Mock Review Workshop 2016, 2016 PDW, Poster Session, Winners
row.field_feature_card_description: CRCHD invited young and early stage investigators participating in the workshop to present their research findings and plans for future research in this competitive session.
row.field_list_description: A highlight of the Professional Development and Mock Review Workshop is always the interactive poster session. CRCHD invited young and early stage investigators participating in the workshop to present their research findings and plans for future research in this competitive session.

row.title: IEEE-NIH 2016 Special Topics Conference on Healthcare Innovations and Point-of-Care Technologies
row.field_page_description: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, Incorporated (IEEE)-NIH 2016 Special Topics Conference on Healthcare Innovations and Point-of-Care Technologies
row.field_feature_card_description: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, Incorporated (IEEE)-NIH 2016 Special Topics Conference on Healthcare Innovations and Point-of-Care Technologies (http://hipt.embs.org/2016/), Cancun Mexico, November 9 to 11, 2016
row.field_list_description: As we approach the upcoming Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, Incorporated (IEEE)-NIH 2016 Special Topics Conference on Healthcare Innovations and Point-of-Care Technologies (http://hipt.embs.org/2016/) to be held in Cancun, Mexico November 9th to 11th, it's a good opportunity to reflect on what it is we’re trying to accomplish here and why individuals should attend.

row.title: Many Cancer Caregivers Report Feeling Unprepared for Caregiving Challenges
row.field_short_title: Cancer Caregivers Feel Unprepared for Some Challenges
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a new study that showed cancer caregivers play multiple roles and need more information to help their loved ones.
row.field_feature_card_description: Many cancer caregivers do not feel adequately prepared for the tasks they assume.
row.field_list_description: Many family members who care for loved ones with cancer do not feel adequately prepared for the caregiving tasks they assume and need help to make informed decisions about end-of-life care, according to a new study.

row.title: Glioblastoma—Unraveling the Threads: A Q&A with Drs. Mark Gilbert and Terri Armstrong of the NIH Neuro-Oncology Branch
row.field_short_title: Unraveling the Threads: Making Progress against Glioblastoma
row.field_page_description: Progress against the brain cancer glioblastoma has been slow. In this Cancer Currents post, Drs. Mark Gilbert and Terri Armstrong of NCI’s Neuro-Oncology Branch discuss what’s being done to change that.
row.field_feature_card_description: Drs. Mark Gilbert and Terri Armstrong of NCI’s Neuro-Oncology Branch discuss challenges in glioblastoma research.
row.field_list_description: Progress against the brain cancer glioblastoma has been slow. Drs. Mark Gilbert and Terri Armstrong of NCI’s Neuro-Oncology Branch discuss why and what’s being done to change that.

row.title: Two New Therapies Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Two New Therapies Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_page_description: Two new treatments for adults with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) have been approved by FDA: enasidenib (Idhifa®) and cytarabine-daunorubicin CPX-351 (Vyxeos®), as this Cancer Currents post explains
row.field_feature_card_description: Approvals include first drug to target tumors with IDH mutations.
row.field_list_description: FDA has approved two new treatments for some adult patients with acute myeloid leukemia (AML): enasidenib (Idhifa®), which targets the IDH2 protein; and liposomal cytarabine-daunorubicin CPX-351 (Vyxeos®), a two-drug chemotherapy combination encapsulated in liposomes.

row.title: Hair Dyes and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that reviews research about the possibility of a connection between personal hair dye use and cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet that reviews research about hair dye use and cancer risk.

row.title: Menopausal Hormone Therapy and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the results of research on menopausal hormone therapy (MHT). Includes information about the effect of MHT on the body and benefits and risks of using menopausal hormones.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet about the results of research on menopausal hormone therapy. Includes information about the effect of menopausal hormone therapy on the body. Also outlines the benefits and risks of using menopausal hormones.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet about the results of research on menopausal hormone therapy. Includes information about the effect of menopausal hormone therapy on the body. Also outlines the benefits and risks of using menopausal hormones.

row.title: PDQ® - NCI's Comprehensive Database
row.field_page_description: An NCI database that contains the latest information about cancer treatment, screening, prevention, genetics, supportive care, and complementary and alternative medicine, plus drug information and a dictionary of cancer terms.
row.field_feature_card_description: Use our evidence-based information summaries and other PDQ resources to answer questions on a wide range of cancer topics.

row.title: PDQ® Screening and Prevention Editorial Board
row.field_page_description: Experts in the fields of oncology, cancer prevention, hematology, radiology, urology, statistics, epidemiology, and economics.

row.title: HPV Infections Targeted by Vaccine Decrease in U.S.
row.field_short_title: HPV Infections Drop in the U.S.
row.field_page_description: Infection with human papillomavirus (HPV) types targeted by the quadrivalent HPV vaccine has declined by nearly two-thirds among teenage girls since HPV vaccination was recommended in the United States.
row.field_feature_card_description: Infection with human papillomavirus (HPV) types targeted by vaccine declined among teenage girls and young women in the U.S.

row.title: New Strategy for Treating Advanced Ovarian Cancer Shows Promise in Mice
row.field_short_title: New Strategy for Treating Advanced Ovarian Cancer Shows Promise in Mice
row.field_page_description: The use of a protein fragment to stimulate cells in the tumor microenvironment against cancer shows promise in animal models of metastatic ovarian cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Stimulating cells in the tumor microenvironment against ovarian cancer shows promise in mice.

row.title: Nutritional Requirements of Pancreatic Cancers - A Conversation with Dafna Bar-Sagi
row.field_page_description: In a new RAS Dialogue blog post, Dr. Dafna Bar-Sagi discusses the new interest in her 1986 discovery of the unexpected dietary preference of pancreatic cancer cells.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a new blog in RAS Dialogue, Dr. Dafna Bar-Sagi discusses the new interest in her 1986 discovery of the unexpected dietary preference of pancreatic cancer cells.
row.field_list_description: Solid tumors in humans develop primarily from epithelial cells, which have different functions in different tissues. Pancreatic cancers derive much of their nutrition from proteins consumed from their environment.

row.title: Understanding Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page is a gateway to basic information about how cancer develops, trends in cancer cases and deaths, and how cancer affects different populations.
row.field_feature_card_description: Start learning about cancer with our resources that explain how it develops and is categorized and who is affected.

row.title: A Shared Commitment for Accelerating Progress with the Cancer Moonshot
row.field_short_title: A Shared Commitment to the Cancer Moonshot
row.field_page_description: At the AACR annual meeting, Vice President Biden spoke about the National Cancer Moonshot Initiative and the critical role the entire research community will play in accelerating progress against cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Vice President Biden spoke at a major cancer meeting about the critical role to be played by the entire research community.

row.title: Healthy Kids; Healthy World - Take Your Child to Work Day 2016
row.field_short_title: Healthy Kids; Healthy World - Take Your Child to Work Day 2016
row.field_page_description: On April 28th CGH joined several NCI offices at the Shady Grove campus to celebrate Take Your Child to Work Day 2016. Volunteers hosted three activity stations, each offering creative fun with a message: With healthy kids, we can create a healthier world.

row.title: Crosstalk between Cancer Cells and Neighboring Cells May Contribute to Tumor Growth
row.field_short_title: Molecular Crosstalk Promotes Pancreatic Tumor Growth
row.field_page_description: Pancreatic cancer cells and neighboring normal cells engage in a two-way molecular conversation that helps drive malignant behavior in the cancer cells, according to new study results.
row.field_feature_card_description: This two-way communication can activate a chain of events that helps tumor cells survive and multiply.

row.title: Leukemia Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Leukemia Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization, and evaluation of concepts for phase 2 and phase 3 clinical trials in adult leukemia cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Leukemia Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Leukemia Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: Myeloma Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Myeloma Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Myeloma Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Myeloma Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: Pediatric Leukemia and Lymphoma Steering Committee
row.field_short_title: Pediatric Leukemia and Lymphoma Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Pediatric Leukemia and Lymphoma Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization, and evaluation of concepts for phase II and phase III clinical trials in pediatric hematologic cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Pediatric Leukemia and Lymphoma Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Pediatric Leukemia and Lymphoma Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: Thoracic Malignancy Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Thoracic Malignancy Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization, and evaluation of concepts for phase II and phase III clinical trials in chest malignancies.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Thoracic Malignancy Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Thoracic Malignancy Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: Investigational Drug Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Investigational Drug Steering Committee (IDSC) collaborates with NCI in the design and prioritization of early phase drug development trials conducted by the Experimental Therapeutics Clinical Trials Network (ETCTN).
row.field_feature_card_description: The IDSC works with NCI in the design and prioritization of early phase drug development trials.
row.field_list_description: The IDSC collaborates with NCI in the design and prioritization of early phase drug development trials conducted by the Experimental Therapeutics Clinical Trials Network (ETCTN).

row.title: Investigational Drug Steering Committee Roster
row.field_page_description: The Investigational Drug Steering Committee collaborates with NCI in the design and prioritization of early phase drug development clinical trials. View the committee member roster.

row.title: Two Drugs Show Efficacy against Common Form of Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Two Drugs Show Efficacy against Common Form of Leukemia
row.field_page_description: Reports from early-stage trials of two new oral drugs provide hope for patients with high-risk chronic lymphocytic leukemia.
row.field_feature_card_description: Early-stage trial results provide hope for patients with high-risk chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

row.title: FDA Approves Alectinib for ALK-Positive Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved alectinib to treat patients with metastatic ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer who have stopped responding to or who are unable to tolerate crizotinib.
row.field_feature_card_description: Drug approval provides another option for some patients with lung cancer.

row.title: Novel Treatment Approach Shrinks Ovarian Tumors in Mice
row.field_short_title: Novel Treatment Shrinks Ovarian Tumors in Mice
row.field_page_description: Researchers have developed a new approach for treating tumors that express mutant versions of the p53 protein, which are present in more than half of all cancers, including an aggressive and common subtype of ovarian cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment shrank tumors by as much as 90 percent with no evidence of side effects.

row.title: January is Cervical Cancer Awareness Month
row.field_short_title: January is Cervical Cancer Awareness Month
row.field_page_description: The Center for Global Health supports global activities to advance global cancer research, build expertise, and leverage resources across nations to address the challenges of cancer and reduce cancer deaths worldwide. Towards these aims, NCI has partnered with Pink Ribbon Red Ribbon, a global organization founded on pu

row.title: Missed Radiation Therapy Sessions Increase Risk of Cancer Recurrence
row.field_short_title: Missed Radiation Therapy Sessions Increase Risk of Cancer Recurrence
row.field_page_description: Patients who miss radiation therapy sessions during cancer treatment have an increased risk of their disease returning, even if they eventually complete their course of radiation treatment, according to a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients who miss radiation therapy sessions during cancer treatment have an increased risk of their disease returning.

row.title: Fueling Basic Discovery: NCI’s Cooperative Human Tissue Network
row.field_short_title: Fueling Basic Discovery: NCI’s Cooperative Human Tissue Network
row.field_page_description: Quality biospecimens are a foundational resource for cancer research. One of NCI’s longest running biospecimen programs is the Cooperative Human Tissue Network, a resource mainly for basic discovery and early translational research.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Cooperative Human Tissue Network provides tissue for biomarker studies and other early research.

row.title: Delirium and Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Diagnosing and Treating Delirium in Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Delirium is a confused mental state. Symptoms may include changes in thinking and sleeping. In cancer patients, it may be caused by medicine, dehydration, or happen at the end of life. Delirium may be mistaken for depression or dementia.
row.field_list_description: Delirium during cancer treatment is explained, including what causes it and how it is treated. Hypoactive delirium, hyperactive delirium, and mixed delirium are explained. Questions to ask your family member's doctor are also included.

row.title: Genomic Data Commons
row.field_page_description: The NCI Genomic Data Commons (GDC) is a unified cancer genomics knowledge base that promotes data sharing and facilitates precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_feature_card_description: This NCI-supported knowledge system for cancer genomic and clinical data fosters precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Genomic Data Commons (GDC) is a unified cancer genomics knowledge base that promotes sharing of genomic and clinical data between researchers and facilitates precision medicine in oncology.

row.title: Opportunities in Cancer Nanotechnology: A Conversation with NCI’s Dr. Piotr Grodzinski
row.field_short_title: Opportunities in Cancer Nanotechnology: A Conversation with NCI’s Dr. Piotr Grodzinski
row.field_page_description: The director of NCI's Office of Cancer Nanotechnology Research discusses the Cancer Nanotechnology Plan 2015, as well as new developments and clinical opportunities in the field.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI’s Dr. Piotr Grodzinski discusses new developments and clinical opportunities in the field of cancer nanotechnology.

row.title: President Obama’s Budget Request Affirms Commitment to Progress against Cancer
row.field_short_title: Budget Request Includes Funds for Cancer Initiative
row.field_page_description: President Obama’s FY 2017 Budget Request includes $680 million to support Vice President Biden’s cancer research initiative.
row.field_feature_card_description: This undertaking will identify promising ways to leverage new resources and accelerate progress against cancer.

row.title: Prospective Study Links HPV Detection in the Mouth to Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Confirms Oral HPV Infection Precedes Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_page_description: A new study confirms that infection with HPV 16 precedes the development of head and neck cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study also links additional HPV types to oropharyngeal cancer.

row.title: Gene Fusion May Drive Rare Childhood Brain Tumor
row.field_short_title: Genomic Study Identifies Gene Fusion in Rare Childhood Brain Tumor
row.field_page_description: Researchers have identified a genetic rearrangement that may drive the development of a rare benign brain tumor in children through three distinct biological mechanisms simultaneously.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers have found a genetic rearrangement that may drive the development of a rare brain tumor in children.

row.title: National Cryo-Electron Microscopy Facility
row.field_page_description: Information about the National Cryo-EM Facility at NCI, created to provide researchers access to the latest cryo-EM technology for high resolution imaging. Includes timeline for installation and how to access the facility.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer researchers can submit samples for high-resolution imaging by the Titan Krios microscope.
row.field_list_description: Home page for the National Cryo-Electron Microscopy Facility at NCI, open to cancer researchers in structural biology cryo-EM research without sufficient access to high resolution microscopes. The user facility is expected to be available for use by May 15, 2017.

row.title: Additional Surgery after Breast-Conserving Surgery Varies Widely
row.field_short_title: Additional Surgery after Breast-Conserving Surgery Varies Widely
row.field_page_description: A study published in the Feb. 1, 2012, issue of JAMA found that the number of women who have one or more additional surgeries to remove suspected residual tumor tissue (re-excisions) following breast-conserving surgery (BCS) for breast cancer varies widely across surgeons and hospitals.

row.title: Gestational Trophoblastic Disease—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD) is a broad term encompassing both benign and malignant growths arising from products of conception in the uterus. GTDs contain paternal chromosomes and are placental in origin. Find evidence-based information on gestational trophoblastic disease treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about gestational trophoblastic disease.

row.title: Intraocular (Eye) Melanoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Intraocular (uveal) melanoma of the uveal tract (iris, ciliary body, and choroid), though rare, is the most common primary intraocular malignancy in adults. Find evidence-based information on intraocular melanoma treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about intraocular (eye) melanoma.

row.title: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Langerhans cell histiocytosis is a rare blood cancer that forms when a type of white blood cell called Langerhans cells becomes abnormal and grows in different parts of the body. LCH is most common in young children but can occur at any age. Start here to find information on Langerhans cell histiocytosis treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about langerhans cell histiocytosis.

row.title: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Histiocytic diseases, like Langerhans cell histiocytosis (LCH) and myeloid-derived dendritic cell disorder, in children and adults are caused by an abnormal accumulation of cells of the mononuclear phagocytic system. Find evidence-based information on Langerhans cell histiocytosis treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about langerhans cell histiocytosis.

row.title: Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Pheochromocytomas and extra-adrenal paragangliomas are rare tumors arising from neural crest tissue that develops into sympathetic and parasympathetic paraganglia throughout the body. Find evidence-based information on pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma treatment, research, and genetics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma.

row.title: Prostate Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Prostate cancers are often adenocarcinomas. Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia is often present in association with prostatic adenocarcinoma. Find evidence-based information on prostate cancer including treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Prostate Cancer.

row.title: Lung Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The two main types of lung cancer are non-small cell lung cancer and small cell lung cancer. Smoking causes most lung cancers, but nonsmokers can also develop lung cancer. Start here to find information on lung cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics on lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Smoking causes most lung cancers, but nonsmokers can also develop lung cancer.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about lung cancer.

row.title: Esophageal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The most common types of esophageal cancer are adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma. These forms of esophageal cancer develop in some parts of the esophagus and are driven by genetic changes. Start here to find information on esophageal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about esophageal cancer.

row.title: Coping with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information for patients, families, and caregivers to help manage emotional and lifestyle effects of cancer, treatment, and life after treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Supportive information on managing the physical and emotional effects of cancer and treatment for both patients and caregivers.

row.title: The ALTTO Breast Cancer Trial
row.field_page_description: A collection of material about the Adjuvant Lapatinib And/Or Trastuzumab Treatment Optimisation, or ALTTO, study that will compare the targeted agents lapatinib and trastuzumab alone, in sequence, or in combination as adjuvant therapy for HER2-positive br
row.field_list_description: A collection of material about the Adjuvant Lapatinib And/Or Trastuzumab Treatment Optimisation, or ALTTO, study that will compare the targeted agents lapatinib and trastuzumab alone, in sequence, or in combination as adjuvant therapy for HER2-positive breast cancer.

row.title: Second HPV Vaccine Shows Early Positive Results
row.field_short_title: Second HPV Vaccine Shows Early Results
row.field_page_description: The vaccine Cervarix® was 90 percent effective against two types of human papillomavirus (HPV) that can cause cervical cancer, according to the June 30, 2007, Lancet.
row.field_list_description: The vaccine Cervarix® was 90 percent effective against two types of human papillomavirus (HPV) that can cause cervical cancer, according to the June 30, 2007, Lancet.

row.title: Subscribe to Cancer.gov RSS Feeds
row.field_page_description: Subscribe to NCI RSS feeds to get news releases, summaries of clinical trial results, NCI Fact Sheets, and other information.

row.title: Blood-Forming Stem Cell Transplants
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that explains the step-by-step procedures of two types of transplantations used with high-dose chemotherapy, including their risks and benefits.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet that explains the step-by-step procedures of two types of transplantations used with high-dose chemotherapy, including their risks and benefits.

row.title: Combination of Idelalisib and Rituximab Improves Survival in Patients with Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Idelalisib Plus Rituximab for Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international double-blind phase III trial that compared the combination of idelalisib plus rituximab (Rituxan®) versus placebo plus rituximab.
row.field_feature_card_description: In an international randomized double-blind phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) who received the investigational drug idelalisib in combination with rituximab (Rituxan®) lived substantially longer without th
row.field_list_description:
In an international randomized double-blind phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) who received the investigational drug idelalisib in combination with rituximab (Rituxan®) lived substantially longer without their disease getting worse than patients who received a placebo plus rituximab.
Overall survival was also improved in patients who received idelalisib plus rituximab. Patients who received idelalisib and rituximab were also more likely to live 12 months after beginning treatment and to have their cancer regress compared with patients who received a placebo plus rituximab.

row.title: About NCI Center for Global Health
row.field_short_title: About NCI Center for Global Health
row.field_page_description: Provides assistance and guidance to nations as they develop and implement cancer control plans, trains international investigators, and strengthens U.S. national, regional, multilateral, and bilateral collaboration.
row.field_list_description: Learn more about who we are, what we do, and why.

row.title: TARGET Initiative Leading the Way to New and Exciting Discoveries in Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: Tapping into collaborative science: NCI's TARGET initiative makes discoveries in childhood cancers possible, such as genetic tests to address blood cancer

row.title: Gastrointestinal Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Gastrointestinal Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization, and evaluation of concepts for phase 2 and phase 3 clinical trials in adult gastrointestinal cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Gastrointestinal Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Gastrointestinal Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: NCI Fact Sheets
row.field_page_description: Nearly 100 fact sheets on a wide array of cancer topics. Fact sheets address risk factors, prevention, support, treatment, and more.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI's fact sheets address questions about risk factors, prevention, support, treatment, and more.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Dr. David Turner - Investigating the Role of Nutrition in Cancer Growth for African Americans Living with Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Dr. David Turner - Role of Nutrition in Cancer Growth for African Americans
row.field_page_description: Dr. David Turner, a Partnerships to Advance Cancer Health Equity (PACHE) researcher, studies the role of nutrition in cancer growth among African Americans with prostate cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Turner studies nutrition in cancer growth among African Americans with prostate cancer.

row.title: Ras Mitogenic Signaling: p53 Enters the Stage
row.field_short_title: Ras Mitogenic Signaling: p53 Enters the Stage
row.field_page_description: Mariano Barbacid and Matthias Drosten describe experiments that reveal a new role for the p53/p21Clp1/Rb axis in controling MAPK signaling.

row.title: Chemotherapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Chemotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that uses drugs to kill cancer cells. Learn how chemotherapy works against cancer, why it causes side effects, and how it is used with other cancer treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn how chemotherapy works against cancer, why it causes side effects, and how it is used with other cancer treatments.

row.title: Step 4: Award Negotiation & Issuance
row.field_page_description: Before a grant can be awarded and accepted, several pre-award activities must happen to formalize the partnership. Ensuring compliance with federal laws, a review of costs and a negotiation of the appropriate funding level must all happen in order to receive a grant.
row.field_feature_card_description: When an agency awards a grant, it is formalizing its partnership with the recipient (institution) to ensure compliance with federal laws, regulations and policies, and to protect the overall scientific endeavor.
row.field_list_description: Before a grant can be awarded and accepted, several pre-award activities must happen to formalize the partnership. Ensuring compliance with federal laws, a review of costs and a negotiation of the appropriate funding level must all happen in order to receive a grant.

row.title: Researchers use Modified CRISPR Systems to Modulate Gene Expression on a Genomic Scale
row.field_short_title: Researchers use Modified CRISPR Systems to Modulate Gene Expression on a Genomic Scale
row.field_page_description: Cancer Target Discovery and Development Network (CTD<sup>2</sup>) researchers at the University of California, San Francisco, developed a CRISPR system that can regulate both gene repression and activation with fewer off-target effects.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Habtom Ressom, Ph.D. - Multi-Omic Approaches for the Early Detection of Liver Cancer
row.field_page_description: Dr. Habtom W. Ressom, an NCI CRCHD R21 grantee, works to identify a method for detecting liver cancer early by employing bioinformatic technologies to collect, and make sense of, multi-omic data from liver cancer cases and patients with liver cirrhosis.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Ressom researches bioinformatic technologies to detect liver cancer early.

row.title: Grants Policies and Process
row.field_page_description: NIH prior approval is required for the transfer of a grant. Learn more about transferring a cancer research grant from one entity to another.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about NCI's grants administration process, including legal, regulatory, and policy requirements.
row.field_list_description: Research grants are subject to a variety of policy requirements. Learn about the NCI Office of Grants Administration process, including legal, regulatory, and policy requirements.

row.title: Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information to help with talking about and coping with advanced cancer, making choices about care, and planning for the end of life.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information to help with talking about and coping with advanced cancer, making choices about care, and planning for the end of life.

row.title: Taking Care of Yourself
row.field_page_description: Caring for someone with advanced cancer brings new challenges and concerns. It's important to take care of yourself and reach out for help. Find tips specific to caregivers of patients with advanced cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Tips specific to caregivers of patients with advanced cancer.

row.title: History of the National Cancer Institute
row.field_page_description: Since its establishment in 1937, the National Cancer Institute has supported and advanced cancer research in many ways.
row.field_feature_card_description: Since its formation in 1937, the National Cancer Institute has supported and advanced cancer research in many ways.
row.field_list_description: Major milestones in the history of the National Cancer Institute, the federal government's primary agency to address cancer research.

row.title: Cancer Care Delivery Research Steering Committee Roster
row.field_short_title: Cancer Care Delivery Research Steering Committee Roster
row.field_page_description: Roster of members on the Cancer Care Delivery Research Steering Committee.
row.field_feature_card_description: Roster of members on the Cancer Care Delivery Research Steering Committee.

row.title: Citing TCGA in Publications and Presentations
row.field_page_description: Guidelines for citing The Cancer Genome Atlas or The Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network in your research.

row.title: Combination Screens for Cancer Vulnerabilities: A Conversation with Kris Wood
row.field_short_title: Combination Screens for Cancer Vulnerabilities: A Conversation with Kris Wood
row.field_page_description: Combining genetic screens with drugs that work downstream of mutant KRAS reveals cellular adaptations to uncontrolled growth that may be targeted.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancers driven by mutant KRAS are difficult to treat. Combining genetic screens with drugs that work downstream of mutant KRAS reveals cellular adaptations to uncontrolled growth that may be targeted.
row.field_list_description: Cancers driven by mutant KRAS are difficult to treat. Combining genetic screens with drugs that work downstream of mutant KRAS reveals cellular adaptations to uncontrolled growth that may be targeted.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of acute myeloid leukemia (AML), including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of chromophobe renal cell (kidney) carcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: High-Fat Diet or Diabetes Drug May Enhance Response to Targeted Cancer Drug
row.field_short_title: Enhancing PI3K Inhibitor Response with Diet, Diabetes Drug
row.field_page_description: Combining targeted cancer drugs known as PI3K inhibitors with a high-fat (ketogenic) diet or a diabetes drug may overcome P13K inhibitor resistance, a new study in mice suggests.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study combined high-fat diet or diabetes medication with PI3K inhibitors.
row.field_list_description: A study in mice may have identified a way to help overcome resistance to targeted cancer drugs known as PI3K inhibitors. The approach appears to work by reducing insulin levels in patients receiving these drugs.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: Integrating Geriatric Assessment into Cancer Care: A Conversation with Dr. Supriya Mohile
row.field_short_title: Integrating Geriatric Assessment into Cancer Care
row.field_page_description: Dr. Supriya Mohile discusses efforts to incorporate geriatric assessment into the cancer care of older patients, including the recent publication of ASCO clinical guidelines on geriatric cancer care.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Supriya Mohile discusses efforts to improve the care of older patients.
row.field_list_description: Dr. Supriya Mohile discusses the unique issues experienced by older adults with cancer and efforts to incorporate geriatric assessment into patient care, including the publication of recent ASCO clinical guidelines on geriatric cancer care.

row.title: Appendix Cancers Are Genetically Distinct from Other Gastrointestinal Cancers, Study Shows
row.field_short_title: Appendix Cancers Genetically Distinct from Other GI Cancers
row.field_page_description: Appendix cancers are distinct from colorectal and other gastrointestinal cancers, the largest-ever genomic study of its kind has shown. As this Cancer Currents post explains, specific mutations may help identify aggressive appendix tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Specific mutations may identify aggressive appendix tumors.
row.field_list_description: The largest-ever study of DNA changes in appendix cancer shows that it is distinct from colorectal and other gastrointestinal cancers and suggests that specific mutations in appendix tumors may help predict whether they may be aggressive.

row.title: Publications from the RAS Initiative
row.field_page_description: This list of publications from the RAS Initiative reflects the balance between the public responsibilities of the National Cancer Institute and the requirements of our external partners.
row.field_feature_card_description: This list of RAS Initiative publications reflects the balance between the public responsibilities of NCI and the requirements of external partners.
row.field_list_description: This list of RAS Initiative publications reflects the balance between the public responsibilities of NCI and the requirements of external partners.

row.title: Dr. Chanita Hughes-Halbert to Deliver NCI CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar
row.field_short_title: Dr. Chanita Hughes-Halbert to Deliver NCI CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar
row.field_page_description: On October 17, 2018, Dr. Chanita Hughes-Halbert will deliver the next CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar. Dr. Hughes-Halbert will present on Translational Issues in Cancer Health Disparities.

row.title: Brushing the Airway to Detect Lung Cancer Earlier
row.field_short_title: Brushing the Airway to Detect Lung Cancer Earlier
row.field_page_description: Learn how NCI support enabled pulmonologist Avrum Spira to develop a minimally invasive test to tell whether smokers with suspicious lung lesions have cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Avrum Spira, M.D., M.Sc., is transforming the paradigm of early lung cancer detection and screening.

row.title: Improving Outcomes for Patients with NF1
row.field_short_title: Improving Outcomes for Patients with NF1
row.field_page_description: Read about Philip Moss who participated in an NCI clinical trial led by Brigitte Widemann that is showing promise in treating children with NF1.
row.field_feature_card_description: Philip Moss had run out of treatment options for his neurofibroma tumors when he joined a clinical trial at NIH.

row.title: Bringing Research to the Community to Reduce Cancer Disparities
row.field_short_title: Bringing Research to the Community to Reduce Cancer Disparities-Chanita Hughes-Halbert, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Read about how NCI is working to reduce cancer disparities by bringing clinical trials to minority and underserved communities.
row.field_feature_card_description: Chanita Hughes-Halbert, Ph.D., leads one of NCORP’s minority/underserved community sites.

row.title: APACT & WCC 2018: Tobacco Control, Oral Cancer and the Sustainable Development Goals in the Asia-Pacific
row.field_short_title: APACT & WCC 2018: Tobacco Control, Oral Cancer and Sustainable Development in the Asia-Pacific
