row.title: Age and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: Advancing age is the most important risk factor for cancer overall, and for many individual cancer types.

row.title: Infectious Agents
row.field_page_description: Certain infectious agents, including viruses, bacteria, and parasites, can cause cancer in infected people or increase the risk that cancer will form.

row.title: Cancer Treatment Research
row.field_page_description: The development of more effective and less toxic treatments is fundamental to improving outcomes for patients with cancer. NCI is leading efforts on several fronts to develop and evaluate new cancer treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is leading efforts on several fronts to develop and evaluate new cancer treatments.

row.title: More Evidence That a Wild-Type KRAS Allele Plays a Role in Cancer
row.field_short_title: More Evidence That a Wild-Type KRAS Allele Plays a Role in Cancer
row.field_page_description: Jim Hartley of the RAS Initiative discusses evidence from mouse models that a wild type KRAS allele modulates early selection of Q61L or Q61R mutants in lung cancers.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Katherine Briant, MPH, CHES - Bridging Community Cancer Education Efforts with Health Disparities Research
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Katherine Briant, MPH, CHES
row.field_page_description: Katherine Briant, MPH, CHES, is Community Health Educator in NCI’s National Outreach Network links NCI-supported outreach and community education efforts and cancer health disparities research and training programs.
row.field_feature_card_description: Ms. Briant links outreach/community education efforts and cancer health disparities research.

row.title: Soft Tissue Sarcoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Soft tissue sarcoma is a cancer that starts in soft tissues like muscle, tendons, fat, lymph vessels, blood vessels, and nerves. These cancers can develop anywhere in the body but are found mostly in the arms, legs, chest, and abdomen. Start here to find information on soft tissue sarcoma treatment and research.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about soft tissue sarcoma.

row.title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_short_title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer
row.field_page_description: Ovarian epithelial cancer is the most common type of ovarian cancer. Cancer can also form at the end of the fallopian tube near the ovary or the peritoneum and spread to the ovary. Start here to find information on ovarian cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_feature_card_description: Because it's hard to diagnose early, ovarian cancer is often found at an advanced stage. Read about treatment, research, and more.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer.

row.title: Description of NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_short_title: Description of NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_page_description: Background and Purpose of PDQ Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_list_description: Description of the cancer genetics services directory and the qualifications of the professionals who are included.

row.title: Oral Contraceptives and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about research on the association of oral contraceptive use (birth control pills) with risk of various cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn what the research says about cancer risk associated with the use of birth control pills.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet about research on the association of oral contraceptive use with risk of various cancers.

row.title: What Does a Mole Look Like?
row.field_short_title: What Does a Mole Look Like?
row.field_page_description: Photographs of Common Moles and Dysplastic Nevi.
row.field_feature_card_description: Photographs of Common Moles and Dysplastic Nevi.

row.title: CGH Short Term Scientist Exchange Program (STSEP)
row.field_short_title: CGH Short Term Scientist Exchange Program (STSEP)
row.field_page_description: STSEP promotes collaborative research between established U.S. and foreign scientists from low, middle, and upper-middle income countries (LMICs) by supporting, in part, exchange visits of cancer researchers between U.S. and foreign laboratories.
row.field_feature_card_description: STSEP promotes collaborative research between established U.S. and foreign scientists from LMICs by supporting exchange visits of cancer researchers between U.S. and foreign laboratories.

row.title: Cancer Prevention Fellowship Program
FDA Approves Sonidegib for Some Patients with Advanced Basal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: Sonidegib Approved for Advanced Basal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved sonidegib for the treatment of patients with locally advanced basal cell carcinoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: FDA approval provides a new option for this hard-to-treat skin cancer.

row.title: Improving Chronic Disease in the Caribbean through Evidence-based Behavioral and Social Interventions
row.field_short_title: Improving Chronic Disease in the Caribbean through Evidence-based Behavioral and Social In
row.field_page_description: The Office for Behavioral and Social Sciences Research and the NCI’s Center for Global Health held a workshop entitled “Improving Chronic Disease in the Caribbean through Evidence-based Behavioral and Social Interventions”, which took place in Bridgetown, Barbados from July 21 to 24, 2015. The objectives of the worksho

row.title: For Some Children with Cancer, Genomic Information May Help Guide Treatment Decisions
row.field_short_title: Using Genomic Tools to Analyze Tumors in Children
row.field_page_description: Genomic methods, such as DNA sequencing, may help doctors manage the treatment of children and young adults with cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: This study tested the use of DNA and RNA sequencing to inform the treatment of younger patients with rare and aggressive cancers.

row.title: CRISPR: Genome Editing Comes of Age
row.field_short_title: CRISPR: Genome Editing Comes of Age
row.field_page_description: A research article about a technique for gene editing known as CRISPR-Cas9. The technique has made it much easier and faster for cancer researchers to study mutations and test new therapeutic targets.
row.field_feature_card_description: An easier, faster way to study cancer mutations and test new therapeutic targets.
row.field_list_description: A technique for gene editing known as CRISPR-Cas9 has made it much easier and faster for cancer researchers to study mutations and test new therapeutic targets.

row.title: New Immunotherapy Option Approved for Cervical Cancer, Rare Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab Approved for Cervical Cancer, Rare Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved pembrolizumab (Keytruda) for some women with advanced cervical cancer and for some patients with primary mediastinal large B-cell lymphoma (PMBCL), a rare type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: Immunotherapy drug pembrolizumab cleared for advanced forms of both cancers.
row.field_list_description: FDA has approved pembrolizumab (Keytruda) for some women with advanced cervical cancer and some patients with primary mediastinal large B-cell lymphoma (PMBCL), a rare type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Esophageal Cancer
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Esophageal Cancer
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Esophageal Cancer
row.field_list_description: A summary of TCGA's study of esophageal squamous cell and adenocarcinoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.

row.title: OMB Burden Statements for NCI Information Collections
row.field_page_description: Under the Paperwork Reduction Act, information collections approved by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) are linked to OMB Burden Statements that explain more about the specific collection and who to contact for more information. Burden statements for information collection by NCI are kept here.

row.title: Build a National Cancer Data Ecosystem
row.field_short_title: Build a National Cancer Data Ecosystem
row.field_page_description: Researchers, clinicians, and patients across the country will need to share their collective data and knowledge to enable the development of new technologies and reduce the burden of cancer. This Cancer Moonshot initiative empowers and encourages such collaboration.
row.field_feature_card_description: This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to enable and encourage stakeholders to share, access, combine, and analyze data that will enable new discoveries and reduce the burden of cancer.
row.field_list_description: Create a national ecosystem for sharing and analyzing cancer data so that researchers, clinicians and patients will be able to contribute data, which will facilitate efficient data analysis.

row.title: For Small Cell Lung Cancer, Immunotherapy Drug Finally Brings Improved Survival
row.field_short_title: For Small Cell Lung Cancer, Immunotherapy Drug Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: In a clinical trial of patients with advanced small cell lung cancer (SCLC), atezolizumab (Tecentriq), combined with standard chemotherapy, modestly increased survival—the first trial in more than 20 years to show a survival improvement in this cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: First trial in decades to show patients with this cancer lived longer.
row.field_list_description: In a large clinical trial, the immunotherapy drug atezolizumab (Tecentriq), combined with a standard chemotherapy regimen, modestly increased survival in patients with advanced small cell lung cancer (SCLC). The trial is the first in more than 20 years to show a survival improvement in this cancer.

row.title: About Resources for Researchers
row.field_page_description: Find contact information to add or edit a resource in the Resources for Researchers tool.

row.title: TCGA Cancers Selected for Study
row.field_page_description: An overview of the 33 cancers selected for molecular characterization and the criteria TCGA used to select them.
row.field_feature_card_description: An overview of the 33 cancers selected for study by TCGA.
row.field_list_description: An overview of the 33 different cancers types TCGA selected for study and the criteria used to select them.

row.title: Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor Network
row.field_short_title: Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor Network
row.field_page_description: The network of scientists, healthcare providers, advocates, patients, and family members, is working on solid rare tumors that have no cures.
row.field_feature_card_description: Engages patients, advocates, and researchers to improve the lives of young people with rare cancers.

row.title: About MyPART
row.field_page_description: MyPART, the My Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor network, is a group of scientists, patients, family members, advocates, and healthcare providers who want to help find treatments for rare cancers.

row.title: By-Laws for the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
row.field_page_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board (FEB) offers a free and confidential editorial service for NIH fellows. The Board members edit manuscripts, abstracts, book chapters, clinical protocols, and grant submissions and offer suggestions for grammar, structure, and style, but not for scientific content. The Board provides valu

row.title: Manuscript Preparation Guidelines
row.field_page_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board has written guidelines on how to prepare a manuscript for submission.

row.title: For Early-Stage Lung Cancer, Study Identifies Potential New Biomarker, Treatment Target
row.field_short_title: New Biomarker, Treatment Target for Early-Stage Lung Cancer?
row.field_page_description: A potential biomarker and treatment target for early-stage non-small cell lung cancer may have been found, results from a new study suggest.
row.field_feature_card_description: Marker is a protein involved in transporting glucose into cells.
row.field_list_description: A new study has identified a potential biomarker of early-stage non–small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). The biomarker, the study’s leaders said, could help diagnose precancerous lung growths and early-stage lung cancers noninvasively and distinguish them from noncancerous growths.

row.title: Redox Biology
row.field_page_description: The Redox Biology course provides NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows with an overview of how redox-active species and radicals are generated, their effects on the cellular and physiological level, and how they alter carcinogenesis, angiogenesis and proliferation in animal models of cancer.

row.title: What are rare digestive system tumors?
row.field_page_description: Rare digestive system tumors form in organs that are important for digesting food and drinks, including the esophagus, stomach, intestines, liver, and pancreas.
row.field_feature_card_description: Rare digestive system tumors form in organs that are important for digesting food and drinks, including the esophagus, stomach, intestines, liver, and pancreas.

row.title: Acquisition Resources
row.field_page_description: There are many different systems for acquiring grants or contracts from the National Cancer Institute, and regulations that manage their execution.
row.field_list_description: Find helpful information relevant to federal contracting processes as conducted by NCI.

row.title: Beat AML 1.0: A Collaborative Program for Functional Genomic Data Integration
row.field_page_description: The Beat AML program publishes an extensive genomic, drug response, and clinical dataset on acute myeloid leukemia. A lead author describes the collaborative effort and future steps.
row.field_feature_card_description: Beat AML Functional Genomics
row.field_list_description: The Beat AML project integrates molecular, drug response, and clinical data for progress towards individualized therapies for acute myeloid leukemia patients. Dr. Jeffrey Tyner from Oregon Health and Science University describes the collaborative effort.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Mesothelioma
row.field_page_description: A summary of TCGA's study of mesothelioma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Mesothelioma

row.title: Getting to Know the Complexities of Cancer: A 2018 TCGA Symposium Preview
row.field_page_description: A preview of some of the research to be presented at the 2018 Cell Symposium, TCGA Legacy: Multi-Omic Studies in Cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA Symposium 2018
row.field_list_description: At the 2018 Cell Symposium, TCGA Legacy: Multi-Omic Studies in Cancer, cancer genomics experts will discuss the latest research in molecularly characterizing cancer, classifying the disease, and the development of targeted therapy. A preview of how some researchers are starting to understand the complex and dynamic aspects of cancer.

row.title: Hope and Challenge: The NCI Annual Plan and Budget Proposal for Fiscal Year 2020
row.field_short_title: NCI FY 2020 Annual Plan and Budget Proposal Released
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Ned Sharpless announces the release of the institute’s Fiscal Year 2020 Annual Plan and Budget Proposal. The plan represents NCI’s best professional judgement on the optimum funding needed to make the most rapid progress against cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Plan helps inform federal budget planning.
row.field_list_description: NCI has released its Fiscal Year 2020 Annual Plan and Budget Proposal. The plan represents NCI’s best professional judgement on the optimum funding needed to make the most rapid progress against cancer.

row.title: Conversation with Scott Kopetz: RAS in Colorectal Cancer, Initiation and Resistance
row.field_short_title: Conversation with Scott Kopetz: RAS in Colorectal Cancer, Initiation and Resistance
row.field_page_description: Mutated RAS genes are an important cause of colorectal cancers, and play a role in resistance to current drug therapies.
row.field_feature_card_description: Mutated RAS genes are drivers of colorectal cancer and drug resistance.
row.field_list_description: Mutated RAS genes are an important cause of colorectal cancers, and play a role in resistance to current drug therapies. Remarkably, patients whose cancer is progressing despite treatment often have multiple different RAS mutations in their tumors.

row.title: Vaping Pods Produce High Nicotine Levels in Young Users
row.field_short_title: Vaping Pods Produce High Nicotine Levels in Young Users
row.field_page_description: Pod-style e-cigarettes produce higher levels of nicotine in the body than conventional cigarettes. Learn why this finding in young users is so concerning.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn the reasons why this finding is so concerning.
row.field_list_description: Adolescents who use pod-style e-cigarettes had higher levels of nicotine in their bodies than is typically found in adolescents who smoke conventional cigarettes, a new study has found. The study's findings are concerning for several reasons.

row.title: For HPV-Positive Women, Test Can Guide Cervical Cancer Screening Follow-Up
row.field_short_title: For HPV-Positive Women, Test Can Guide Screening Follow-Up
row.field_page_description: For women who test HPV-positive during cervical cancer screening, the dual stain test is better than the Pap test at identifying those at increased risk of developing precancers over the next 5 years and can better guide follow-up care.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dual-stain test better than Pap at identifying cervical precancer risk.
row.field_list_description: A new test can help to improve the clinical management of women who screen positive for HPV infection during routine cervical cancer screening, an NCI-led study has shown.

row.title: Thinking Chemically to Discover New Targeted Cancer Drugs
row.field_short_title: Thinking Chemically to Discover New Targeted Cancer Drugs-Kevan Shokat, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: About a third of all cancers are driven by mutations in RAS genes. Learn how NCI funding is helping Dr. Kevan Shokat develop drugs that inactivate molecular drivers of cancer such as RAS.
row.field_feature_card_description: Chemical biologist Kevan Shokat, Ph.D., uses his unique perspective to develop molecularly targeted therapies.

row.title: Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers
row.field_page_description: The Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers workshop assist and inform NCI Fellows, Staff Scientists, and Staff Clinicians about exploring various science-based career opportunities outside of independent academic research. This 7 week workshop will provide best practices for getting a job, setting work exp

row.title: What are rare bone tumors?
row.field_page_description: Rare bone tumors include bone cancer and cartilage cancer. They can be called by different names depending on where they are in the body. Particulare types of rare bone tumors affect children, adolescents, and young adults.
row.field_list_description: Rare bone tumors include cancer of the bone and cartilage. They get more specific names depending on where they are located in the body.

row.title: K Grant Writing Workshop
row.field_page_description: The Writing Cancer Grant Applications course focuses on how to write clear and persuasive grant applications. This course aims to increase the quality of grant applications by successfully communicating scientific data and ideas.
row.field_list_description: K Grant Writing Workshop focuses on how to write clear and persuasive grant applications. This course aims to increase the quality of grant applications by successfully communicating scientific data and ideas.

row.title: 2018 Social Media Events
row.field_page_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2018.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2018.

row.title: CGH Recognizes World Cancer Day 2019
row.field_page_description: Want to know more about World Cancer Day? Read how the NCI Center for Global Health promotes knowledge sharing in global cancer research and cancer control.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI’s Center for Global Health joins partners around the world to reduce the impact of cancer.
row.field_list_description: On Monday, February 4, the National Cancer Institute (NCI) will recognize World Cancer Day, (WCD) an initiative of the Union for International Cancer Control (UICC). The Center for Global Health (CGH) joins partners across the globe to build awareness about progress against cancer and promote knowledge sharing in cancer research and cancer control.

row.title: A CAR T-Cell Therapy for Multiple Childhood Cancers?
row.field_short_title: CAR T-Cell Study Suggests Promise for Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: A CAR T-cell therapy targeting the B7-H3 protein may have potential as a treatment for several childhood cancers, results from a study in mice suggest.
row.field_feature_card_description: In mouse models of common pediatric cancers, treatment shrank or eradicated tumors.
row.field_list_description: An experimental CAR T-cell therapy may have potential as a treatment for several types of childhood cancer, results from a new study in mice suggest. The CAR T cells eradicated tumors in mouse models of several different childhood cancers, including two forms of sarcoma and medulloblastoma.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Testicular Germ Cell Cancer
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Testicular Germ Cell Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of TCGA's study of testicular germ cell cancer, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Testicular Germ Cell Cancer

row.title: Dormant Tumor Cells Can Be Sensitized to Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Sensitizing Dormant Tumor Cells to Chemotherapy
row.field_page_description: Strategy looks to slow or prevent metastatic breast cancer by targeting hidden, dormant cancer cells.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approach targets hidden cancer cells linked to metastasis.
row.field_list_description: A new study in mice shows that disrupting the relationship between breast cancer cells that spread to bone and normal cells surrounding them makes the cancer cells sensitive to treatment.

row.title: Studying “Total Diet” and Its Impact on Health, Including Cancer Risk
row.field_short_title: Studying the Impact of Total Diet on Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: Dr. Jill Reedy explains a shift in diet and cancer risk studies, with researchers using a holistic approach that analyzes dietary patterns across the lifespan.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers are changing how they assess the effect of diet on cancer, health.
row.field_list_description: Researchers are shifting how they assess diet and cancer risk, looking beyond the impact of individual foods or nutrients on health, and taking a more holistic approach, considering dietary patterns across the lifespan.

row.title: Engineered ECM Platforms to Analyze Progression in High Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: Engineered ECM Platforms Analyze Progression in High Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer

row.title: Genomic Test Helps Identify Thyroid Nodules That Don’t Require Surgery
row.field_short_title: Test Identifies Thyroid Nodules That Don’t Require Surgery
row.field_page_description: A new test measures genomic changes in thyroid biopsy samples and generates a score based on how strongly each change is associated with thyroid cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Test measures genomic changes that have been linked to thyroid cancer.
row.field_list_description: The test measures genomic changes in thyroid biopsy samples and generates a score based on how strongly each change is associated with thyroid cancer. A study showed the test accurately identified samples that, after surgery, were found to be benign.

row.title: Targeted Treatment for Rare Digestive Tract Cancers May Extend Survival
row.field_short_title: Targeted Treatment for Rare GI Cancers May Extend Survival
row.field_page_description: In patients with biliary tract cancer with a BRAF mutation, treatment with dabrafenib plus trametinib shrank tumors, results from a phase 2 trial show.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dabrafenib plus trametinib shrank tumors with a specific BRAF gene mutation.
row.field_list_description: In an early-phase trial, dabrafenib plus trametinib shrank tumors in patients with biliary tract cancer and adenocarcinoma of the small intestine whose tumors had a specific mutation in the BRAF gene.

row.title: Adamantinoma
row.field_page_description: Adamantinoma is a rare bone cancer, which mostly grows in the lower leg, tough it can apear in the forearm, jaw, hands, or feet. Adamantinoma is a serious condition. Treatment is important for survival, but it is possible to make a full recovery.
row.field_list_description: Adamantinoma is a rare bone cancer, which mostly grows in the lower leg, tough it can apear in the forearm, jaw, hands, or feet. Adamantinoma is a serious condition. Treatment is important for survival, but it is possible to make a full recovery.

row.title: Medullary thyroid cancer
row.field_page_description: Medullary thyroid cancer, or MTC, is a cancer that forms in the medulla, or the inside of the thyroid. It is the rarest type of thyroid cancer. Learn more about the diagnosis, treatment, and prognosis of MTC.
row.field_list_description: Medullary thyroid cancer, or MTC, is a cancer that forms in the medulla, or the inside of the thyroid. It is the rarest type of thyroid cancer.

row.title: Who is MyPART?
row.field_page_description: The team of doctors, nurses, scientists, and other staff who make up MyPART are working together to improve the lives of children, adolescents, and young adults with rare solid tumors. Learn more about us!
row.field_feature_card_description: MyPART is made up of a team of doctors, nurses, scientists, and other staff.
row.field_list_description: The team of doctors, nurses, scientists, and other staff who make up MyPART are working together to improve the lives of children, adolescents, and young adults with rare solid tumors.

row.title: Contact MyPART
row.field_page_description: Get in touch with the scientists and staff of MyPART, the My Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor network.
row.field_feature_card_description: There are several ways to get in touch with us and learn more about MyPART.
row.field_list_description: There are several ways to get in touch with us and learn more about MyPART.

row.title: Contact the Division of Cancer Biology
row.field_page_description: Find staff and contact information for DCB's offices and branches.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find staff and contact information for DCB's offices and branches.

row.title: Persistence of Genetic Mutations after Chemotherapy Linked to Poor Outcomes in Some Patients with AML
row.field_short_title: Mutation Persistence after Chemotherapy Linked to Poor Outcomes in AML
row.field_page_description: The persistence of genetic mutations in some patients with acute myeloid leukemia may allow physicians to better classify their risk of recurrence.
row.field_feature_card_description: Survival, time to relapse substantially greater when no post-treatment mutations detected.

row.title: New on NCI’s Websites
row.field_page_description: An update about new websites and online content from NCI
row.field_feature_card_description: An update about new websites and online content from NCI
row.field_list_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Bringing Cancer Research to the Public: NCI’s Networks and Programs
row.field_short_title: Bringing Cancer Research to the Public: NCI’s Networks and Programs
row.field_page_description: A number of NCI programs and networks are the foundation of the National Cancer Program and play a critical role in promoting progress.
row.field_feature_card_description: Networks ensure NCI can respond to changes in knowledge, technology, and policy.

row.title: Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR)
row.field_short_title: Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR)
row.field_page_description: The Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR) advises the NCI Director, staff, and advisory boards on legislative and Congressional activities as they relate to the NCI mission.
row.field_feature_card_description: Advises NCI staff and advisory boards on legislative and Congressional activities as they relate to the NCI mission.

row.title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Patients with Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab to Treat Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved the drug pembrolizumab to treat patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) whose tumors express a protein called PD-L1.
row.field_feature_card_description: The drug is used to treat patients whose tumors express a protein called PD-L1.

row.title: Patient Safety in Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Information about how the rights and safety of people who take part in clinical trials are protected.
row.field_feature_card_description: There are federal rules in place to help ensure the safety and ethics of clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: There are federal rules in place to help protect the rights and safety of people who take part in clinical trials. Learn about informed consent, institutional review boards (IRB's), and how trials are closely monitored.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for prostate cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names.

row.title: Combining Immunotherapy and Radiation against Cancer
row.field_short_title: Combining Immunotherapy and Radiation against Cancer
row.field_page_description: Read how an NCI-funded team led by Robert Vonderheide showed the promise of combining immune checkpoint inhibitors and radiation therapy in melanoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: A cross-disciplinary team is demonstrating the promise of combining radiation and checkpoint inhibitors.

row.title: NCI Summer Curriculum: Strengthening Global Cancer Research Capacity
row.field_short_title: NCI Summer Curriculum: Strengthening Global Cancer Research Capacity
row.field_page_description: Interested in learning about principles and practice of cancer prevention and control and molecular prevention? Read NCI Summer Curriculum: Strengthening Global Cancer Research Capacity and learn details about 2019 courses.
row.field_list_description: Cancer Prevention Fellowship Program (CPFP) hosts the 2018 NCI Summer Curriculum featuring two courses: The Principles and Practice of Cancer Prevention and Control (PPCPC) and the Molecular Prevention Course. The program provides a multidisciplinary overview of the principles and practices of cancer prevention and control from both, the public health and the basic biology perspectives.

row.title: Can Topical Drugs Help Prevent Breast Cancer?
row.field_short_title: Can Topical Drugs Help Prevent Breast Cancer?
row.field_page_description: A topical form of tamoxifen, called 4-OHT, is being tested to see if it can prevent breast cancer as effectively as oral tamoxifen but with fewer side effects.
row.field_feature_card_description: A gel form of tamoxifen is being tested in clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: Researchers are testing a topical-gel form of the drug tamoxifen to see if it can help prevent breast cancer as effectively as the oral form of the drug but with fewer side effects.

row.title: Drug Combination May Target the Unique Metabolism of Leukemia Stem Cells
row.field_short_title: Drug Combination May Target Metabolism of Leukemia Stem Cells
row.field_page_description: In AML, the drugs venetoclax (Venclexta) and azacitidine (Vidaza) team up to block the unique metabolism of leukemia stem cells, two studies show.
row.field_feature_card_description: Two studies may explain why the drugs generate lasting responses in people with AML.
row.field_list_description: Two new studies show how the drugs venetoclax (Venclexta) and azacitidine (Vidaza) team up to block the unique metabolism of leukemia stem cells and may explain why the drug combination is effective against acute myeloid leukemia.

row.title: Anaplastic thyroid cancer
row.field_page_description: Anaplastic thyroid cancer, or ATC, is a type of thyroid cancer. It is a rare type, making up 1% to 2% of thyroid cancer cases.

row.title: Neuroblastoma
NUT midline carcinoma
Center for Cancer Research Rare Tumor Clinics
row.field_page_description: Each year, the MyPART team hosts clinics on select rare tumors at the NIH Clinical Center in Bethesda, MD. During these one to three-day meetings, people with the rare tumor and experts from around the country meet to learn more about the tumor from each other.
row.field_feature_card_description: The MyPART team hosts clinics where patients and experts meet to learn more about the tumor from each other.
row.field_list_description: Each year, the MyPART team hosts clinics on select rare tumors at the NIH Clinical Center in Bethesda, MD. During these one- to three-day meetings, people with the rare tumor and experts from around the country meet to learn more about the tumor from each other.

row.title: Cancer Research Interns
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Research Interns (CRI) summer program goal is to train a diverse number of students in labs and branches across the Center for Cancer Research.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Uveal Melanoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of TCGA's study of uveal (intraocular or eye) melanoma, including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Uveal Melanoma

row.title: Patient-Derived Models Consortium
Using the Immune System in the Fight Against Cancer: Discovery of Rituximab
row.field_page_description: NCI funded the development of rituximab, one of the first monoclonal antibody cancer treatments. With the discovery of rituximab, more than 70 percent of patients diagnosed with non-hodgkin lymphoma now live five years past their initial diagnosis.

row.title: Off-Label Drug Use in Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Off-Label Drug Use in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Learn what off-label drug use is and its role in cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn what off-label drug use is and its role in cancer treatment.

row.title: Research Advocacy at NCI
row.field_page_description: Research advocates bring the patient perspective to NCI's work, informing research focus and supporting timely, relevant, and effective advances in cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Research advocates bring the patient's perspective to NCI's work across the cancer care and cancer research continuum.
row.field_list_description: The cancer patient perspective that research advocates bring into NCI’s research enterprise helps to inform research focus and support the dissemination of results that lead to new and better cancer prevention, detection, and treatment methods.

row.title: Next Round of Grant Solicitations for Provocative Questions Announced
row.field_short_title: Next Round of Grant Solicitations for Provocative Questions Announced
row.field_page_description: The next round of grant solicitations for Provocative Questions has been announced.
row.field_feature_card_description: Grants cover 12 new questions generated by researchers.

row.title: Pancreatic Cancer Study Finds Possible Diagnostic Marker in Blood
row.field_short_title: Possible Diagnostic Marker for Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: A protein attached to vesicles circulating in the blood could be a biological marker for detecting early signs of pancreatic cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Study detects exosomes shed by pancreatic cancer cells into the blood.

row.title: Oncolytic Virus Therapy Shows Benefit in Patients with Melanoma
row.field_short_title: Oncolytic Virus Therapy Shows Benefit in Patients with Melanoma
row.field_page_description: In a large clinical trial, the oncolytic virus therapy T-VEC improved the durable response rate and median survival in patients with advanced melanoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment also appears to stimulate immune response against cancer cells.

row.title: RAS Lab Discussion Forum
row.field_page_description: RAS Lab is an online discussion forum to facilitate the exchange of scientific information among researchers in cancers related to RAS.
row.field_feature_card_description: RAS Lab is an online discussion forum to facilitate the exchange of scientific information among researchers in cancers related to RAS.

row.title: Cancer Research in the Media: International Workshop for Scientific Journalism
row.field_page_description: Cancer Research in the Media (CRiM) is a two-day seminar designed for international journalists to increase their understanding of complex scientific findings, improving their ability to communicate accurate cancer-related information to the public.
row.field_feature_card_description: CRiM is a two-day seminar designed for international journalists to increase their understanding of complex scientific findings.

row.title: Pursuing a Cancer Prevention Vaccine
row.field_short_title: Pursuing a Cancer Prevention Vaccine-Olivera Finn, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Read the story of NCI-funded scientist Olivera Finn whose research led to the first clinical trial of a prevention vaccine for people at high risk for cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Olivera Finn, Ph.D., has pursued this goal since her research team discovered the first tumor antigen.

row.title: Running (and Eating) Away from Cancer
row.field_short_title: Running (and Eating) Away from Cancer-Sue Wharfe
row.field_page_description: Learn how Sue Wharfe benefitted from taking part in a clinical trial of exercise and nutrition for breast cancer survivors that was supported by NCI funding.
row.field_feature_card_description: Is obesity associated with worse survival for patients with breast cancer? Sue Wharfe participated in a study to address this question.

row.title: Addressing Cancer Disparities in Appalachia
row.field_short_title: Addressing Cancer Disparities in Appalachia-Electra Paskett, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Dr. Electra Paskett addresses cancer disparities through science and community partnerships. With NCI’s support, her efforts have made improvements in underserved communities.
row.field_feature_card_description: Electra Paskett, Ph.D., has devoted her career to addressing cancer disparities in the United States.

row.title: Combining Drugs to Treat Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: Combining Drugs to Treat Ovarian Cancer-Betsy Brauser
row.field_page_description: Approximately 70 percent of women diagnosed with ovarian cancer will die from the disease. Read about the NCI-funded combination drug trial that has successfully treated Betsy Brauser's recurrent cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Betsy Brauser participated in a phase 1 clinical trial testing a drug combination to treat ovarian cancer.

row.title: Blood Test Shows Promise for Detecting Genetic Changes in Brain Tumors
row.field_short_title: Blood Test May Detect Genetic Changes in Brain Tumors
row.field_page_description: The minimally invasive test could be used to identify and follow molecular changes in children with highly lethal brain tumors called diffuse midline gliomas.
row.field_feature_card_description: The minimally invasive test could be used in kids with highly lethal gliomas.
row.field_list_description: A liquid biopsy blood test can detect DNA from brain tumors called diffuse midline gliomas, researchers have found. This minimally invasive test could be used to identify and follow molecular changes in children with these highly lethal brain tumors.

row.title: The Cancer Moonshot: Moving from Planning to Research
row.field_short_title: The Cancer Moonshot: Moving from Planning to Research
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Moonshot is supporting innovative science, as it moves from the planning phase to the research phase, explains NCI’s Dr. Dinah Singer.
row.field_feature_card_description: An update on the science of the Cancer Moonshot initiative.
row.field_list_description: Dr. Dinah Singer, co-chair of the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel, provides an update to the cancer community on the science being supported under the Moonshot initiative.

row.title: Site Map
Drugs Approved for Stomach (Gastric) Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for stomach (gastric) cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Vulvar Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for vulvar cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: CAR T Cells: Expanding into Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: CAR T Cells Expanding into Multiple Myeloma
row.field_page_description: CAR T-cell therapy is showing promise in multiple myeloma, according to recently presented data from two early-phase clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients in two early-phase trials responded to treatment, but longer follow-up is needed.
row.field_list_description: Results from two early-phase trials presented at the American Society of Clinical Oncology annual meeting suggest that an immunotherapy using genetically engineered immune cells may be effective in patients with advanced multiple myeloma.

row.title: Mostafa Nokta, M.D., Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Learn more about Mostafa Nokta, M.D., Ph.D., director of the AIDS Cancer Clinical Program in the Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn more about Mostafa Nokta, M.D., Ph.D., director of the AIDS Cancer Clinical Program in the Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy.

row.title: Taking Part in Cancer Treatment Research Studies
row.field_short_title: Taking Part in Cancer Treatment Research Studies
row.field_page_description: Covers things you should know and think about when deciding to take part in a cancer treatment clinical trial.
row.field_feature_card_description: This updated booklet explains cancer treatment trials and helps you think about whether to take part.

row.title: Center for Cancer Training (CCT)
row.field_page_description: CCT's mission is to catalyze the development of a 21st century workforce capable of advancing cancer research through a scientifically integrated approach.
row.field_feature_card_description: The mission is to catalyze the development of a 21st century cancer research workforce.

row.title: About the NCI Cancer Bulletin
row.field_page_description: The NCI Cancer Bulletin is an award-winning online newsletter published by the National Cancer Institute from January 2004 through January 2013.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about the NCI Cancer Bulletin

row.title: Partnerships to Advance Cancer Health Equity (PACHE)
row.field_short_title: Partnerships to Advance Cancer Health Equity (PACHE)
row.field_page_description: PACHE fosters collaboration among institutions serving underserved health disparity populations and NCI-Designated Cancer Centers.
row.field_feature_card_description: PACHE fosters collaboration among institutions serving underserved health disparity populations and NCI-Designated Cancer Centers.
row.field_list_description: PACHE fosters collaboration among institutions serving underserved health disparity populations and NCI-Designated Cancer Centers to train scientists and deliver cancer advances to underserved communities.

row.title: Building Partnerships Begins at Home
row.field_page_description: Building Partnerships Begins at Home
row.field_feature_card_description: Building Partnerships Begins at Home

row.title: Children's Assent
row.field_page_description: Assent is the process of involving children in the decision to take part in research studies.
row.field_feature_card_description: Assent is the process of involving children in the decision to take part in research studies.

row.title: Keep Up with Your Daily Routine
row.field_page_description: Tips on managing your daily life, incorporating fun, humor, and physical activities.
row.field_feature_card_description: Manage your daily life, incorporating fun, humor, and physical activities.

row.title: Your Faith and Spirituality
row.field_page_description: What spirituality means to you, how cancer may affect and change your spirituality and values, and finding comfort and meaning.
row.field_feature_card_description: What spirituality means to you, how cancer may affect and change your spirituality and values, and finding comfort and meaning.

row.title: Modified Immunotherapy Approach Shows Promise for Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Modified Immunotherapy Approach Shows Promise for Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post highlighting a new study of a modified immunotherapy approach that uses immune cells called natural killer cells.
row.field_feature_card_description: A modified immunotherapy shows promise in some patients with acute myeloid leukemia.
row.field_list_description: Researchers have developed an immunotherapy approach that uses immune cells whose natural cancer killing abilities have been enhanced in the lab. In a small clinical trial, the treatment led to remissions in about half of patients with acute myeloid leukemia.

row.title: FDA Approves Trabectedin to Treat Two Types of Soft Tissue Sarcoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved trabectedin for patients with advanced liposarcoma and leiomyosarcoma whose cancer has progressed after prior treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approval for two sarcoma subytpes.

row.title: Study Sheds Light on Role of Inherited Mutations in Childhood Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Sheds Light on Role of Inherited Mutations in Childhood Cancer
row.field_page_description: In the most comprehensive study of its kind conducted to date, more than 8 percent of children with cancer were found to have inherited genetic mutations associated with a predisposition to the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Finding may influence patient care, counseling for parents, siblings.

row.title: The Ruth L. Kirschstein NRSA Institutional Research Training Grant (T32)
row.field_page_description: Institutional award for predoctoral or postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who are pursuing careers in basic science.

row.title: Mentored Patient-Oriented Research Career Development Award (K23)
row.field_page_description: For postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who are clinical scientists pursuing careers in patient-oriented research.

row.title: Vaccine Reduces HPV Infections in Young Men
row.field_short_title: Vaccine Reduces HPV Infections in Young Men
row.field_page_description: An international randomized clinical trial has shown that the vaccine Gardasil can reduce the incidence of anogenital human papillomavirus (HPV) infections in young men 16 to 26 years of age at the time of vaccination.
row.field_feature_card_description: An international randomized clinical trial has shown that the vaccine Gardasil can reduce the incidence of anogenital human papillomavirus (HPV) infections in young men 16 to 26 years of age at the time of vaccination.

row.title: Targeted Therapies Sunitinib and Everolimus Improve Survival for Patients with Rare Type of Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_short_title: Targeted Therapies Improve Survival for Patients with Rare Pancreatic Cancers
row.field_page_description: In 2011, based on initial findings from two clinical trials, the Food and Drug Administration approved sunitinib and everolimus for patients with pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors. Updated results from the everolimus trial were published in September 2016.
row.field_feature_card_description: The drugs increased the length of time patients with pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors survived overall and without their disease progressing.

row.title: Anyone Can Get Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: No matter if your skin is light, dark, or somewhere in between, everyone is at risk for skin cancer. Learn what skin cancer looks like, how to find it early, and how to lower the chance of skin cancer.

row.title: Contact OGCR
row.field_page_description: Contact the Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR) if you have any questions or need more information on federal legislation and congressional activity affecting cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Contact the Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR) if you have any questions or need more information on federal legislation and congressional activity affecting cancer research.

row.title: Federal Health Legislation
row.field_page_description: Legislation from the current Congress dealing with federal health related to NCI.

row.title: National Cancer Act of 1971
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Act of 1971, signed into law by President Richard Nixon, established the National Cancer Institute in its current form.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for breast cancer. The list includes generic names, brand names, and common drug combinations, which are shown in capital letters.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Melanoma
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for melanoma. The list includes generic names and brand names.

row.title: The NCI Transition Career Development Award (K22)
Denosumab Reduces Risk of Bone Side Effects in Advanced Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Denosumab Reduces Risk of Bone Side Effects in Advanced Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: The biological agent denosumab (Xgeva) is more effective than zoledronic acid at decreasing the risk of bone fractures and other skeletal-related events (SRE) in men with castration-resistant metastatic prostate cancer, according to results from a randomi
row.field_feature_card_description: The biological agent denosumab is more effective than zoledronic acid at decreasing the risk of bone fractures in men with castration-resistant metastatic prostate cancer, according to results from a randomized trial.
row.field_list_description: The biological agent denosumab (Xgeva) is more effective than zoledronic acid at decreasing the risk of bone fractures and other skeletal-related events (SRE) in men with castration-resistant metastatic prostate cancer, according to results from a randomized clinical trial reported online February 25, 2011, in The Lancet.

row.title: Research Team Members
row.field_page_description: Information about the different types of experts involved in designing and running a clinical trial.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about the different types of experts involved in designing and running a clinical trial.

row.title: Researcher Interview: Matthew Meyerson
row.field_page_description: CCG Interview with Matthew Meyerson
row.field_feature_card_description: Researcher Interview: Matthew Meyerson
row.field_list_description: In this interview, Matthew Meyerson, M.D., Ph.D., Professor of Pathology at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute and Harvard Medical School, talks about the clinical impact of his research on lung cancer and discusses developing technologies and ongoing challenges in the field of cancer genomics.

row.title: Committees of Interest
row.field_page_description: Learn more about the specific committees which appropriate funds, authorize programs, or oversee activities of the National Cancer Institute.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn more about the specific committees which appropriate funds, authorize programs, or oversee activities of the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: National Cancer Act of 1937
row.field_page_description: National Cancer Act of 1937, signed into law by President Franklin D. Roosevelt, created the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for bladder cancer. The list includes generic names, brand names, and common drug combinations, which are shown in capital letters.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Colon and Rectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Colon and Rectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for use in colon cancer and rectal cancer. The list includes generic names, brand names, and common drug combinations, which are shown in capital letters.

row.title: Ruth L. Kirschstein NRSA for Individual Predoctoral MD/PhD Degree Fellows (F30)
The Pathway to Independence Award (K99/R00)
row.field_page_description: For postdoctoral candidates and mentored junior faculty who have less than 5 years of research experience since earning their doctoral degree.

row.title: Ruth L. Kirschstein NRSA for Senior Fellows (F33)
Certain Physicians Are More Likely to Refer Patients to Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: Certain Physicians Are More Likely to Refer Patients to Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: According to a survey-based study of more than 1,500 physicians treating patients with lung or colorectal cancer, medical oncologists were the most likely and surgeons the least likely to refer patients to, or enroll them in, clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: According to a survey-based study of more than 1,500 physicians treating patients with lung or colorectal cancer, medical oncologists were the most likely and surgeons the least likely to refer patients to, or enroll them in, clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: According to a survey-based study of more than 1,500 physicians treating patients with lung or colorectal cancer published online February 11, 2011 in the Journal of the National Cancer Institute, medical oncologists were the most likely and surgeons the least likely to refer patients to, or enroll them in, clinical trials.

row.title: Spanish-Language Social Media at NCI
New Targeted Treatment May Slow Disease in Patients with Advanced GIST
row.field_short_title: New Targeted Treatment May Slow Disease in Patients with Advanced GIST
row.field_page_description: A new oral drug, regorafenib (Stivarga®), may delay the progression of advanced gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST) that are resistant to treatment, according to results from an international clinical trial published November 22, 2012, in The Lancet.
row.field_feature_card_description: A new oral drug, regorafenib (Stivarga®), may delay the progression of advanced gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST) that are resistant to treatment, according to results from an international clinical trial published November 22, 2012, in The Lancet.

row.title: Biomarker, Imaging and Quality of Life Studies Funding Program (BIQSFP)
row.field_short_title: Biomarker, Imaging and Quality of Life Studies Funding Program (BIQSFP)
row.field_page_description: Funding for NCTN and NCORP Research Bases to support biomarker, imaging, quality of life and cost-effectiveness studies (BIQSFP) associated with network trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Funded NCTN and NCORP Research Bases can apply for special funding.
row.field_list_description: Funded NCTN and NCORP Research Bases can apply for funding to support biomarker, imaging, and quality of life studies with or without Cost-Effectiveness Analysis (CEA) proposals associated with NCI network trials.

row.title: Monoclonal Antibody Therapy for Relapsed or Treatment-Resistant Neuroblastoma
row.field_short_title: Monoclonal Antibody Therapy for Relapsed or Treatment-Resistant Neuroblastoma
row.field_page_description: NCI is sponsoring two clinical trials of a monoclonal antibody called ch14.18, in combination with other drugs, to see if the antibody may be helpful for children or young adults (up to age 21) with relapsed or refractory neuroblastoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is sponsoring two clinical trials of a monoclonal antibody called ch14.18, in combination with other drugs, to see if the antibody may be helpful for children or young adults (up to age 21) with relapsed or refractory neuroblastoma.
row.field_list_description: NCI is sponsoring two clinical trials of a monoclonal antibody called ch14.18, in combination with other drugs, to see if the antibody may be helpful for children or young adults (up to age 21) with relapsed or refractory high-risk neuroblastoma.

row.title: CRCHD Dialogue on Disparities
row.field_page_description: Blog from CRCHD. Stay up-to-date with cancer health disparities issues and read CRCHD spotlights on promising research findings and program updates.
row.field_feature_card_description: Stay up-to-date with cancer health disparities issues and read CRCHD spotlights on promising research findings and program updates.
row.field_list_description: Stay up-to-date with cancer health disparities issues and read CRCHD spotlights on promising research findings and program updates.

row.title: About Cancer Health Disparities
Disparities Research
Providing Your Tissue for Research: What You Need To Know
row.field_short_title: Providing Your Tissue for Research: What You Need To Know
row.field_page_description: Covers things you should know and think about when deciding to donate your tissue to research. Tissue can include materials from your body such as skin, hair, nails, blood, and urine.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers things you should know and think about when deciding to donate your tissue to research. Tissue can include materials from your body such as skin, hair, nails, blood, and urine.

row.title: Understanding Prostate Changes: A Health Guide for Men
row.field_short_title: Understanding Prostate Changes: A Health Guide for Men
row.field_page_description: Explains prostate cancer symptoms, risk factors, the PSA test, and other prostate conditions including BPH and prostatitis.
row.field_feature_card_description: Explains prostate cancer symptoms, risk factors, the PSA test, and other prostate conditions including BPH and prostatitis.

row.title: Archived International Conference on HIV/AIDS Meeting Materials
row.field_short_title: Archived International Conference on HIV/AIDS Meeting Materials

row.title: Large Study Verifies Cancer Risk for Women Carrying BRCA1 or BRCA2 Mutations
row.field_short_title: Study Affirms Cancer Risk for Women with BRCA Mutations
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a large, prospective study of breast, ovarian, and contralateral breast cancer risks associated with BRCA1 and BRCA2 gene mutations.
row.field_feature_card_description: High lifetime risks of breast and ovarian cancers confirm earlier findings.
row.field_list_description: Results from the first large prospective study of breast and ovarian cancer risk in women with inherited mutations in the BRCA 1 or BRCA2 genes confirm the high risks estimated from earlier, retrospective studies.

row.title: NCI’s Technology Transfer Center—Moving Inventions and Ideas from the Lab to Patients: An Interview with Dr. Michael Salgaller
row.field_short_title: Technology Transfer: From the Lab to Patients
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post featuring an interview with Dr. Michael Salgaller about how NCI’s Technology Transfer Center helps to move NCI-developed technologies from the lab to the bedside.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI's Technology Transfer Center helps to advance inventions ‘across the finish line.’
row.field_list_description: An interview with Dr. Michael Salgaller about how NCI’s Technology Transfer Center helps to move new technologies developed by NCI and NIH scientists from the lab to the bedside.

row.title: FDA Clears Wider Use of Cooling Cap to Reduce Hair Loss during Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: FDA Clears Wider Use of Cooling Cap
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about FDA’s clearance of the DigniCap Scalp Cooling System for use in reducing hair loss during chemotherapy by patients with any type of solid tumor.
row.field_feature_card_description: The clearance covers patients with any type of solid tumor receiving chemotherapy.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has cleared a cooling cap—a device designed to reduce hair loss during chemotherapy called the DigniCap Scalp Cooling System—for use by patients with any type of solid tumor.

row.title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Some Metastatic Colorectal Cancers
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved nivolumab (Opdivo®) for metastatic colorectal cancer with tumors that have alterations that affect DNA repair, as this Cancer Currents post explains.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approval applies to patients whose tumors have specific genetic alterations.
row.field_list_description: FDA has granted accelerated approval to the immunotherapy drug nivolumab (Opdivo®) for patients with metastatic colorectal cancer whose tumors have alterations that affect DNA repair.

row.title: Prior Approval Requests
row.field_page_description: Approval from NIH may be required before a cancer research grant recipient makes budget modifications or undertakes particular activities. Learn how to request approval.
row.field_feature_card_description: Prior written approval from NIH may be required before modifying grant budget or activities.
row.field_list_description: The recipient institution is permitted some flexibility for rebudgeting between budget categories, but some actions require prior approval from the NCI. Requests must be submitted at least 30 days before the proposed change.

row.title: Health Disparities Resources
September Spotlight: Childhood Cancer Awareness Month and other Cancer Awareness Highlights
row.field_short_title: September Spotlight: Childhood Cancer Awareness Month and other Cancer Awareness Highlights
row.field_page_description: In September, CRCHD joins the rest of the nation in recognizing Childhood Cancer Awareness Month, Leukemia and Lymphoma Awareness Month, and Prostate Cancer Awareness Month.
row.field_feature_card_description: In September, CRCHD joins the rest of the nation in recognizing Childhood Cancer Awareness Month, Leukemia and Lymphoma Awareness Month, and Prostate Cancer Awareness Month.

row.title: Community Networks Program (CNP)
When Cancer Returns
row.field_page_description: Covers the physical and emotional issues related to having a cancer recurrence.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers the physical and emotional issues related to having a cancer recurrence.

row.title: Facing Forward: When Someone You Love Has Completed Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Facing Forward: When Someone You Love Has Completed Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Covers coping strategies to help cancer caregivers adjust their focus to the recovery phase once treatment is over for their loved one with cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers coping strategies to help cancer caregivers adjust their focus to the recovery phase once treatment is over for their loved one with cancer.

row.title: What Do We Mean By "RAS Pathway"?
row.field_short_title: What Do We Mean By "RAS Pathway"?
row.field_page_description: Frank McCormick, scientific lead of the RAS Initiative, requests input from the RAS community to update our conception of the "RAS pathway".
row.field_feature_card_description: What Do We Mean By "RAS Pathway"?

row.title: Facing Cancer with Your Spouse or Partner
row.field_short_title: Facing Cancer with Your Spouse or Partner
row.field_page_description: Practical and supportive information to help you face cancer with your spouse or partner. Includes tips to help improve communication.
row.field_feature_card_description: Practical and supportive information to help you face cancer with your spouse or partner.

row.title: Survivorship
row.field_page_description: After cancer treatment, the transition to a new way of life can be hard. Find out how to plan for follow-up care and adjust to physical, emotional, and family changes.
row.field_feature_card_description: Many cancer survivors say that once treatment ended, it was hard to make a transition to a new way of life. Find out how to adjust to the new feelings and issues that arise when cancer treatment is over.
row.field_list_description: Many cancer survivors say that once treatment ended, it was hard to make a transition to a new way of life. Find out how to adjust to physical and emotional changes, deal with common family issues, and plan for follow-up care after treatment.

row.title: CCG Welcomes a New Genomic Data Analysis Network
row.field_short_title: CCG's New Genomic Data Analysis Network
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG) awarded a new Genomic Data Analysis Network (GDAN), comprised of thirteen centers of three types: Processing, Specialized, and Visualization.

row.title: 2nd Annual Intra-NCI Global Cancer Research Day: Highlighting Prevention and Screening
row.field_short_title: 2nd Annual Intra-NCI Global Cancer Research Day
row.field_page_description: 2nd Annual Intra-NCI Global Cancer Research Day: Highlighting Prevention and Screening (GCR2016)
row.field_feature_card_description: 2nd Annual Intra-NCI Global Cancer Research Day: Highlighting Prevention and Screening (GCR2016)

row.title: Examining the Effects of Presurgical Treatment for Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Effects of Presurgical Treatment for Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this study, men diagnosed with androgen-sensitive prostate cancer with intermediate- or high-risk features will be examined with mpMRI, undergo targeted biopsies, and be treated with neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this study, men diagnosed with androgen-sensitive prostate cancer with intermediate- or high-risk features will be examined with mpMRI, undergo targeted biopsies, and be treated with neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy.

row.title: Track 4: Cancer Prevention Product Research and Review for Postdoctoral Research Fellows
row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train individuals in the medical product development and application process. Learn more about this cancer training program.
row.field_feature_card_description: Training to facilitate novel approaches to cancer prevention.
row.field_list_description: This interagency program trains individuals in the medical product development processes and their application to study populations, including healthy subjects, to facilitate the movement of novel approaches from the bench to the community.

row.title: IOTF Mentors: Track 1 and Track 2
row.field_page_description: While at FDA, fellows are assigned a mentor who is a senior member of FDA scientific review staff. Learn more about mentors for Tracks 1 and 2.
row.field_feature_card_description: Senior members of FDA scientific review staff mentor IOTF fellows in tracks 1 and 2.

row.title: GICR Partners Task Force for Cancer Registration in Vietnam
row.field_short_title: GICR Partners Task Force for Cancer Registration in Vietnam
row.field_page_description: Global taskforce aims strengthen population-based cancer registries with improved operations, access to case reports, and cancer surveillance.
row.field_feature_card_description: Partners aim to improve registry operations and cancer surveillance.
row.field_list_description: NCI joins global taskforce to strengthen population-based cancer registries with improved registry operations, access to case reports, and cancer surveillance.

row.title: Nivolumab Improves Survival for Patients with Recurrent Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: Nivolumab for Recurrent Head and Neck Cancer Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improved overall survival compared with standard chemotherapy in patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a phase III trial, the drug improved overall survival better than chemotherapy.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial showed that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improved overall survival compared with standard chemotherapy in patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.

row.title: Patient Education Publications

row.field_feature_card_description: Explains next steps after an abnormal mammogram result, including information about how conditions are diagnosed and treated.

row.title: Crunching Numbers: What Cancer Screening Statistics Really Tell Us
row.field_short_title: Crunching Numbers: What Cancer Screening Statistics Really Tell Us
row.field_page_description: Cancer screening studies have shown that more screening does not necessarily translate into fewer cancer deaths. This article explains how to interpret the statistics used to describe the results of screening studies.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn to interpret the statistical results of cancer screening studies.

row.title: Contact & Staff Bios

The RAS Initiative - Welcome
row.field_page_description: Blog post from Dr. Harold Varmus, introducing the collaborative initiative to study RAS and provide better treatment for the many cancers driven by RAS mutations around the world.
row.field_list_description: Former NCI Director and Nobel Laureate Harold Varmus describes the origins, goals, structure, and oversight of the RAS Initiative.

row.title: Radiation Therapy and You: Support for People With Cancer
row.field_page_description: This booklet explains the different types of radiation therapy, what people can expect during treatment, side effects that may happen and ways to manage them.

row.field_page_description: Find a list of frequently asked questions related to Biomarker, Imaging and Quality of Life Studies Funding Program (BIQSFP).

row.title: Counseling Improves Survivorship Plan Implementation for Low-Income Breast Cancer Survivors
row.field_short_title: Counseling Improves Survivorship Care Plan Implementation
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a randomized trial that showed that low-income women who received counseling and a survivorship care plan got improved follow-up care
row.field_feature_card_description: Low-income women who role-played talking with their doctor about their plan got better care.
row.field_list_description: In a randomized trial, low-income women who role-played talking with their doctor about their survivorship care plan in a counseling session reported receiving more of their recommended care than women who did not get counseling.

row.title: Exceptional Responders Initiative: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Exceptional Responders Initiative: Questions and Answers
row.field_page_description: NCI has embarked on the Exceptional Responders Initiative to understand the molecular underpinnings of exceptional responses to treatment, primarily via chemotherapy, in cancer patients.

row.title: Find a Cancer Center
row.field_page_description: Find the locations of NCI-designated cancer centers by area, region, state, or name that includes contact information to help health care providers and cancer patients with referrals to clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Use the map or list to find centers by area, region, state, or name.

row.title: Approaching Pediatric Cancers through a Global Lens
row.field_short_title: Approaching Pediatric Cancers through a Global Lens
row.field_page_description: Since the incidence of pediatric cancer is relatively constant worldwide, strengthening population-based registries to collect data on the extent of disease at diagnosis would be helpful in determining if late diagnosis may explain difference in outcome globally.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approaching Pediatric Cancers through a Global Lens

row.title: 1,3-Butadiene
row.field_page_description: Learn about 1,3-butadiene, exposure to which can raise your risk of leukemia. 1,3-Butadiene is a gas used to produce synthetic rubber products, such as tires, resins, and plastics. Other sources of exposure include car exhaust; tobacco smoke; and polluted air and water near industrial facilities.

row.title: January Monthly Spotlight: Cervical Health and Cervical Cancer Disparities
row.field_short_title: January Monthly Spotlight: Cervical Health and Cervical Cancer Disparities
row.field_page_description: In January, CRCHD joins the nation in raising awareness for Cervical Health and Cervical Cancer Disparities. This month we share a special focus on NCI/CRCHD research programs that are trying to reduce cervical cancer disparities in underserved communities and the people who are spreading the word about the importance

row.title: Midostaurin Approved by FDA for Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on the FDA approval of midostaurin for patients with newly diagnosed acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and mutations in the FLT3 gene.
row.field_feature_card_description: The targeted drug is the first new AML treatment to be approved in decades.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved midostaurin for patients with newly diagnosed acute myeloid leukemia (AML) with mutations in the FLT3 gene. The approval also covers several rare conditions.

row.title: NCI Cancer Moonshot℠ Public Access and Data Sharing Policy

row.field_page_description: NCI has established a data sharing policy that supports open, public access to all research and data for projects funded as part of the Cancer Moonshot. Find details on the policy.

row.field_page_description: TMEN funded cancer research investigated mechanisms of a tumor’s interaction with its surrounding environment.
row.field_feature_card_description: TMEN funded research into the mechanisms of tumor-host interactions in human cancer.
row.field_list_description: The Tumor Microenvironment Network was an NCI-funded Program that supported research towards better understanding the mechanisms of a tumor’s interaction with its surrounding environment.

row.field_page_description: Blog posts on cancer treatment research—including new treatments for cancer and their effects, clinical trial results, and overcoming treatment resistance—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: New on NCI’s Websites for May 2017

row.field_list_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: 2015 Outstanding Investigator Award Recipients
row.field_short_title: 2015 Recipients of NCI Outstanding Investigator Awards
row.field_page_description: Learn how these investigators' projects aim to break new ground in biomedical, behavioral, and clinical cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn how these investigators' projects aim to break new ground in biomedical, behavioral, and clinical cancer research.

row.title: Celebrating 21 Years of the CURE Program
row.field_short_title: Celebrating 21 Years of the CURE Program
row.field_page_description: In honor of the 21st anniversary of the Continuing Umbrella of Research Experiences (CURE) program, CRCHD will host “Celebrating 21 Years of the CURE Program” on June 27, 2017.
row.field_feature_card_description: CRCHD will host “Celebrating 21 Years of the CURE Program” on June 27, 2017.

row.title: Engineered Invasive Human Breast Tumors with Integrated Capillaries and Lymphatics
row.field_page_description: This collaborative study seeks to develop and apply new methods of engineering human breast tumors that allow for modular control over key aspects of a tumor and its microenvironment.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI-funded grant investigating Engineered Invasive Human Breast Tumors.

row.title: Improving Cancer Control in Rural Communities: Next Steps
row.field_short_title: Improving Cancer Control in Rural Communities
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post from NCI’s Dr. Robert Croyle on how the institute is working to address disparities in cancer outcomes in US rural communities.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is working on multiple fronts to improve cancer control in rural areas.
row.field_list_description: Studies continue to show disparities in cancer outcomes for people who live in rural parts of the United States. NCI’s Dr. Robert Croyle explains how the institute is working with multiple partners to better understand and address these disparities.

row.title: Cancer Prevention Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Prevention Steering Committee reviews innovative cancer prevention, screening, and surveillance concepts.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Cancer Prevention Steering Committee reviews innovative cancer prevention, screening, and surveillance concepts.

row.field_page_description: Find diagnosis, staging, and treatment information for these head and neck cancers: hypopharynx, larynx, lip and oral cavity, neck cancer with occult primary, nasopharynx, oropharynx, paranasal sinus and nasal cavity, and salivary gland cancer.

row.field_short_title: Head and Neck Cancer Treatment in Adults
row.field_page_description: Find information about prognosis, staging, and treatment for adult head and neck cancer sites: hypopharynx, larynx, lip and oral cavity, neck cancer with occult primary, nasopharynx, oropharynx, paranasal sinus and nasal cavity, and salivary gland cancer.
row.field_list_description: Find information about incidence, risk factors, prognosis, staging, and treatment of the following head and neck cancer sites in adults: hypopharynx, larynx, lip and oral cavity, neck cancer with occult primary, nasopharynx, oropharynx, paranasal sinus and nasal cavity, and salivary gland cancer.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ - Recent Fiscal Year Funding

row.field_feature_card_description: See appropriated funding by fiscal year for the Cancer Moonshot.
