row.field_page_description: Since they first began to be sold in North America in the mid-2000s, electronic cigarettes have been the subject of intense debate. NCI's Dr. Michele Bloch recently presented an update on some of the issues surrounding e-cigarettes.
row.field_feature_card_description: A blog post about the intense debate over electronic cigarettes.
row.field_list_description: Since they first began to be sold in North America in the mid-2000s, electronic cigarettes have been the subject of intense debate. NCI's Dr. Michele Bloch recently presented an update on some of the issues surrounding e-cigarettes.

row.title: Thorium
row.field_page_description: Learn about thorium, which can raise the risk of liver, lung, and pancreatic cancers. The primary ways people are exposed are inhalation, intravenous injection, ingestion, and absorption through the skin.

row.title: Coke Oven Emissions
row.field_page_description: Learn about coke oven emissions, which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Workers at coking plants and coal-tar production plants may be exposed to coke oven emissions.

row.title: The United States - Latin America Cancer Research Network: A multidisciplinary and collaborative approach to conducting clinical cancer research in Latin America
row.field_short_title: US-LA CRN Clinical Cancer Research in Latin America
row.field_page_description: The United States – Latin America Cancer Research Network (US-LA CRN) convened its Annual Meeting, in coordination with the Ministry of Health of Chile to discuss the Network’s first multilateral clinical research study: Molecular Profiling of Breast Cancer (MPBC).

row.title: Nanoparticle that Mimics Salmonella Counteracts Chemotherapy Resistance
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a nanoparticle that mimics Salmonella and may help counteract chemotherapy resistance.
row.field_feature_card_description: Nanoparticle that mimics Salmonella may help counteract chemotherapy resistance.
row.field_list_description: A nanoparticle that mimics Salmonella may help to counteract chemotherapy resistance, according to a new study.

row.title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA granted pembrolizumab accelerated approval for some patients with head and neck cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: First immunotherapy drug approved for patients with this cancer type.
row.field_list_description: FDA granted pembrolizumab an accelerated approval for patients with recurrent or metastatic head and neck cancer that has continued to progress despite standard treatment with chemotherapy.

row.title: Cancer Clinical Trials API
row.field_page_description: Access NCI-supported cancer clinical trials information through an application programming interface (API).

row.title: Learn About the RAS Initiative
row.field_page_description: The RAS Initiative, a "hub and spoke" model, connects researchers to better understand and target the more than 30% of cancers driven by mutations in RAS genes. Includes oversight and contact information.
row.field_feature_card_description: Discover the problem with RAS genes and how the RAS Initiative is structured to oversee and evaluate its goals and progress.
row.field_list_description: The "hub and spoke" model of the RAS Initiative connects researcher collaborators to better understand and target the more than 30% of cancers driven by mutations in RAS genes. Find more on the problem with RAS genes, RAS Initiative origins and oversight, and contact information.

row.title: CGH Roundtable on HPV Screening
row.field_page_description: The NCI Center for Global Health extends its congratulations on Pink Ribbon Red Ribbon’s fifth anniversary and continues to build on its three-year partnership. We look forward to participating in PRRR fifth-anniversary-related activities.

row.title: CGH Announces Recipients of Regional Centers of Research Excellence (RCREs) P20 Grant Awards
row.field_short_title: Recipients of Regional Centers of Research Excellence (RCREs) P20 Grant Awards Announced
row.field_page_description: NCI, Center for Global Health (CGH) release of the applications represents novel global collaborations charged with planning and designing sustainable, Regional Centers of Research Excellence (RCREs) for non-communicable diseases, including cancer, in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) or regions.
row.field_feature_card_description: Recipients of Regional Centers of Research Excellence (RCREs) P20 Grant Awards Announced

row.title: A Key Data Sharing Partnership: The Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation Donates Data to the GDC
row.field_page_description: MMRF will share its genomic and clinical data on multiple myeloma patients through a first of its kind partnership with the NCI Genomic Data Commons (GDC).
row.field_list_description: The Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation (MMRF), an advocacy and research organization, has emerged as a leader in data sharing by donating robust datasets on multiple myeloma to the GDC. By sharing their data, they hope to energize research on multiple myeloma and facilitate advances in cancer care.

row.title: Find NCI-Supported Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Find an NCI-supported clinical trial—and learn how to locate other research studies—that may be right for you or a loved one.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find an NCI-supported clinical trial—and learn how to locate other research studies—that may be right for you or a loved one.

row.title: 3-D View of Mutations May Identify Potential Targets for Cancer Drugs
row.field_short_title: 3-D View of Mutations May Identify Potential Targets for Cancer Drugs
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a new 3-D modeling tool that may help identify effective treatments for some cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: A new tool models how mutations affect the structure of cancer-related proteins and how those proteins may interact with drugs.
row.field_list_description: A new 3-D modeling tool may help identify mutations in cancer cells that could be targeted with new or existing drugs, a new study suggests.

row.title: Anthrax Toxin-Based Cancer Therapy Targets Tumor Blood Vessels
row.field_short_title: Anthrax Toxin-Based Cancer Therapy Targets Tumor Blood Vessels
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study which shows that an anthrax toxin-based cancer therapy may attack tumors by selectively targeting blood vessels that feed them.
row.field_feature_card_description: Therapy based on anthrax toxin has potential to treat different cancer types.
row.field_list_description: A therapy that uses the anthrax toxin selectively targets blood vessels that feed tumors and support their growth and spread, researchers have found.

row.title: CA-125 Testing, CT Scans Still Used for Ovarian Cancer Surveillance Despite Lack of Proven Benefit
row.field_short_title: Tests without Proven Benefit Still Used for Ovarian Cancer Surveillance
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a study that shows clinicians continue to use routine CA-125 testing and CT scans to monitor for recurrences although the benefit of these tests has not been proven
row.field_feature_card_description: Study shows clinicians continue to use CA-125 tests and CT scans to monitor for recurrences.
row.field_list_description: A new study shows clinicians continue to use CA-125 testing and CT scans to monitor for recurrences although the benefit of these tests has not been proven.

row.title: Clearing The Air: Quit Smoking Today
row.field_short_title: Clearing The Air: Quit Smoking Today
row.field_page_description: This booklet outlines successful strategies that can help people quit smoking and stay smoke-free.
row.field_feature_card_description: This booklet outlines successful strategies that can help people quit smoking and stay smoke-free.

row.title: Research Directions for Childhood Cancer
row.field_page_description: NCI has identified areas for which more research is needed on childhood cancers, including investments in basic research, immunotherapies, and moleculary targeted therapies.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI has identified areas for which more research is needed on childhood cancers, and identified opportunities to gain new insights.
row.field_list_description: Making rapid progress against childhood cancers is a high-priority goal for NCI. To that end, NCI has identified areas for which more research is needed on childhood cancers, and identified opportunities to gain new insights.

row.title: RAS Collaborations
row.field_page_description: RAS Initiative collaborations with both organizations and individual scientists have expanded research capabilities and maximized the impact of RAS Initiative discoveries.
row.field_feature_card_description: RAS Initiative collaborations with both organizations and individual scientists have expanded research capabilities and maximized the impact of RAS Initiative discoveries.
row.field_list_description: The RAS Initiative has engaged in numerous formal collaborations with both organizations and individual scientists. These arrangements bring outside expertise to the Initiative's project areas to apply the best ideas and newest technologies to the problem of RAS-driven cancers.

row.title: NCI-DOE Collaboration Paving Way for Large-Scale Computational Cancer Science
row.field_short_title: Paving the Way for Large-Scale Computational Cancer Science
row.field_page_description: NCI and the Department of Energy have entered into a collaboration to develop a plan to use large-scale computing to influence cancer science and, ultimately, clinical treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Effort looks to expand cancer research capabilities, advance strategic computing.

row.title: What’s New on NCI’s Websites?
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.
row.field_list_description: NCI is constantly publishing new information on its websites, so periodically we provide updates on new content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Study of Cancer’s Origins Reveals Genetic Reprogramming of Single Cells
row.field_short_title: Zebrafish Model of Cancer Reveals Genetic Reprogramming of Single Cells
row.field_page_description: Researchers have used a new zebrafish model of cancer to characterize the early genetic changes associated with the initiation of tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: A new zebrafish model of cancer lets researchers observe early genetic changes in cancer cells.

row.title: High-Magnification Microscopy Visualizes Tumor Blood Vessels in Real Time
row.field_short_title: Researchers visualize tumor blood vessels during surgery
row.field_page_description: High powered intravital microscopy reveals that 50 percent of blood vessels in melanoma tumors do not have any blood flow, according to a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Intravital microscopy visualizes blood vessels in human tumors in real time.
row.field_list_description: High-powered intravital microscopy reveals that 50 percent of blood vessels in melanoma tumors do not have any blood flow, according to a new study.

row.title: Blocking Calcium Transfer May Selectively Kill Cancer Cells
row.field_short_title: Blocking Calcium Transfer May Selectively Kill Cancer Cells
row.field_page_description: A new study shows that blocking the transfer of calcium ions into mitochondria is toxic to cancer cells and impairs growth of tumors in mice, while sparing normal cells.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this mouse study, the new approach created an “energy crisis” from which cancer cells can’t recover.
row.field_list_description: A new study shows that blocking the transfer of calcium ions (Ca2+) into mitochondria is toxic to cancer cells and impairs growth of tumors in mice, while sparing normal cells.

row.title: The Cancer Community's Next Steps for the Moonshot Initiative
row.field_short_title: Next Steps for the Moonshot Initiative
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Moonshot Initiative’s Blue Ribbon Panel is moving quickly to develop recommendations on how to accelerate progress against cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The blue ribbon panel for Vice President Biden’s moonshot initiative is moving quickly ahead with its work.

row.title: Midcareer Investigator Award in Patient-Oriented Research (K24)
Grantee Spotlight: Beatriz M. Carreno, Ph.D. - Seeking a Vaccine to Cure Melanoma
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Beatriz M. Carreno, Ph.D. - Seeking a Vaccine to Cure Melanoma
row.field_page_description: CRCHD grantee Dr. Beatriz Carreno is studying the use of vaccines as a potential cure for metastatic melanoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: CRCHD grantee Dr. Beatriz Carreno is studying the use of vaccines as a potential cure for metastatic melanoma.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Dr. Meena Jaggi - Investigating Curcumin (Turmeric) as HPV Repressor for Native American Women
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Dr. Meena Jaggi - Investigating Curcumin (Turmeric) as HPV Repressor for Native A
row.field_page_description: Dr. Meena Jaggi’s research, funded by an NCI/CRCHD U01 grant, involves the use of curcumin (commonly known as turmeric) to inhibit human papillomavirus (HPV) infection among Native American (NA) women.
row.field_feature_card_description: Dr. Jaggi researches using curcumin to inhibit HPV infection in Native American women.

row.title: A Good Year: FDA Approved Nine New Cancer Drugs in 2014
row.field_short_title: A Good Year: FDA Approved Nine New Cancer Drugs in 2014
row.field_page_description: In 2014, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved 41 drugs that had not been approved previously for any indication, the most in nearly 20 years. Of these 41 novel drugs, 9 were approved for the treatment of cancer or cancer-related conditions.
row.field_feature_card_description: In 2014, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved 41 drugs that had not been approved previously for any indication, the most in nearly 20 years.

row.title: Finding Health Care Services
row.field_page_description: If you have been diagnosed with cancer, finding a doctor and treatment hospital for your cancer care is an important step to getting the best treatment possible. Learn tips for choosing a doctor and treatment facility to manage your cancer care.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn tips for choosing a doctor and a hospital or treatment facility to manage your cancer care.
row.field_list_description: If you have been diagnosed with cancer, finding a doctor and treatment facility for your cancer care is an important step to getting the best treatment possible. Learn tips for choosing a doctor and hospital or treatment facility to manage your cancer care.

row.title: Using Trusted Resources
row.field_page_description: Information to help people evaluate the source and credibility of health information that they find in print or online.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information to help people evaluate the source and credibility of health information that they find in print or online.
row.field_list_description: Some online sources can provide misleading or incorrect information. Health information, whether in print or online, should come from a trusted, credible source

row.title: Skin and Nail Changes during Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments can cause skin to become dry, itchy, red, or peel. Nails may become dark, yellow, or cracked. Learn about signs of skin problems that may need urgent medical care. Get a helpful list of questions to ask your doctor.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes skin and nail changes, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to prevent or manage them.

row.title: Lymphedema and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Lymphedema is a side effect of some cancer treatments. Symptoms of lymphedema are presented. Ways to treat or manage swelling in the arm or leg are covered for cancer patients and cancer survivors.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes lymphedema, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage or treat it.

row.title: Symptoms of Cancer
row.field_page_description: Cancer can cause different symptoms, such as abnormal bumps, night sweats, or unknown weight gain or loss. Only a doctor can tell if symptoms are caused by cancer or some other problem.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer has many different symptoms. Only a doctor can tell if your symptoms are caused by cancer.
row.field_list_description: Cancer can cause many different symptoms. Only a doctor can tell if your symptoms are caused by cancer or some other problem.

row.title: Intramural Investigators Submitting Data
row.field_page_description: Find general requirements for intramural investigators submitting genomic data. Different processes may exist based on operational differences in NCI intramural research programs.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Endometrial Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for endometrial cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Extramural vs Intramural and RMS Funding
row.field_page_description: See a comparison of extramural funding and intramural and research management funding by mechanism since 2014.
row.field_feature_card_description: See a comparison of extramural and intramural funding by mechanism since 2014.
row.field_list_description: See total dollar amounts and a comparison of extramural funding versus intramural and research management and support funding.

row.title: Test May Identify Poor Prognosis for Some Patients with Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: Test May Identify Poor Prognosis for Some Patients with Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: A panel of three genetic markers may help to identify patients with early-stage lung cancer who have a very strong likelihood of their disease returning after surgery.
row.field_feature_card_description: Markers could help guide decisions on post-surgical therapy.

row.title: Targeted Therapies, Tooth Extraction, and Metastasis
row.field_short_title: Targeted Therapies, Tooth Extraction, and Metastasis
row.field_page_description: Resistance often develops to targeted cancer drugs. Mouse studies indicate that dying cancer cells secrete signals that help other cancer cells survive.

row.title: FDA Approves Expanded Indication for Carfilzomib in Patients with Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves New Indication for Carfilzomib
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved carfilzomib in combination with other anticancer drugs to treat patients with relapsed multiple myeloma.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approval expands indication for carfilzomib in patients with multiple myeloma.

row.title: Risk of Breast Cancer Death is Low After a Diagnosis of Ductal Carcinoma in Situ
row.field_short_title: Risk of Breast Cancer Death is Low After DCIS Diagnosis
row.field_page_description: Women who are diagnosed with a condition called ductal carcinoma in situ generally have a low risk of dying from breast cancer, a new study has found.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment to prevent recurrence doesn’t reduce breast cancer death risk.

row.title: Skillful News Reporting Drives Progress in Research

row.field_page_description: Call for Applications for Cancer Research in the Media Workshops in India: Deadline Extended to September 4, 2015.

row.title: Researcher Interview: Tom Hudson

row.title: Join the Conversation about the Annual Plan and Budget
row.field_page_description: We invite you to comment on blog posts and discuss the Annual Plan and Budget Proposal with the cancer research community.

row.title: Information on DCB Funding Mechanisms

row.field_list_description: DCB uses different funding mechanisms to support investigator-initiated cancer research including Funding Opportunity Announcements (FOAs), Program Announcements (PA), Requests for Application (RFA), and Notices (NOT).

row.title: TCGA Wins 2015 Sammies People’s Choice Award

row.title: A Holistic Approach to Cancer Health Disparities
row.field_short_title: A Holistic Approach to Cancer Health Disparities
row.field_page_description: Recognizing that complex factors underlie health disparities, NCI is taking a holistic approach in our efforts to address this serious public health issue.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI leaders discuss efforts in biology, clinical trials, and training a more diverse workforce. Join our Twitter chat, 3 pm ET, Nov. 18.

row.title: Hearings and Testimonies
row.field_page_description: Written testimony from NCI experts from appropriations hearings and other hearings focused on cancer research and related topics.

row.field_list_description: Find written testimony from NCI experts from appropriations hearings and other hearings focused on a particular cancer related topic.

row.title: Patient with Brain Tumor Responds Dramatically to Targeted Therapy
row.field_short_title: Patient with Brain Tumor Responds Dramatically to Targeted Therapy
row.field_page_description: A patient with a papillary craniopharyngioma saw his tumor shrink more than 80 percent after treatment with a targeted drug that inhibits a mutant form of the BRAF protein.
row.field_feature_card_description: Findings suggest a potential new therapeutic strategy.

row.title: Legislative History

row.title: Treating Cancer without Harming the Heart
row.field_short_title: Treating Cancer without Harming the Heart
row.field_page_description: Researchers from the fields of oncology and cardiology are working to find ways to prevent, manage, and possibly even reverse the cardiovascular side effects of certain cancer therapies.

row.field_list_description: Some cancer treatments may damage the heart, and researchers from the fields of oncology and cardiology are working to find ways to prevent, manage, and possibly even reverse these side effects.

row.title: NCI’s Office of Cancer Survivorship: Celebrating 20 Years, Planning for Continued Progress

row.title: Immune-Cell Traps May Aid Cancer Metastasis
row.field_short_title: Immune-Cell Traps May Aid Cancer Metastasis
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a new study that suggests cancer cells may exploit a normal function of neutrophils, a type of immune cell, to help form metastatic tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Drug that disintegrates traps may hinder cancer from spreading.
row.field_list_description: Cancer cells may exploit a normal function of neutrophils, the most common form of white blood cell, to help form metastatic tumors, a new study suggests.

row.title: Screen to Save: NCI Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative
row.field_page_description: NCI Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative aims to increase colorectal cancer screening rates among ethnically and racially diverse and rural communities nationwide.

row.title: Pembrolizumab Improves Survival for Some Patients with Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that pembrolizumab improved progression-free and overall survival for patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Pembrolizumab improved survival for patients with advanced disease.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial showed that the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) improved progression-free and overall survival among patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer compared with chemotherapy.

row.title: Researchers Design a Precise Library for CRISPR-Mediated Genetic Screens
row.field_page_description: Researchers used machine learning method to optimize CRISPR libraries for genomic studies.
row.field_list_description: Researchers in the Cancer Target Discovery and Development Network used machine learning to create improved CRISPR libraries for genomic studies. Their new libraries of single guide RNAs can be used to alter gene expression with greater sensitivity and specificity.

row.title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Hodgkin Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Hodgkin Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s approval of pembrolizumab for the treatment of some adult and pediatric patients with classical Hodgkin lymphoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: The checkpoint inhibitor is approved for adults and children with refractory or relapsed disease.
row.field_list_description: The FDA approved pembrolizumab for the treatment of some adult and pediatric patients with classical Hodgkin lymphoma.

row.title: NCI's Genome Characterization Pipeline
row.field_page_description: The Genome Characterization Pipeline, run by NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics, transforms cancer tissue samples into rich genomic datasets that are shared with the research community.
row.field_feature_card_description: This efficient workflow transforms cancer tissue samples into rich, publicly available genomic and clinical data. CCG partners with expert research teams to produce and share high quality, harmonized raw and processed data with researchers worldwide.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Genome Characterization Pipeline is an efficient workflow that transforms cancer tissue samples into rich, publicly available genomic and clinical data. By partnering with foremost experts in tissue processing, bioinformatics, and data science, CCG produces and shares high quality, harmonized raw and processed data with researchers worldwide.

row.title: Patients Who Choose No Intervention for Small Thyroid Cancers Report Lack of Support
row.field_short_title: Choosing No Intervention for Thyroid Cancer Can Be Difficult
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study showing that patients with early stage thyroid cancers who don’t pursue immediate intervention experience a lack of support from doctors, loved ones.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients with small thyroid cancers who choose not to pursue immediate intervention report lack of support.
row.field_list_description: Patients who choose not to pursue immediate biopsy or treatment for small, asymptomatic thyroid cancers, or suspected cancers, can experience a lack of support from doctors and loved ones, a new study shows.

row.title: Aiming to Prevent Hereditary Cancers, Researchers Focus on Lynch Syndrome

row.field_page_description: An NCI research update article about a workshop to discuss new strategies for preventing hereditary cancers by using Lynch syndrome as a model.
