row.title: Diagnosis and Staging
row.field_page_description: Cancer can cause many different symptoms. The doctor will order tests to determine if symptoms are caused by cancer or some other problem. If cancer is diagnosed, the doctor will run tests to determine the stage. Knowing the stage helps the doctor plan treatment and discuss prognosis.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer can cause many different symptoms. The doctor will order tests to determine if symptoms are caused by cancer or some other problem.

row.title: Gardasil 9 Vaccine Protects against Additional HPV Types
row.field_short_title: Gardasil 9 Protects against Additional HPV Types
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a large randomized clinical trial that shows a new human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine effectively prevented infection and disease caused by seven HPV types that cause cancer and two HPV types that cause genital warts.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a large randomized clinical trial, a new human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine effectively prevented infection and disease caused by seven HPV types that cause cancer and two HPV types that cause genital warts.
row.field_list_description: In a large randomized clinical trial, a new human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine effectively prevented infection and disease caused by nine HPV types, including seven types that cause cervical and other cancers—five of which were not covered by the previously available HPV vaccines—and two types that cause genital warts.

row.title: Health Economics Fellowships in Cancer
The International Cancer Control Partnership (ICCP)
row.field_page_description: The ICCP is a collaboration of governments, United Nations agencies, and Non-government organizations (NGOs) that work together to reduce the global burden of cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The ICCP works together to reduce the global burden of cancer by ensuring countries have national cancer control plans.
row.field_list_description: The ICCP is a collaboration of governments, United Nations agencies, and Non-government organizations (NGOs) that work together to reduce the global burden of cancer by ensuring countries have national cancer control plans.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Multicentric Castleman Disease
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Multicentric Castleman Disease
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for mutlicentric Castleman disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for mutlicentric Castleman disease.

row.title: Office of Advocacy Relations
row.field_page_description: OAR brings the cancer advocacy and NCI communities together to help identify research opportunities that speed advances and improve patient outcomes.
row.field_feature_card_description: OAR brings the cancer advocacy and NCI communities together to help identify research opportunities that speed advances and improve patient outcomes.

row.title: Brain Malignancies Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Brain Malignancies Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization, and evaluation of concepts for large phase 2 and phase 3 clinical trials in both adult and pediatric brain cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The BMSC evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Brain Malignancy Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: Breast Cancer Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Breast Cancer Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization, and evaluation of concepts for phase 2 and phase 3 treatment trials in adult breast cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Breast Cancer Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Breast Cancer Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: Stories of Discovery
row.field_page_description: Read these stories describing landmark developments in cancer prevention and treatment supported by NCI funding.
row.field_feature_card_description: Collection of stories that describe landmark developments in cancer prevention and treatment supported by NCI funding.
row.field_list_description: Collection of stories that describe landmark developments in cancer prevention and treatment supported by NCI funding.

row.title: Radium-223 Improves Survival in Patients with Advanced Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a phase III trial that compared radium-223 dichloride plus the best standard of care versus a placebo plus the best standard of care in men with metastatic, castration-resistant prostate cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from a phase III trial show that radium-223 dichloride (Xofigo®) improves overall survival in men with advanced prostate cancer that has spread to their bones compared with placebo.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial show that radium-223 dichloride (Xofigo®) improves overall survival in men with advanced prostate cancer that has spread to their bones compared with placebo.

row.title: Preventing Stomach Cancer: The Link to H. pylori Bacteria
row.field_short_title: The Link to H. pylori Bacteria
row.field_page_description: NCI supported research to solidify the link between H. pylori infections and stomach cancer. As a result, new cancer treatment and prevention strategies are being developed, encouraging scientists to carefully examine other cancers for viral and bacterial connections.

row.title: About the Office of Advocacy Relations
row.field_page_description: OAR works with cancer research advocates and organizations to ensure the advocacy community's perspectives and ideas are integrated into NCI activities to advance research.
row.field_list_description: OAR links NCI and the advocacy community to communicate NCI priorities and ensure appropriate involvement of research advocates in Institute activities to advance research.

row.title: Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award (NRSA) for Individual Postdoctoral Fellows (F32)
row.field_page_description: For postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who have Ph.D.s and are pursuing careers in basic science.

row.title: Novel Combination Chemotherapy for Localized Ewing Sarcoma
row.field_short_title: Novel Combination Chemotherapy for Localized Ewing Sarcoma
row.field_page_description: In this clinical trial, researchers will test whether the addition of the drug combination vincristine, topotecan, and cyclophosphamide to a standard chemotherapy regimen improves overall survival in patients with extracranial Ewing
row.field_feature_card_description: In this clinical trial, researchers will test whether the addition of the drug combination vincristine, topotecan, and cyclophosphamide to a standard chemotherapy regimen improves overall survival in patients with extracranial Ewing
row.field_list_description: In this clinical trial, researchers will test whether the addition of the drug combination vincristine, topotecan, and cyclophosphamide to a standard chemotherapy regimen improves overall survival and event-free survival in newly diagnosed patients with non-metastatic Ewing sarcoma of the bone or soft tissue (excluding the soft tissue of the skull).

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Treatment Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Treatment Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Suggested questions to ask your doctor, if you are thinking about taking part in a clinical trial.
row.field_feature_card_description: Suggested questions to ask your doctor, if you are thinking about taking part in a clinical trial.
row.field_list_description: If you are thinking about taking part in a clinical trial, be sure to ask your doctor if there is a trial you can join. If your doctor offers you a trial, here are some questions you may want to ask.

row.title: Scientific Review
row.field_page_description: Scientific review ensures that studies are based on sound science, which contributes to the safety of clinical trial participants. Learn about the role of Institutional Review Boards (IRBs), Data and Safety Monitoring Boards (DSMBs), and government agenci
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about the role of scientific review in protecting the safety of participants in cancer clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: Scientific review ensures that research studies are based on sound science, which contributes to the safety of clinical trial participants. Learn about the role of Institutional Review Boards (IRBs), Data and Safety Monitoring Boards (DSMBs), and government agencies in this review process.

row.title: Special Funding
row.field_page_description: Funding opportunities for biomarker, imaging, quality of life and cost effectiveness studies (BIQSFP) and mid-career clinical investigators (CCITLA)
row.field_feature_card_description: Explore funding opportunities for biomarker, imaging, quality of life and cost effectiveness studies (BIQSFP) and mid-career clinical investigators (CCITLA).
row.field_list_description: Explore funding opportunities for biomarker, imaging, quality of life and cost effectiveness studies (BIQSFP) and mid-career clinical investigators (CCITLA).

row.title: The HPV Vaccine: Increasing the Use of an Important Cancer Prevention Tool
row.field_short_title: President’s Cancer Panel Report: Increasing HPV Vaccine Use
row.field_page_description: A new report on the HPV vaccine from the President’s Cancer Panel identifies priorities and strategies for improving uptake of this cancer prevention tool.
row.field_feature_card_description: President’s Cancer Panel identifies priorities, strategies for increasing vaccine uptake.
row.field_list_description: Dr. Barbara Rimer, chair of the President’s Cancer Panel, summarizes the panel’s recent report on the HPV vaccine, which includes priorities and strategies to ensure that more people receive this critical cancer vaccine.

row.title: 2019 Speakers for the Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers Course
row.field_short_title: 2019 Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers Course Speakers

row.title: Johns Hopkins/NCI Molecular Target and Drug Discovery Fellowship
row.field_short_title: JHU and NCI Molecular Target and Drug Discovery Fellowship
row.field_page_description: Training fellows in bioassay development, chemical libraries, molecular targets and cancer, and high-throughput screening laboratory automation.

row.title: Director’s Innovation Award Program
row.field_page_description: The NCI Director’s Intramural Innovation Award Program is designed to support development of highly innovative approaches and technology aimed at significant problems from across the CCR portfolio.

row.title: Managing Cancer Pain: Are Better Approaches on the Horizon?
row.field_short_title: Developing Better Approaches for Managing Cancer Pain
row.field_page_description: Pain is common in cancer patients and long-term survivors, so researchers are studying potential new pain medications and nondrug approaches for cancer pain.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers are studying potentially nonaddictive medications and non-drug treatments.
row.field_list_description: Pain is a common and much-feared symptom among people with cancer and long-term survivors. As more people survive cancer for longer periods, there is a renewed interest in developing new, nonaddictive approaches for managing their chronic pain.

row.title: Contracting Opportunities
row.field_page_description: Contracting opportunities with the National Cancer Institute can be found in several different ways. The NCI Office of Acquisitions also works to connect small and disadvantaged buisnesses with subcontracting opportunities.
row.field_list_description: Explore the different ways to find NCI contracting and subcontracting opportunities, as well as upcoming small business events.

row.title: Glioblastoma Study Highlights Sex Differences in Brain Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Reveals Sex Differences in Glioblastoma
row.field_page_description: Men and women with glioblastoma appear to respond differently to treatment. A new study identifies biological factors that might contribute to this sex difference.
row.field_feature_card_description: Biological factors may explain differences in treatment response by men and women.
row.field_list_description: Men and women with glioblastoma appear to respond differently to standard treatment. A new study identifies biological factors that might contribute to this sex difference.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Gastric Adenocarcinoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of TCGA's study of gastric adenocarcinoma (stomach cancer), including what was known prior to the study and main findings from the characterization and analysis.
row.field_feature_card_description: TCGA's Study of Gastric Adenocarcinoma

row.title: Immunotherapy Effective in Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Effective in Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma
row.field_page_description: In some people with alveolar soft part sarcoma (ASPS), atezolizumab (Tecentriq) shrank tumors or stopped them from growing, a small clinical trial has shown.
row.field_feature_card_description: Checkpoint inhibitor may be new option for rare, hard-to-treat cancer.
row.field_list_description: People with advanced alveolar soft part sarcoma (ASPS), a rare cancer, appear to benefit from a type of immunotherapy called an immune checkpoint inhibitor, according to results from a small clinical trial.

row.title: 2019 Press Releases
row.field_page_description: Press releases from NCI for the year 2019.
row.field_list_description: Press releases from the National Cancer Institute for the year 2019.

row.title: MyPART Upcoming Events
row.field_page_description: MyPART team members are participating in meetings to talk about our programs and to answer questions. Find us at events across the country!
row.field_list_description: MyPART team members are participating in meetings to talk about our programs.

row.title: CRCHD Supplements Café celebrates Black History Month
row.field_short_title: CRCHD Supplements Café celebrates Black History Month
row.field_page_description: In observance of Black History month, CRCHD staff will be blogging about influential black doctors, scientists, and medical innovators, as well as rising stars from our portfolio.

row.title: Partnering with Small Business to Advance Innovation in Cancer Research and Care
row.field_short_title: Partnering with Small Business to Advance Progress against Cancer
row.field_page_description: The NCI director describes how NCI’s SBIR/STTR programs act as “engines of innovation” and shares new recommendations for strengthening the programs.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI’s SBIR/STTR programs are “engines of innovation,” NCI Director says.
row.field_list_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless describes how NCI’s Small Business Innovation Research and Small Business Technology Transfer Programs act as “engines of innovation” and shares recommendations from a federal working group for strengthening the programs.

row.title: NCI Director’s Intramural Innovation Award Program
row.field_short_title: NCI Director’s Intramural Innovation Award Program

row.title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_short_title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_page_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that vemurafenib and ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that vemurafenib and ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for the disease.
row.field_list_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that the molecularly targeted agent vemurafenib and the immunotherapy agent ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for a disease in which effective treatments have been lacking.

row.title: U.S. and Peru Formalize Alliance in Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: U.S. and Peru Formalize Alliance in Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) Center for Global Health (CGH) had the pleasure of welcoming a delegation of health officials from the Government of Peru for the signing of a memorandum of understanding (MOU) between the U.S. and Peru.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI Center for Global Health and Peru agree to expand knowledge exchange and cancer research.

row.title: Taking Food Away: Targeting Nutrient Scavenging by RAS-driven Cancers
row.field_short_title: Taking Food Away: Targeting Nutrient Scavenging by RAS-driven Cancers
row.field_page_description: Cancers driven by mutant KRAS genes are more dependent on scavenging nutrients from the tumor microenvironment, via macropinocytosis, and from internal recycling of cellular components, via autophagy. These differences may be cancer vulnerabilities.

row.title: Anyone Can Get Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: Covers skin cancer risk information for minority audiences. The goal of the brochure is to dispel the belief that only people with light skin are at risk for skin cancer.

row.title: Intraperitoneal Chemotherapy in Advanced Ovarian Cancer Improves Survival, But Is Underused
row.field_short_title: IP Chemo for Ovarian Cancer is Underused
row.field_page_description: Use of intraperitoneal chemotherapy, along with intravenous chemotherapy, improves survival in some women with advanced ovarian cancer, but its use in clinical practice has been limited, according to a new study.
row.field_feature_card_description: Intraperitoneal chemotherapy improves survival in advanced ovarian cancer. Its underuse may be due to side effects, technical challenges.

row.title: The Biology of Cancer Health Disparities
row.field_short_title: The Biology of Cancer Health Disparities
row.field_page_description: These examples show how biology contributes to health disparities (differences in disease incidence and outcomes among distinct racial and ethnic groups, ), and how biological factors interact with other relevant factors, such as diet and the environment.

row.title: About the Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy
row.field_page_description: Find helpful information about the GDS Policy, including when the policy applies, example projects, and providing informed consent.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find helpful information about the GDS Policy, including when the policy applies, example projects, and providing informed consent.
row.field_list_description: The NIH Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy was issued to promote broad and robust sharing of genomic research data and ensure proper oversight and appropriate protections for research involving human data.

row.title: "Fine Tuning" Engineered T Cells May Extend Immunotherapy Approach to More Cancer Types
row.field_short_title: Expanding Immunotherapy to More Cancer Types
row.field_page_description: Engineering immune cells to have a decreased affinity for their targets on cancer cells may not weaken their efficacy but may reduce the risk of side effects.
row.field_feature_card_description: Early studies explore ways to ‘fine tune’ immune cells to treat cancer.

row.title: NCI at APHA 2018
row.field_page_description: Check out this year’s APHA Annual Meeting schedule to see which NCI experts will be presenting, which poster sessions feature NCI research, and interactive sessions to attend with NCI experts.

row.title: NCI Grant Policies
row.field_page_description: Research grants are subject to a variety of policy requirements. Find highlights of policy announcements or changes specific to NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: Research grants are subject to a variety of policy requirements. Find highlights of policy announcements or changes specific to NCI.

row.title: In Triple-Negative Breast Cancer, Targeting an Addiction
row.field_short_title: In Triple-Negative Breast Cancer, Targeting an Addiction
row.field_page_description: A new approach to disrupting genes that promote the development and spread of tumors may hold promise for treating an aggressive and difficult-to-treat type of breast cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The new therapy targets and disrupts genes driving this difficult-to-treat type of cancer.

row.title: NCI-MATCH Update: More Labs, New Arms, and Initial Findings
row.field_short_title: NCI-MATCH: More Labs, New Arms, and Initial Findings
row.field_page_description: The NCI-MATCH cancer precision medicine trial is adding new treatment arms and testing labs, and reporting initial findings, NCI’s Dr. Lyndsay Harris explains.
row.field_feature_card_description: An update on the largest precision medicine trial of its kind.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Dr. Lyndsay Harris provides an update on the NCI-MATCH trial, including the opening of new trial treatment arms and the addition of new laboratories to perform testing on tumor samples of prospective trial participants.

row.title: Chondromyxoid fibroma
Rhabdoid Tumor
The Role of Advocacy in MyPART
row.field_short_title: The Role of Advocacy in MyPART
row.field_page_description: Our mission is to engage patients as partners in rare tumor research. Non-profit organizations dedicated to improving the experiences and outcomes of people with rare solid tumors are important members of the MyPART network.
row.field_feature_card_description: Non-profit organizations are important members of the MyPART network.
row.field_list_description: In the MyPART network, our mission is to engage patients as partners in rare tumor research. Advocacy groups like yours are a critical bridge between patients and researchers as you help share experience and expertise between these groups. Non-profit organizations dedicated to improving the experiences and outcomes of people with rare solid tumors are important members of the MyPART network.

row.title: What Is MyPART?
row.field_page_description: MyPART is a group of scientists, patients, family members, advocates, and healthcare providers who want to help find treatments for rare cancers. We are working on childhood, teen, and young adult solid rare tumors that have no cures.
row.field_feature_card_description: MyPART is a group of scientists, patients, family members, advocates, and healthcare providers working on rare tumors.
row.field_list_description: MyPART is the My Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor network. It is a group of scientists, patients, family members, advocates, and healthcare providers who want to help find treatments for rare cancers. We are working on childhood, teen, and young adult solid rare tumors that have no cures. We think that working as a team will help us find treatments for rare cancers faster. Everyone can play a part.

row.title: Statistical Analysis of Research Data
row.field_page_description: The Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD) course is designed to provide NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows an overview on the general principles of statistical analysis of research data.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD) course is designed to provide NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows an overview on the general principles of statistical analysis of research data.

row.title: New on NCI Websites for December 2018
row.field_short_title: New on NCI Websites for December 2018
row.field_page_description: See selected content that has been added to NCI’s websites as of December 2018, in this Cancer Currents blog post.
row.field_feature_card_description: An update on new content of interest to the cancer community recently added to NCI’s websites.
row.field_list_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community. See selected content that has been added as of December 2018.

row.title: News

row.title: CCR Fellows and Young Investigators Association
row.field_page_description: The Fellows and Young Investigators Association enhances the intramural training program by organizing, promoting and informing the NCI fellows of career development and training opportunities at the NIH. This association fosters communcation among fellows, NCI research community and senior management.

row.title: Comparing Relaxation Programs for Breast Cancer Patients Receiving Radiotherapy
row.field_short_title: Comparing Relaxation Programs for Breast Cancer Patients Receiving Radiotherapy
row.field_page_description: In this study, women with breast cancer who have had surgery and are scheduled to undergo radiation therapy will be randomly assigned to one of two different stretching and relaxation programs or to a control group that will receive usual care.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this study, women with breast cancer who have had surgery and are scheduled to undergo radiation therapy will be randomly assigned to one of two different stretching and relaxation programs or to a control group that will receive usual care.

row.title: Chemotherapy and You: Support for People With Cancer
row.field_short_title: Chemotherapy and You: Support for People With Cancer
row.field_page_description: Covers side effects that patients may have during chemotherapy and ways to manage them.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers side effects that patients may have during chemotherapy and ways to manage them.

row.title: Cancer Pain Control: Support for People With Cancer
row.field_short_title: Cancer Pain Control: Support for People With Cancer
row.field_page_description: Covers pain control medicines for cancer patients, pain control plans, talking with your health care team about pain, and coping with the physical and emotional effects of pain.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers pain control medicines for cancer patients, pain control plans, talking with your health care team about pain, and coping with the physical and emotional effects of pain.

row.title: New Drug Shows Promise against Drug-Resistant Leukemias
row.field_short_title: New Drug Shows Promise against Drug-Resistant Leukemias
row.field_page_description: A new drug called ponatinib may be a new treatment option for patients with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) that is resistant to other therapies, according to results of two early clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: A new drug called ponatinib may be a new treatment option for patients with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) that is resistant to other therapies, according to results of two early clinical trials.

row.title: Glossary
Preserving Fertility while Battling Cancer
row.field_page_description: Some oncologists neglect to discuss the possibility of treatment-related infertility with patients of reproductive age. Researchers are developing decision aids to help patients make an informed, carefully considered decision about fertility.
row.field_feature_card_description: An article about cancer treatment-related infertility and research on decision aids to help patients make an informed, carefully considered decision about fertility.

row.title: Blocking DNA Repair in Advanced BRCA-Mutated Cancer
row.field_short_title: Blocking DNA Repair in Advanced BRCA-Mutated Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with relapsed or refractory advanced cancer and confirmed BRCA mutations who have not previously been treated with a PARP inhibitor will be given BMN 673 by mouth once a day in 28-day cycles.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this trial, patients with relapsed or refractory advanced cancer and confirmed BRCA mutations who have not previously been treated with a PARP inhibitor will be given BMN 673 by mouth once a day in 28-day cycles.

row.title: NCI and Medical Decision Making
row.field_page_description: NCI conducts and facilitates basic and translational research that can inform standard clinical practice and medical decision making.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information on NCI's role in support of medical decision making.
row.field_list_description: Information on NCI's role in support of medical decision making.

row.title: Mutations in Human Cancers Through the Lens of KRAS
row.field_short_title: Mutations in Human Cancers Related to KRAS
row.field_page_description: Exome sequences from The Cancer Genome Atlas were analyzed for the types of missense mutations in KRAS that were associated with missense mutations in other commonly mutated genes.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancers with high rates of KRAS mutations were analyzed for mutation rates in other genes.

row.title: Healthy Border 2020 Embassy Launch
row.field_page_description: The U.S.-Mexico Border Health Commission launched the Healthy Border 2020 at the Mexican Embassy in the United States on June 24, 2015. This new initiative aims to strengthening what was accomplished on the previous plan of action entitled Healthy Border 2010.

row.title: Fostering Cooperation in Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Thursday, June 25, 2015 Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed between US National Cancer Institute and three agencies of the Indian government - the Department of Biotechnology, the Indian Council of Medical Research, and the Indian National Cancer Institute, a part of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences

row.title: Dr. Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Awards (NRSA)

row.field_page_description: The NCI Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award (NRSA) program helps ensure that a diverse pool of highly trained scientists is available to meet the Nation’s research needs. Learn more about the NRSA program and the types of predoc and postdoc trainees awarded.

row.title: NCI at AACR 2019
row.field_page_description: NCI is participating at the American Association for Cancer Research (AACR) Annual Meeting, March 29-April 3, 2019 at the Georgia World Congress Center in Atlanta, GA. See the schedule of NCI-sponsored sessions and NCI expert booth presentations

row.title: Sessions Featuring NCI Staff
row.field_page_description: The NCI-sponsored sessions at AACR are dedicated to discussing programs held throughout NCI, while the poster sessions and presentations offer a platform for NCI scientists to relay study findings. Find the sessions led by NCI staff at AACR 2019.
row.field_feature_card_description: Each year, NCI sponsors sessions to present and showcase programs and resources.
row.field_list_description: Each year, NCI sponsors sessions to present and showcase programs and resources.

row.title: Treatment for Children with Leukemia Also Effective for Adolescents, Young Adults
row.field_short_title: Childhood Leukemia Treatment Also Effective for Young Adults
row.field_page_description: A treatment regimen designed for children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia is also effective for older adolescents and young adults with the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment will likely become standard for AYAs with this cancer.
row.field_list_description: A clinical trial found that an intensive treatment regimen developed specifically for children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia is also effective for older adolescents and young adults with the disease.

row.title: UK Clinical Trial Compares E-cigarettes, Nicotine-Replacement Products for Smoking Cessation
row.field_short_title: Trial Tests E-cigarettes against Nicotine Replacement
row.field_page_description: E-cigarettes plus counseling may help smokers trying to quit tobacco more than nicotine-replacement products like patches and gums, a UK clinical trial has found.
row.field_feature_card_description: UK study shows e-cigarettes plus counseling improved the ability to quit smoking.
row.field_list_description: Researchers in the United Kingdom have found that e-cigarettes combined with counseling may be more helpful to smokers trying to quit tobacco than nicotine-replacement products, such as patches, gums, and lozenges.

row.title: Now Accepting iCURE Applications for 2019
row.field_page_description: Apply for a Fall 2019 iCURE research experience by March 31, 2019!
row.field_feature_card_description: The Intramural Continuing Umbrella of Research Experiences (iCURE) program is now accepting applications for Fall 2019 research experiences!

row.title: Drugs Approved for Wilms Tumor and Other Childhood Kidney Cancers
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for Wilms tumor and other childhood kidney cancers. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Abiraterone Improves Survival in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Abiraterone Improves Survival in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A multinational phase III trial found that the drug abiraterone acetate prolonged the median survival of patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer by 4 months compared with patients who received a placebo.
row.field_feature_card_description: A multinational phase III trial found that the drug abiraterone acetate prolonged the median survival of patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer by 4 months compared with patients who received a placebo.

row.title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_short_title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_page_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane—used to treat early and advanced breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in high-risk postmenopausal women.
row.field_feature_card_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane—used to treat early and advanced breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in high-risk postmenopausal women.
row.field_list_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane (Aromasin®)—commonly used to treat early and advanced-stage breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in postmenopausal women at high risk of developing the disease.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Liver Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for liver cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI’s Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Targeted Treatments for a Type of Pancreatic Cancer: Rapamycin and Other mTOR Inhibitors
row.field_short_title: Targeted Treatments for a Type of Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: Thanks to discovering the anticancer effects of mTOR inhibitors, cancer treatment for pNet, a rare type of pancreatic cancer, were revolutionized. Through clinical trials, NCI continues to investigate the life-saving potential of mTOR inhibitors.

row.title: NCI and NIH AIDS Funding History
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have made a number of key discoveries in HIV/AIDS research. Find information about the history of funding levels for HIV/AIDS research year over year.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about the history of NCI funding levels for HIV/AIDS research year over year.
row.field_list_description: See the total dollar amount and a comparison of NIH and NCI funding levels for HIV/AIDS research.

row.title: Director's Corner: Professional Development Workshop Helps Early Stage Investigators Build Independent Careers in Scientific Research
row.field_short_title: Director's Corner: Professional Development Workshop Helps Early Stage Investigators
row.field_page_description: The Professional Development and Mock Review Workshop is a seminal event organized each year for CURE scholars and trainees. The event includes informative presentations, interactive discussions, a mock review, and poster session.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Professional Development and Mock Review Workshop is an important annual event.

row.title: National Lung Screening Trial
row.field_page_description: The National Lung Screening Trial (NLST), a research study sponsored by the National Cancer Institute that used low-dose helical CT scans or chest X-ray to screen men and women at risk for lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: The National Lung Screening Trial (NLST) used low-dose helical CT scans or chest X-ray to screen men and women at risk for lung cancer.
row.field_list_description: Information about the National Lung Screening Trial (NLST), a research study sponsored by the National Cancer Institute that used low-dose helical CT scans or chest X-ray to screen men and women at risk for lung cancer.

row.title: Understanding Cervical Changes: A Health Guide for Women
row.field_short_title: Understanding Cervical Changes: A Health Guide for Women
row.field_page_description: Explains next steps after an abnormal Pap or HPV test result, including how cervical conditions are diagnosed and treated – as well as information about screening guidelines and HPV vaccines.
row.field_feature_card_description: Explains next steps after an abnormal Pap or HPV test result, including how cervical conditions are diagnosed and treated – as well as information about screening guidelines and HPV vaccines.

row.title: Facing Forward: Making a Difference in Cancer
row.field_short_title: Facing Forward: Making a Difference in Cancer
row.field_page_description: Covers the different ways of volunteering or becoming involved in cancer-related activities.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers the different ways of volunteering or becoming involved in cancer-related activities.

row.title: Thinking About Complementary and Alternative Medicine
row.field_short_title: Thinking About Complementary and Alternative Medicine
row.field_page_description: Covers how to make informed choices when looking for complementary and alternative medicine (CAM).
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers how to make informed choices when looking for complementary and alternative medicine (CAM).

row.title: CRCHD Diversity Training
row.field_page_description: The Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities (CRCHD) funds cancer research training for those from backgrounds underrepresented in cancer biomedical and behavioral sciences.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities (CRCHD) funds cancer research training for those from backgrounds underrepresented in cancer biomedical and behavioral sciences.

row.title: CURE Scholar Spotlight - Dr. Donita Colette Brady
row.field_page_description: Donita C. Brady, a Research Associate Senior at the Department of Pharmacology and Cancer Biology at Duke University, is investigating the role that copper plays in cell growth and tumor biology. Inspired by her mentor Christopher Counter, a cancer biologist, and Dennis Thiele, a copper biologist, at Duke University, B
row.field_feature_card_description: Donita C. Brady, a Research Associate Senior at the Department of Pharmacology and Cancer Biology at Duke University, is investigating the role that copper plays in cell growth and tumor biology. Inspired by her mentor Christopher Counter, a cancer biolog

row.title: Tackling Cancer Health Disparities: Small Steps, Big Hopes
row.field_page_description: An article about steps for developing and testing ways to reduce—or eliminate—cancer-related health disparities.
row.field_feature_card_description: An article about steps for developing and testing ways to reduce—or eliminate—cancer-related health disparities.
row.field_list_description: Numerous studies have documented disparities in cancer incidence and mortality among certain populations. But, by and large, cancer-related health disparities in the United States have been an intractable problem. Researchers believe the time is now ripe for actively developing and testing ways to reduce—or better yet, eliminate—these disparities.

row.title: National Cancer Institute’s New NCD Coordinator
row.field_short_title: National Cancer Institute’s New NCD Coordinator
row.field_page_description: National Cancer Institute’s New NCD Coordinator

row.title: Talking to Children about Your Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information to help you talk to your kids, teens, and adult children about cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information to help you talk to your kids, teens, and adult children about cancer.

row.title: Follow-Up Medical Care
row.field_page_description: Information about follow-up medical care for patients who have completed cancer treatment. Discusses your follow-up care plan, getting a wellness plan, and guidelines for a healthy lifestyle.
row.field_feature_card_description: Once you're done with cancer treatment, you should receive a follow-up cancer plan from your doctor. Learn more.

row.title: Symposium Brings Rising Global Cancer Burden into Focus
row.field_short_title: Symposium Focuses on Global Cancer Burden
row.field_page_description: The NCI Global Cancer Research Symposium examined ways of increasing research collaboration, particularly in cancer prevention and screening, to reduce the global cancer burden.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI-sponsored event examined ways of increasing research collaboration, particularly in cancer prevention and screening, to reduce the cancer burden.
row.field_list_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about the NCI Global Cancer Research Symposium, which examined ways of increasing research collaboration, particularly in cancer prevention and screening, to reduce the cancer burden.

row.title: NCI’s CRCHD Launches National Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative
row.field_short_title: CRCHD Launches National Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative
row.field_page_description: The NCI CRCHD launches National Screen to Save Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative which aims to increase colorectal cancer screening rates among racially and ethnically diverse and rural communities.
row.field_feature_card_description: A new initiative aims to increase colorectal cancer screening among racially and ethnically diverse communities and in rural areas.
row.field_list_description: The NCI Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities (CRCHD) is pleased to announce the launch of the National “Screen to Save” (S2S) Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative. This innovative initiative aims to increase colorectal cancer screening rates among racially and ethnically diverse and rural communities.

row.title: CGH Continues Building Partnership with the Commonwealth of Independent States at World Cancer Congress
row.field_short_title: Recent Activities with partners in the Commonwealth of Independent States
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Global Health and Commonwealth of Independent States partners collaborate on cancer control in Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan.
row.field_feature_card_description: CGH Continues Building Partnership with the Commonwealth of Independent States at World Cancer Congress
row.field_list_description: During the recent World Cancer Congress, the National Cancer Institute Center for Global Health (NCI CGH) staff had the opportunity to follow up with several partners in the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS). The long-term relationships with CIS countries have recently been reinvigorated following the Central Asia Leadership Forum (CALF) that was co-sponsored by NCI CGH and the Uzbekistan National Cancer Center in Tashkent, Uzbekistan, in October 2015.

row.title: Monitoring Research Grant Awards
row.field_page_description: NCI grants management staff regularly monitor individual grants within each budget period and within the overall project period.
row.field_feature_card_description: Monitoring grant awards requires ongoing analysis.
row.field_list_description: NCI grants management and program staff monitor individual grants within each budget period and within the overall project period.

row.title: Neratinib Approved by FDA for HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Neratinib for HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Neratinib (Nerlynx) has been approved by FDA for patients with early-stage HER2-positive breast cancer who have finished at least 1 year of adjuvant therapy with trastuzumab (Herceptin).
row.field_feature_card_description: The drug reduces the risk of recurrence, but has side effects in the gut.
row.field_list_description: FDA has approved neratinib for patients with early-stage HER2-positive breast cancer who have finished at least 1 year of adjuvant therapy with trastuzumab.

row.title: The TAILORx Breast Cancer Trial
row.field_page_description: A collection of material about the Trial Assigning IndividuaLized Options for Treatment (Rx), or TAILORx.
row.field_feature_card_description: A collection of material about the Trial Assigning IndividuaLized Options for Treatment (Rx), or TAILORx.
row.field_list_description: A collection of material about the Trial Assigning IndividuaLized Options for Treatment (Rx), or TAILORx, which will examine whether a molecular test can assign women with early-stage breast cancer to the most appropriate and effective treatment.

row.title: Extragonadal Germ Cell Tumors—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Extragonadal germ cell tumors form in parts of the body outside the gonads. They may begin to grow anywhere in the body, but usually form in the pineal gland in the brain, the chest, the lower part of the spine, or the abdomen. Start here to find information on extragonadal germ cell tumors treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Extragonadal Germ Cell Tumor .

row.title: NCI Budget and Appropriations
row.field_page_description: Information about NCI's current and previous annual budgets, strategic plans for the institute, and Congressional Justification documents.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find information about NCI’s budget activities in relation to grant funding.
row.field_list_description: Information about how NCI allocates its budget to achieve research goals. Learn more about the current fiscal year 2018 budget, the NCI budget process, and recent trends in NCI budgets.

row.title: Ataxia Telangiectasia
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about ataxia telangiectasia (A-T), a rare, recessive genetic disorder of childhood that occurs in between one out of 40,000 and one out of 100,000 persons worldwide.

row.title: Biological Therapies for Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that provides an overview of how the immune system functions and describes the actions of biological therapies.
row.field_feature_card_description: An overview of the immune system and certain biological therapies such as adoptive T-cell transfer, gene therapy, and more.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet that provides an overview of how the immune system functions and describes the actions of biological therapies, such as monoclonal antibodies, cytokines, therapeutic vaccines, the bacterium bacillus Calmet-Guérin, cancer-killing viruses, gene therapy, and adoptive T-cell transfer.

row.title: Urethral Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Urethral cancer is rare and is more common in men than in women. Urethral cancer can metastasize (spread) quickly to tissues around the urethra and has often spread to nearby lymph nodes by the time it is diagnosed. Start here to find information on urethral cancer treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about urethral cancer.

row.title: DINO RNA Molecule Triggers Anticancer Response in Damaged Cells
row.field_short_title: DINO RNA Molecule Triggers Anticancer Response in Damaged Cells
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about a noncoding RNA called DINO, which helps accelerate the cellular self-destruct process that prevents tumor development.
row.field_feature_card_description: A type of RNA may play a critical role in preventing tumor development.
row.field_list_description: Studies in cells and mice found that, in cells with damaged DNA, a noncoding RNA called DINO stabilizes the p53 protein and guides the cells into cell death, preventing tumor development.

row.title: Structure of KRAS4b-PDEδ Complex
row.field_page_description: The structure of farnesylated, carboxymethylated KRAS4b protein complexed with its chaperone PDEδ has been solved.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a new RAS Dialogue, Dhirendra Simanshu describes how the structure of KRAS4b complexed with a chaperone illuminates a long-standing puzzle of cancer therapy.
row.field_list_description: The structure of fully modified KRAS4b protein complexed to its chaperone PDEδ has been solved. All the amino acids of KRAS4b are seen, including the entire HVR. The structure shows how PDEδ can bind both farnesylated and geranylgeranylated KRAS4b protein.

row.title: CDC Updates Recommendations on HPV Vaccine
row.field_short_title: CDC Updates Recommendations on HPV Vaccine
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about an updated CDC recommendation that those younger than age 15 need only two doses of the HPV vaccine instead of three.
row.field_feature_card_description: Two doses of the vaccine, instead of three, are recommended for those younger than age 15.
row.field_list_description: Updated CDC recommendations advise those younger than age 15 need only two doses of the HPV vaccine instead of three.

row.title: Device Uses Cancer Cells' Mass to Predict Response to Treatment
row.field_short_title: Device May Predict Cancer Treatment Response
row.field_page_description: A blog post on a study demonstrating the ability of a device, called a suspended microchannel resonator, to predict cancer cell death or growth following cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Measuring change in mass of cancer cells predicted whether the cells were sensitive or resistant to a particular drug.
row.field_list_description: Scientists have designed a device that measures the mass of single cancer cells to predict how cells respond to drug treatment. The technology could potentially help clinicians determine whether a drug effectively kills cancer cells.

row.title: Targeting the KRAS G12D Neoantigen to Treat Cancer
row.field_short_title: Targeting the KRAS G12D Neoantigen to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Steven A. Rosenberg and colleagues at the National Cancer Institute have treated a patient with metastatic colon cancer by using the patient's own cells to target the G12D mutation in KRAS.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a new RAS Dialogue, Jim Hartley of the NCI RAS Initiative describes an innovative treatment for cancers caused by the G12D mutation of KRAS.
row.field_list_description: The G12D mutation of the oncogene KRAS causes thousands of cancers every year. Steven Rosenberg and colleagues at the National Cancer Institute have treated a patient with metastatic colon cancer by using the patient's own cells to target KRAS G12D.

row.title: Identifying Novel Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_short_title: Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_page_description: A review of current research identifying and testing drug combination approaches that have the potential to overcome or delay resistance to cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Scientists are exploring drug combinations to overcome treatment resistance.
row.field_list_description: Drug resistance is a common occurrence that can lead to tumor relapse and patient death. Scientists are exploring combinations of different cancer drugs that have the potential to kill more cancer cells and overcome or delay drug resistance.

row.title: CGH Director strengthens research and control partnerships in Kenya
row.field_short_title: CGH Director strengthens research and control partnerships in Kenya
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Global Health director Edward Trimble met with Kenyan partners in December 2016 to increase engagement in cancer control strategy.
row.field_feature_card_description: Partners aim to increase coordination of Kenya cancer control strategy with MOU
row.field_list_description: Center for Global Health director Edward Trimble met with Kenyan partners and stakeholders in December 2016 to reiterate longer-term engagement to support national cancer control planning and expanded research capacity.

row.title: The Global Economic Burden of Tobacco: An Interview with Dr. Mark Parascandola
row.field_short_title: Economic Study of Global Tobacco Burden
row.field_page_description: In an interview on Cancer Currents, Dr. Mark Parascandola discusses findings from an economics study showing that, globally, tobacco use burdens economies with more than US $1 trillion annually in health care costs and lost productivity.
row.field_feature_card_description: Global cost of tobacco tops $1 trillion, but control strategies can be "highly cost effective," says NCI’s Dr. Mark Parascandola.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Dr. Mark Parascandola answers questions about The Economics of Tobacco and Tobacco Control, the latest in a series of monographs on tobacco use and tobacco control, which was co-written with the World Health Organization.

row.title: Democratizing Access to CCG Data: Cancer Genomics Cloud Pilots
row.field_page_description: The cloud pilots provide access to NCI data and computational resources in the cloud, enabling diverse researchers to advance precision oncology.
row.field_list_description: Big data is essential to cancer research. Yet as we collect more cancer data, we limit the number of researchers who can participate. By enabling access to NCI data and computational resources in the cloud, the cloud pilots contribute to a cancer data ecosystem that enables diverse researchers to advance precision oncology.

row.title: Avelumab Becomes First Approved Treatment for Patients with Merkel Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: Avelumab First Approved Drug for Rare Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s first-ever approval of a drug for the rare skin cancer Merkel cell carcinoma and updated data on patients’ tumor responses.
row.field_feature_card_description: Updated data show sustained tumor reductions in responding patients.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved the first drug ever for the rare skin cancer, Merkel cell carcinoma, and updated data show an improved tumor response rate and that patients’ tumors continued to respond for at least a year.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Blue Ribbon Panel Members
row.field_page_description: Information about the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel of experts. The panel was established to ensure the Cancer Moonshot's goals and approaches are grounded in the best science.
row.field_feature_card_description: Blue Ribbon Panel Members
row.field_list_description: To ensure that the Cancer Moonshot's goals and approaches are grounded in the best science, the Moonshot Task Force consulted with external experts, including the presidentially appointed National Cancer Advisory Board (NCAB). A Blue Ribbon Panel of experts was established as a working group of the NCAB to assist the board in providing this advice.

row.title: PARP Inhibitors May Be Effective in Brain, Other Cancers with IDH Mutations
row.field_short_title: PARP Inhibitors May Treat Cancers with IDH Mutations
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on studies that suggest brain and other cancers with an IDH mutation are susceptible to treatment with PARP inhibitors, such as olaparib.
row.field_feature_card_description: These drugs exploit a weakness caused by the mutation—the inability to repair DNA.
row.field_list_description: Studies presented at the 2017 AACR annual meeting suggest that therapies which take advantage of the mutations in the IDH gene may be more effective than drugs that block it.

row.title: Making Greater Progress Against Cancer—Not Just a Hope but a Reality
row.field_short_title: Making Greater Progress Against Cancer a Reality
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post from Acting NCI Director Dr. Doug Lowy on the recent Annual Report to the Nation and how NCI is promoting further progress against cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer trends are encouraging, says Acting NCI Director Dr. Doug Lowy.
row.field_list_description: Acting NCI Director Dr. Doug Lowy discusses what he calls encouraging news in the most recent Annual Report to the Nation and how NCI is helping to achieve further progress against cancer.

row.title: When Someone You Love Has Advanced Cancer: Support for Caregivers
row.field_short_title: When Someone You Love Has Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: Covers coping strategies and communication tips to address the concerns that cancer caregivers face when their loved one has been told that he or she has advanced cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers coping strategies and communication tips to address the concerns that cancer caregivers face when their loved one has been told that he or she has advanced cancer.

row.title: Treatment Choices for Men With Early-Stage Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Treatment Choices for Men With Early-Stage Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: Covers the treatment options for early-stage prostate cancer, such as active surveillance, surgery, and radiation therapy, and helps men decide which treatment is the best for them.
row.field_feature_card_description: Covers the treatment options for early-stage prostate cancer, such as active surveillance, surgery, and radiation therapy, and helps men decide which treatment is the best for them.

row.title: Talking with Your Health Care Team
row.field_short_title: Talking with Your Health Care Team
row.field_page_description: talking to your doctor, ask questions, take notes, ask about costs
row.field_feature_card_description: Tips to make it easier to talk with your doctors and learn about cancer and your treatment.
row.field_list_description: Tips to make it easier to talk with your doctors and learn about cancer and your treatment.

row.title: Self-Image and Sexuality
row.field_page_description: Cancer and its treatment can change how you look and feel about yourself. Learn to cope with body changes and issues related to sexuality and intimacy.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer can affect your looks and also how you feel about your body and physical intimacy. Here are steps to help you cope.
row.field_list_description: Cancer and its treatment can affect how you look and feel about yourself and your body. There are steps you can take to cope with body changes and issues related to sexuality and intimacy.

row.title: Going Back to Work
row.field_page_description: Information and guidance on going back to work, including talking with and relating to others at work, your legal rights, and handling problems at work.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information and guidance on going back to work, including talking with and relating to others at work, your legal rights, and handling problems at work.

row.title: A New Normal
row.field_page_description: Adjusting to physical and emotional changes after cancer treatment and tips on coping with fear of recurrence.
row.field_feature_card_description: Adjusting to physical and emotional changes after cancer treatment and tips on coping with fear of recurrence.

row.title: More Immunotherapy Options Approved for Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: More Immunotherapy Options Approved for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about the FDA approval of the checkpoint inhibitors atezolizumab and pembrolizumab for patients with the most common form of lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approvals include a new checkpoint inhibitor and expanded approval of another.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved atezolizumab and expanded the approval of pembrolizumab for some patients with non-small cell lung cancer.

row.title: Breast Changes and Conditions
row.field_page_description: Breast changes include benign conditions and those that increase the risk of breast cancer. Symptoms and treatment of breast conditions such as ADH, ALH, cysts, DCIS, and LCIS are explained to women who may have received an abnormal mammogram finding.
row.field_feature_card_description: Including changes that are benign (not cancer) and those that may increase a woman’s risk of cancer.
row.field_list_description: Breast changes and conditions such as adenosis, ADH, ALH, cysts, DCIS, duct ectasia, fat necrosis, fibrocystic breast changes, fibroadenomas, and LCIS are explained, together with information about how these conditions are found, diagnosed, and treated.

row.title: Feelings and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Ways to cope with your emotions and manage the emotional effects of cancer, including anger, fear, stress, and depression.
row.field_feature_card_description: Ways to cope with your emotions and manage the emotional effects of cancer, including anger, fear, stress, and depression.
row.field_list_description: Cancer can bring up a wide range of feelings, whether you're in treatment now, done with treatment, or a friend or family member. Learn tips for coping with the many emotions that arise with cancer.

row.title: Metabolomics Study Reveals another Energy Source for Cancer Cells
row.field_short_title: Study Reveals another Cancer Cell Energy Source
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on a study showing that, instead of discarding lactate, cancer cells can use it to fuel biochemical reactions, support their growth.
row.field_feature_card_description: Offers new insights into how cancer cells get energy to survive and grow.
row.field_list_description: Researchers have found that cancer cells can use the compound lactate to fuel biochemical reactions and to generate other compounds they need for growth and survival.

row.title: ‘Unexpected’ Vulnerability Creates Treatment Opportunity in Aggressive Type of Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: New Treatment Opportunity in Aggressive Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about a study that identified a way to target a key vulnerability in lung cancers that have mutations in the KRAS gene.
row.field_feature_card_description: Suggests potential treatment opportunity in cancers with KRAS mutations.
row.field_list_description: A new study has identified a potentially critical vulnerability in lung cancers that have mutations in the KRAS gene, and showed that a drug already under study may be able to exploit it.

row.title: Partnership in Cancer Control Planning Saves Lives
row.field_short_title: Partnership in Cancer Control Planning Saves Lives
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Global Health and partner Pink Ribbon Red Ribbon collaborate to reduce cervical and breast cancer in Zambia, Botswana, Ethiopia, and Tanzania.
row.field_feature_card_description: CGH helps control cervical and breast cancer in Sub-Saharan Africa.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Center for Global Health and partner Pink Ribbon Red Ribbon see success in large-scale training and collaboration efforts to address the growing burden of cervical and breast cancer in Zambia, Botswana, Ethiopia, and Tanzania.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ – Funding Opportunities
row.field_page_description: NCI is accepting applications for research grants that support the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel recommendations to accelerate cancer research.
row.field_feature_card_description: New opportunities announced for research grants that align with the goals of the Cancer Moonshot.
row.field_list_description: New Cancer Moonshot funding opportunities from NCI support goals articulated in the recommendations made by the Blue Ribbon Panel.

row.title: Interagency Oncology Task Force Fellowship
row.field_page_description: In collaboration with FDA, these fellowships train scientists in research and research-related regulatory review, policies, and regulations to develop a skill set that bridges the two disparate processes.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI and FDA train scientists in research and regulatory review.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Genetics
row.field_page_description: Genetics of specific cancers and inherited cancer syndromes, and ethical, legal, and social concerns.

row.title: Photodynamic Therapy for Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that explains photodynamic therapy, how it is administered, and indications and side effects of treatment.

row.title: Fluoridated Water
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that reviews research about the possibility of a connection between fluoridated water and cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet about the possibility of a connection between fluoridated water and cancer.

row.title: Family Issues after Treatment
row.field_page_description: Discusses common family problems and issues that often occur after treatment and ways to cope.
row.field_feature_card_description: Discusses common family problems and issues that often occur after treatment and ways to cope.

row.title: Caregiving after Treatment Ends
row.field_page_description: Even when treatment ends, both cancer survivors and caregivers are still dealing with a lot. Find information to help you understand and cope with the transition after cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Discusses the transition for cancer patients and caregivers after treatment and ways to cope.
row.field_list_description: Discusses the transition for cancer patients and caregivers after treatment and ways to cope.

row.title: Support for Teens When a Family Member has Cancer
row.field_short_title: Support for Teens When a Family Member has Cancer
row.field_page_description: When a parent, brother, or sister has been diagnosed with cancer, family members need extra support. Information to help teens learn how to cope, talk with family members, manage stress, and get support from counselors when a loved one has been diagnosed with, or is being treated for, cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: When a family member has cancer, everyone in the family needs support.
row.field_list_description: When a family member has cancer, whether it’s a parent or sibling, everyone in the family needs extra support.

row.title: For Some Breast Cancer Survivors, Drug May Reduce Treatment-Related Joint Pain
row.field_short_title: Drug Reduces Cancer Treatment-Related Joint Pain
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post about a clinical trial demonstrating that duloxetine (Cymbalta®) may reduce joint pain caused by aromatase inhibitors in women being treated for early-stage breast cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Drug helps with common side effect of standard breast cancer therapy.
row.field_list_description: Researchers have found that duloxetine (Cymbalta®), a drug most commonly used to treat depression, may also reduce joint pain caused by aromatase inhibitors in some women being treated for early-stage breast cancer.

row.title: Shifts Seen in Tobacco Product Types Purchased in US
row.field_short_title: Shifts Seen in Tobacco Product Types Purchased in US
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a new study showing shifts in the types of tobacco products purchased in the United States, including increased purchases of snuff and large cigars.
row.field_feature_card_description: U.S. consumers are purchasing fewer cigarettes and small cigars but more snuff and other tobacco products.
row.field_list_description: The consumption of cigarettes, small cigars, and chewing tobacco has declined over the past 15 years, according to a new study. These declines were partially offset by a rise in consumption of large cigars, pipe tobacco, and snuff.

row.title: Selected Publications by Dr. Doug Lowy
row.field_page_description: In these selected published articles, Douglas R. Lowy, M.D., Deputy Director of the National Cancer Institute (NCI), presents some of his work in cancer research.

row.title: Conditional Reprogramming: An Interview with Dr. Richard Schlegel on Growing Cancer Cells
row.field_short_title: Conditional Reprogramming to Grow Cancer Cells
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog featuring Dr. Richard Schlegel discussing conditional reprogramming, a new cell culture technique for rapidly growing normal and tumor cells.
row.field_feature_card_description: Conditional reprogramming can rapidly grow cultures of cancer cells from patients.
row.field_list_description: Dr. Richard Schlegel describes an innovative cell culture technique he helped to develop. Called conditional reprogramming, the technique can be used to rapidly establish cell cultures of normal and tumor cells from patient samples.

row.title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Bladder Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the clinical trial that led the FDA to approve nivolumab for bladder cancer and what the approval means for patients.
row.field_feature_card_description: FDA approval adds a new treatment option for patients whose cancer has progressed during or after initial treatment.
row.field_list_description: The FDA has approved nivolumab for the treatment of unresectable locally advanced or metastatic bladder cancer that worsened after treatment with platinum-based chemotherapy.

row.title: Center for Cancer Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics aims to transform the diagnosis and treatment of cancer through structural, functional, and computational genomics research, and the promotion of data sharing.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about CCG’s programs and collaborations, which study the molecular basis of cancer through structural, functional, and computational genomics research.
row.field_list_description: CCG studies cancer through structural, functional, and computational genomics, and promotes data sharing. The Genome Characterization Pipeline transforms tissue samples into rich, publicly available data that fuel innovation by the research community.

row.title: Researchers Use CRISPR Gene-Editing Tool to Help Turn Immune Cells against Tumors
row.field_short_title: CRISPR Gene-Editing Tool May Help Improve Cancer Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog about using the CRISPR gene-editing technology to genetically engineered immune cells and improve the ability of these cells to kill cancer cells in mice.
row.field_feature_card_description: The gene-editing tool improved the ability of immune cells to kill cancer cells in mice.
row.field_list_description: Using a new tool for editing genomes, known as CRISPR, researchers have genetically engineered immune cells and improved the ability of these cells to kill cancer cells in mice.

row.title: Clinical Trial Results - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on practice-changing cancer clinical trials—including trials of targeted therapies, immunotherapies, and prevention drugs—from NCI Cancer Currents.
row.field_feature_card_description: Blog posts from NCI Cancer Currents on practice-changing cancer clinical trials.

row.title: ROS1+ Cancer Patients Partner to Increase Research
row.field_page_description: ROS1ders, a group of lung cancer patients who share a rare genetic abnormality, united to promote research by foundations, academics, and industry.
row.field_feature_card_description: Meet the ROS1ders, a group of lung cancer patients with a rare gene fusion who have united to promote lifesaving research.
row.field_list_description: ROS1ders, a group of lung cancer patients who share a rare genetic abnormality involving the ROS1 gene, united to support each other and promote research. They formed the Global ROS1 Initiative, a collaboration between foundations, academic researchers, and industry that aims to improve outcomes for future patients.

row.title: Biomarker Test Could Reduce Unnecessary Biopsies to Detect Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Test Could Reduce Unnecessary Prostate Biopsies
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study showing that two biomarkers in urine may help identify who does and doesn’t need a biopsy to detect a suspected prostate cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Biomarkers in urine could help identify men with suspected prostate cancer.
row.field_list_description: Findings from a new study show testing for two biomarkers in urine may help some men avoid an unnecessary biopsy to detect a suspected prostate cancer.

row.title: Trastuzumab Emtansine Improves Survival in Previously Treated Metastatic HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Trastuzumab Emtansine for HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on results from the TH3RESA and EMILIA clinical trials showing trastuzumab emtansine (T-DM1) improved overall survival in patients with previously treated metastatic HER2-positive breast cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Benefit seen even in patients previously treated with other HER2-targeted drugs.
row.field_list_description: Two clinical trials show that trastuzumab emtansine (T-DM1) improves survival compared with other standard treatments for patients with HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer that has progressed after treatment with other HER2-targeted drugs.

row.title: Disease Dynamic Trial Listing Page
FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Tumors with Specific Genetic Features
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab Approved for Tumors with Specific Genetic Features
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on FDA’s approval of pembrolizumab for patients with mismatch repair deficient and microsatellite instability high tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Pembrolizumab is approved for mismatch repair deficient and microsatellite instability high tumors.
row.field_list_description: FDA approved pembrolizumab for patients with solid tumors that have specific genetic features, called mismatch repair deficiency and high microsatellite instability. This is the first approval based on a genetic feature, rather than cancer type.

row.title: Introducing DAVE: Online Analysis Tools for the Genomic Data Commons
row.field_short_title: DAVE Provides New Tools for Genomic Data Commons
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post from NCI’s Dr. Louis Staudt about the release of an online, open-access cancer research resource for the Genomic Data Commons called DAVE.
row.field_feature_card_description: Online, open-access resource provides broad access to genomic analysis tools.
row.field_list_description: NCI has released an online, open-access cancer research resource for the Genomic Data Commons called the Data Analysis, Visualization, and Exploration Tools, or DAVE.

row.title: Promoting Cancer Control in Indonesia
row.field_page_description: CGH's Kalina Duncan travels to Indonesia on detail with the Ministry of Health this past spring to address important global issues of cancer control and cancer research.

row.title: Strong Inorganic Acid Mists Containing Sulfuric Acid
row.field_short_title: Strong Inorganic Acid Mists Containing Sulfuric Acid
row.field_page_description: Copper smelting and other manufacturing processes generate strong inorganic acid mists that can increase your risk of laryngeal and lung cancers.

row.title: NCI Program Supports Small Businesses to Advance Cancer Research Innovation – A Q&A with Michael Weingarten
row.field_short_title: Supporting Small Business to Drive Cancer Research Innovation
row.field_page_description: NCI’s SBIR program is offering funding to help small businesses develop innovative cancer-related therapies and technologies, including those prioritized by the Cancer Moonshot.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is offering funds to spur the development of new cancer therapies and technologies.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Small Business Innovation Research Program recently issued contract solicitations to spur the development of new cancer-related therapies and technologies, including seven opportunities specific to the Cancer Moonshot.

row.title: Gallbladder Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Gallbladder cancer is a rare cancer that is usually diagnosed late due a to lack of early signs and symptoms. It is sometimes found when the gallbladder is checked for gallstones or removed. Start here to find information on gallbladder cancer treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about gallbladder cancer.

row.title: Cancers by Body Location/System
row.field_page_description: A list of all cancers, organized by location and/or function in the body. Cancers on the list are linked to information about treatment, supportive care, screening, prevention, clinical trials, and other topics.

row.title: Skin Cancer (Including Melanoma)—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Skin cancer is the most common type of cancer. The main types of skin cancer are squamous cell carcinoma, basal cell carcinoma, and melanoma. Most deaths from skin cancer are caused by melanoma. Start here to find information on skin cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: Information about skin cancer treatment, prevention, causes, screening, clinical trials, research, and other topics from the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: Cabozantinib Approval Expands Initial Treatment Options for Advanced Kidney Cancer
row.field_short_title: Cabozantinib for Initial Treatment of Kidney Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved cabozantinib (Cabometyx®) as an initial treatment for patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma. The approval adds another tyrosine kinase inhibitor to the available options for patients with advanced kidney cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Cabozantinib (Cabometyx®) is approved for the initial treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma.
